scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' as melancholy is rendered literally as 'splène'; 'grim about the mouth' becomes 'sombre aux lèvres'). The archaic, contemplative tone of Melville's original is diminished by more modern phrasing and awkward constructions like 'une manière dont je me débrouille' that lack the philosophical weight of the source.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine Tatsache, die universell anerkannt wird, dass ein unverheirateter Mann mit einem guten Vermögen unbedingt eine Frau benötigt. Wie wenig die Gefühle oder Ansichten eines solchen Mannes bei seinem ersten Eintreten in eine Nachbarschaft bekannt sein mögen, so fest ist diese Wahrheit in den Köpfen der umgebenden Familien verankert, dass er als das rechtmäßige Eigentum einer ihrer Töchter angesehen wird.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice through overly literal phrasing ('Tatsache, die universell anerkannt wird' vs. the elegant 'truth universally acknowledged'). The prose reads stiffly and academic rather than maintaining the original's witty, conversational tone.

results.translated_text: Das Studierzimmer war von dem intensiven Geruch der Rosen erfüllt. Als der leichte Sommerwind durch die Bäume des Gartens rauschte, drang durch die offene Tür den schweren Geruch des Lilacs oder den feineren Duft des rosa blühenden Dorns. Aus der Ecke des aus persischen Satteltaschen gefertigten Divans, auf dem er lag und, wie es ihm gewohnt war, unzählige Zigaretten rauchte, konnte Lord Henry Wotton nur den Schimmer der honigschönen und honigfarbenen Blüten des Laburnums erkennen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meanings accurately but has grammatical issues ("drang durch die offene Tür den schweren Geruch" is awkward; should be "drang...der schwere Geruch"). The aesthetic sensibility is mostly preserved, though the prose feels somewhat stilted compared to Wilde's flowing elegance, and "honigschöne" is an unusual construction that disrupts the lyrical quality.

results.translated_text: Ich erkenne, dass du in Afghanistan gewesen bist. „Wie hast du das überhaupt wissen können?“, fragte ich erstaunt. „Nichts“, sagte er, lachend vor sich hin. „Die aktuelle Frage dreht sich nun um Hämoglobin. Du erkennst zweifellos die Bedeutung dieser Entdeckung?“ „Chemisch ist es zweifellos interessant“, antwortete ich, „aber praktisch—“ „Warum, mein Freund, es ist die praktischste medizinisch-rechtliche Entdeckung der letzten Jahre. Siehst du nicht, dass es uns ein unfehlbares Testverfahren für Blutspuren bietet?“

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has notable issues: 'Nichts' for 'Never mind' is incorrect (should be 'Egal' or 'Macht nichts'), and the opening lacks proper dialogue attribution. The tone shifts from Victorian formality to modern German, and some phrasing feels awkward ('lachend vor sich hin' is acceptable but 'chuckling to himself' has subtler connotations). The medico-legal terminology is well-handled, but overall fluency suffers from occasional stiffness.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich absichtsvoll leben wollte, nur die wesentlichen Tatsachen des Lebens konfrontieren und herausfinden, was es zu lehren hatte – und nicht bei meinem Tod erkennen sollte, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht leben, was nicht Leben war, denn Leben ist so kostbar; ich wollte auch keine Resignation üben, es sei denn, sie wäre vollkommen notwendig. Ich wollte tief und gründlich leben und das gesamte Knochenmark des Lebens aussaugen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings accurately, with 'kostbar' effectively conveying 'dear' and 'Knochenmark' preserving the vivid marrow metaphor. Minor fluency issues include the awkward phrasing 'konfrontieren und herausfinden' (confront and find out) which doesn't flow as naturally as the original, and 'gründlich' adds an unnecessary modifier to 'live deep.'

results.translated_text: Ich heiße Ishmael. Einige Jahre her – es ist nicht wichtig, wie lange genau – hatte ich kaum Geld in meiner Geldbörse und nichts, was mich besonders an Land interessierte. Ich dachte, ich würde ein bisschen segeln und den wassergebundenen Teil der Welt erkunden. Es ist eine Art, um die Anspannung abzubauen und den Blutkreislauf zu regulieren. Jedemal, wenn ich mich zu einem grimmigen Mund entwickle; wenn es in meiner Seele ein nasses, regnerisches November ist, halte ich es für höchste Zeit, so bald wie möglich ins Meer zu segeln.

scores.feedback: The translation loses significant nuance and archaic tone; phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become 'Anspannung abbauen' (reducing tension), and 'growing grim about the mouth' is awkwardly rendered as 'zu einem grimmigen Mund entwickle' (develop into a grim mouth). The poetic, introspective voice is flattened into more literal, modern German, failing to capture Melville's distinctive philosophical tone and period style.

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero con una buena fortuna debe necesitar una esposa. Aunque los sentimientos o opiniones de tal hombre puedan ser poco conocidos al llegar por primera vez a un barrio, esta verdad está tan bien establecida en las mentes de las familias circundantes que se considera como la propiedad legítima de alguna de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures the ironic social commentary, though 'debe necesitar' is slightly awkward compared to 'must be in want of,' and the formal tone could be more elegantly rendered to better match Austen's distinctive narrative voice and ironic wit.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba lleno del rico aroma de las rosas, y cuando el ligero viento de verano agitaba entre los árboles del jardín, se filtraba a través de la puerta abierta el intenso olor del lilac, o el más delicado perfume de las flores rosadas de la espina. Desde el rincón del diván de bolsas persas en el que se encontraba acostado, fumando como solía, incontables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton apenas lograba captar el brillo de las flores de laburno dulces como miel y de color miel.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'lilac' remains untranslated and 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes slightly awkward as 'flores rosadas de la espina.' The sensory richness is mostly maintained, but some poetic flow is lost in the restructured syntax, particularly in the final clause about the laburnum blossoms.

results.translated_text: "Percibo que has estado en Afganistán". "¿Cómo es que lo sabías?" pregunté asombrado. "No importa", dijo riéndose para sí mismo. "Ahora la cuestión es la hemoglobina. ¿No ves la importancia de este descubrimiento mío?" "Es interesante químicamente, sin duda", respondí, "pero prácticamente—". "¿Por qué, hombre, es el descubrimiento medico-legal más práctico en los últimos años? ¿No ves que nos da una prueba infalible para las manchas de sangre?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and preserves the dialogue's investigative tone, though some phrasing feels slightly awkward (e.g., '¿Por qué, hombre' is an unusual construction in Spanish). Minor improvements in natural flow would enhance readability while maintaining the Victorian-era formality.

results.translated_text: Fui a los bosques porque deseaba vivir deliberadamente, enfrentar solamente los hechos esenciales de la vida y ver si no podía aprender lo que tenía que enseñar, y no descubrir que, cuando llegara a morir, no había vivido. No deseaba vivir lo que no fuera vida; vivir es tan precioso; ni deseaba practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera completamente necesaria. Quería vivir profundamente y extraer toda la médula de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential intensity very well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately,' 'essential facts,' and the vivid 'suck out all the marrow.' Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward word order in the conditional clause ('cuando llegara a morir, no había vivido') and 'practicar la resignación' which feels slightly formal compared to the original's natural rhythm.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ishmael. Hace algunos años—no importa cuánto tiempo exactamente—teniendo pocos o ningún dinero en mi billetera y nada particular que me interesara en tierra firme, me dije que navegaría un poco y vería la parte acuática del mundo. Es una manera que tengo de liberar el bazo y regular la circulación. Cuando me siento cada vez más tenso; cuando en mi alma es un noviembre húmedo y llovioso, considero que es hora de ir al mar lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuances: 'driving off the spleen' becomes 'liberar el bazo' (literally 'free the spleen') rather than the idiomatic melancholic sense; 'billetera' (wallet) is too modern for the archaic tone; 'teniendo pocos o ningún dinero' is awkward compared to the original's flow; and the poetic, meditative quality of Melville's prose is diminished by more literal, contemporary phrasing throughout.

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che un uomo singolo in possesso di una buona fortuna debba essere in cerca di una moglie. Tuttavia, quanto meno i sentimenti o le opinioni di tale uomo siano conosciuti al suo primo ingresso in un quartiere, questa verità è così ben fissata nelle menti delle famiglie circostanti, che viene considerato come la proprietà legittima di una o l'altra delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and famous opening of Pride and Prejudice, preserving the ironic tone and structure. However, some phrasing feels slightly awkward ('quanto meno i sentimenti' is grammatically correct but less elegant than the original's flow), and minor word choices ('quartiere' for 'neighbourhood' is less precise than 'vicinato') slightly diminish the literary polish of Austen's prose.

results.translated_text: La stanza era riempita da un profumo intenso di rose, e quando il leggero vento estivo si mosse tra gli alberi del giardino, attraverso la porta aperta arrivava l'odore pesante di lillà o il profumo più delicato dei fiori rosa di una spina. Da un angolo del divano di sacchi persiani, su cui si trovava disteso e fumando innumerevoli sigarette come era suo abitudine, Lord Henry Wotton riusciva a vedere appena la luce dei fiori gialli dolci e dorati di un laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately but loses some aesthetic nuance—'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes merely 'gialli dolci e dorati' (yellow sweet and golden), flattening Wilde's poetic repetition. The syntax is generally natural in Italian, though the long final clause feels slightly awkward compared to the original's flowing rhythm.

results.translated_text: Mi sembra che tu abbia stato in Afghanistan. "Come hai potuto sapere questo?" chiesi, sorpreso. "Non importa," sghignazzò lui per sé. "Ora la questione è l'emoglobina. Non c'è dubbio che tu veda l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?" "È interessante dal punto di vista chimico, non c'è dubbio," risposi, "ma praticamente—" "Perché, uomo, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non vedi che ci dà un test infallibile per le macchie di sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning but contains grammatical errors ('tu abbia stato' is incorrect; should be 'sei stato') and awkward phrasing ('sghignazzò lui per sé' is unnatural). The tone shifts from Holmes's characteristic deduction to more colloquial Italian, losing some of the Victorian formality and intellectual precision of the original.

results.translated_text: Sono andato nella foresta perché volevo vivere deliberatamente, affrontare soltanto i fatti essenziali della vita e vedere se non potessi imparare cosa avesse da insegnare, e non scoprire, quando sarei morto, che non avevo vissuto. Non volevo vivere ciò che non era vita, poiché vivere è così caro; né volevo praticare la resa a meno che non fosse assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere profondamente e trarre tutta l'essenza della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with only minor deviations. 'Trarre tutta l'essenza della vita' captures the essence of 'suck out all the marrow' reasonably well, though the visceral intensity of the original metaphor is slightly softened; the formal register and contemplative tone are well-maintained throughout.

results.translated_text: Chiamami Ishmael. Diversi anni fa—non importa quanto esattamente—avendo poco o nessun denaro nel portafoglio e nulla di particolare che mi interessasse a terra, pensavo di fare un piccolo giro in mare per vedere la parte acquatica del mondo. È un modo che ho per svuotare lo spleen e regolare la circolazione. Quando mi sento diventare grigio in bocca; quando nel mio animo è un novembre umido e pioggioso, considero che sia il momento giusto per andare a mare il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but loses some nuance and archaic tone. 'Diventare grigio in bocca' is awkward for 'growing grim about the mouth,' and 'svuotare lo spleen' misses the idiomatic sense of 'driving off.' The formal register is somewhat preserved but the poetic, melancholic voice of the original is diminished.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente aceita que um homem solteiro em posse de uma fortuna precisa necessariamente de uma esposa. No entanto, quanto menos conhecidos os sentimentos ou opiniões desse homem ao entrar em um bairro pela primeira vez, essa verdade está tão bem fixada nas mentes das famílias vizinhas que ele é considerado como pertencente a uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Austen's ironic opening, though 'precisa necessariamente de' is slightly more direct than the original's subtle irony. The prose flows reasonably well in Portuguese but lacks some of the elegant cadence and formal register of the original English.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava cheio do cheiro intenso das rosas. Quando o vento leve de verão agitava as árvores do jardim, o cheiro pesado do lilá ou o perfume mais delicado das flores rosadas do espinho passava pela porta aberta. Do canto do divan de bolsas de cavalo persas em que ele estava deitado, fumando como era seu hábito inúmeras cigarros, Lord Henry Wotton conseguia apenas captar o brilho das flores de laburno doces como mel e de cor de mel.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning but loses some aesthetic nuance; 'cheiro intenso' is less evocative than 'rich odour,' and the sensory flow is disrupted by awkward phrasing like 'bolsas de cavalo persas' and the clunky construction 'inúmeras cigarros' (should be 'inúmeros cigarros'). The poetic rhythm and Wilde's characteristic elegance are diminished.

results.translated_text:
"Percebo que você esteve no Afeganistão."
"Como é que você sabia disso?" perguntei, surpreso.
"Não importa," disse ele, rindo para si mesmo.
"A questão agora é sobre a hemoglobina."
"Não duvido que você veja a importância desta descoberta minha?"
"É interessante, quimicamente, sem dúvida," respondi, "mas praticamente—"
"Por que, homem, é a descoberta medicolegal mais prática dos últimos anos. Você não vê que isso nos dá um teste infalível para manchas sanguíneas?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has notable issues: 'Não duvido que' incorrectly suggests doubt rather than confidence, and 'descoberta minha' is awkward Portuguese word order. The dialogue reads somewhat stiffly and loses the natural Victorian conversational flow of the original, particularly in Holmes's characteristic deductive manner and Watson's astonishment.

results.translated_text: Fui para a floresta porque queria viver deliberadamente, enfrentar apenas os fatos essenciais da vida e ver se não podia aprender o que ela tinha de ensinar, sem descobrir, ao morrer, que não havia vivido. Não queria viver o que não era vida; viver é tão precioso; nem queria praticar a resignação, a menos que fosse muito necessária. Queria viver profundamente e extrair toda a medula da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency with high fidelity, though the phrase 'extrair toda a medula' is slightly less evocative than the original 'suck out all the marrow.' The prose flows naturally in Portuguese with minor stylistic adjustments that are appropriate for the target language.

results.translated_text: Chame-me Ishmael. Alguns anos atrás — não importa exatamente quantos anos — tendo poucos ou nenhum dinheiro no meu bolso e nada particular que me interessasse na terra, eu pensava em navegar um pouco e ver a parte aquática do mundo. É uma maneira que tenho de descarregar a raiva e regular a circulação sanguínea. Quando me sinto cada vez mais irritado; quando é um novembro úmido e chuvoso em minha alma, considero que é hora de ir ao mar o mais cedo possível.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses significant nuance: 'spleen' becomes 'raiva' (anger) rather than the melancholic/philosophical sense intended, and the archaic, contemplative tone is diminished by more modern phrasing like 'considero que é hora' instead of a more literary construction. The fluency is hindered by awkward constructions like 'parte aquática' and the loss of Melville's distinctive voice.

results.translated_text: To jest prawda uniwersalnie uznawana: mężczyzna posiadający bogaty majątek musi potrzebować żony. Chociaż jego uczucia lub poglądy mogą być zupełnie nieznane w momencie pierwszego wejścia do sąsiedztwa, ta prawda jest w myślach sąsiadujących rodzin tak dobrze zakotwiczone, że jest uznawany za własność jednej z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone about marriage expectations, though some phrasing feels slightly stiff compared to the original's elegant flow. Minor word choices like 'zakotwiczone' (anchored) work well, but the overall rhythm lacks the sophisticated naturalness of Austen's prose.

results.translated_text: Studiów był pełen bogatego zapachu róż, a kiedy łagodny letni wiatr poruszał się wśród drzew ogrodu, przez otwarte drzwi dobiegł ciężki zapach lilaców lub bardziej delikatny parfum różowocznego drzewa z ostrymi gałkami. Z rogu divana z perskich kieszeni, na którym leżał i paląc nieskończenie wiele papierosów, jak zwykle, Lord Henry Wotton mógł tylko zauważyć blask miodowych i miodowoczerwonych kwiatów laburnu.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors that undermine both meaning and readability: 'Studiów był pełen' is grammatically incorrect (should be 'Studio było pełne'), 'perskich kieszeni' misrepresents 'Persian saddle-bags,' and 'różowocznego drzewa z ostrymi gałkami' incorrectly translates 'pink-flowering thorn.' The sensory richness and aesthetic elegance of Wilde's prose are lost through awkward phrasing and mistranslations that obscure the original's lyrical quality.

results.translated_text: Zauważam, że byłeś w Afganistanie. „Jak to możliwe, jak to wiedziałeś?” – pytałem z zdziwieniem. „Niech to będzie”, uśmiechając się samemu powiedział. „Teraz pytanie dotyczy hemoglobiny. Nie wątpię, że zauważasz znaczenie tego mojego odkrycia?” „Chemicznie jest to interesujące, nie wątpię,” odpowiedziałem, „ale praktycznie—” „Dlaczego, człowieku, to najpraktyczniejsze odkrycie medyczno-prawne w ciągu lat. Nie widzisz, że daje nam niewątpliwy test na ślady krwi?”

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has several issues: 'Niech to będzie' is awkward for 'Never mind,' 'uśmiechając się samemu' is unclear, and 'w ciągu lat' (during years) misses 'for years.' The dialogue feels stilted and less natural than the original Victorian English, with some phrasing that doesn't flow smoothly in Polish.

results.translated_text: Poszedłem do lasów, ponieważ chciałem żyć celowo, skupić się wyłącznie na najważniejszych faktach życia i sprawdzić, czy nie mógłbym nauczyć się tego, co miało nauczyć, by nie odkryć, że kiedy zmarę, nie żyłem. Nie chciałem żyć tym, co nie było życiem, bo życie jest tak cenne; ani nie chciałem praktykować rezignacji, chyba że było to całkowicie konieczne. Chciałem żyć głębiej i wydusić całą esencję życia.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but contains awkward constructions ('nauczyć się tego, co miało nauczyć' is confusing) and loses some philosophical elegance. 'Wydusić' (squeeze out) is less poetic than the original 'suck out all the marrow,' and the overall rhythm feels stilted compared to Thoreau's flowing prose.

results.translated_text: Nazywam się Ishmael. Kilka lat temu – niech to będzie ilekolwiek czasu – miałem niewielką ilość pieniędzy lub brak w kieszeni, a nic, co mogłoby mnie zainteresować na brzegu. Pomyślałem, że płynę trochę po morzu, by zobaczyć wodną część świata. To jest sposób, w jaki wyciszę napięcia i reguluję krążenie. Kiedy zaczynam się zimno w ustach, kiedy w mojej duszy jest mokry, deszczowy listopad, uznaję, że to już czas, by jak najszybciej pójść na morze.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative but contains significant errors: 'Call me Ishmael' becomes an awkward 'Nazywam się Ishmael' (I am named), 'zimno w ustach' (cold in mouth) misses the idiom entirely, and 'pójść na morze' (go to sea) should be 'popłynąć' (sail). The archaic, meditative tone is largely lost, replaced by stilted phrasing that reads more like a literal word-for-word rendering than natural Polish prose.

results.translated_text: 世人皆知，凡是有富有的单身男子，必定需要一位妻子。尽管他初入邻里时的见解或情感如何鲜为人知，但此理早已根深蒂固于周围各户的头脑之中，因此他必将成为某位女儿的正当归属。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning and ironic tone effectively, preserving Austen's satirical commentary on marriage customs. Minor fluency issues with slightly formal phrasing ('见解或情感如何鲜为人知') detract slightly from the natural flow, though the overall style and structure remain faithful to the original.

results.translated_text: 工作室里弥漫着玫瑰的浓郁香气。当夏日微风轻拂花园树丛时，透过敞开的门扉，紫丁香的浓烈芬芳与粉红刺槐的细腻幽香便悄然沁入。他躺在波斯风格的沙发一角，习惯性地抽着无数支香烟，隐约可见金缕梅蜜甜蜜黄的花朵泛着微光。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most sensory details and maintains the aesthetic focus, but contains minor inaccuracies: 'pink-flowering thorn' is rendered as '粉红刺槐' (acacia) rather than hawthorn, and 'laburnum' becomes '金缕梅' (witch hazel) instead of the correct golden chain tree. The prose reads naturally in Chinese but loses some of Wilde's flowing, luxurious cadence and the delicate gradation between scent intensities.

results.translated_text:
“我察觉你去过阿富汗。”  
“你到底是怎么知道的？”我惊讶地问道。  
“算了，”他轻笑一声，“现在的问题是血红蛋白。你肯定看出了我这个发现的意义吧？”  
“化学上确实有趣，”我回答道，“但实际应用——”  
“天哪，伙计，这可是近年来最实用的法医发现。你没看见它能给我们一种绝对可靠的血迹检测方法吗？”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's investigative tone, though 'Never mind' becomes '算了' (forget it) which slightly softens Holmes's dismissive attitude. The Chinese flows naturally and captures the character dynamics well, though some Victorian formality is lost in the colloquial phrasing.

results.translated_text: 我前往森林，是希望有意识地生活，只聚焦于生命的本质，探求它能给予的智慧，以免在临终时惊觉自己从未真正活过。我并不愿过不真实的生活，因为活着本身如此珍贵；亦不希望轻易放弃，除非万不得已。我渴望深入生活，彻底汲取生命的精髓。

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings with strong fidelity, though 'practice resignation' becomes 'lightly give up' which slightly shifts the original's nuance of accepting hardship. The prose flows naturally in Chinese with appropriate formality, and the meditative, earnest tone is well-preserved through careful word choices like '珍贵' and '精髓.'

results.translated_text: 我自称伊摩。数年前——具体是多久，我也不必在意——我的口袋里几乎没钱，岸上也没什么能吸引我的事，于是我想着四处航行一番，看看这水的世界。这便是我排解郁结、调节气血的一种方式。每当我的眉头紧锁，或我的灵魂中弥漫着阴雨连绵的十一月，我便觉得该立刻出海，尽速启程。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' as melancholy becomes generic '郁结', 'regulating circulation' becomes literal '调节气血'). The archaic, contemplative tone is partially preserved but the Chinese reads somewhat awkwardly with phrases like '我自称伊摩' and '这水的世界' that feel unnatural compared to Melville's flowing, introspective voice.

results.translated_text: 世人皆知，有財產之單身男子必當娶妻。無論其初入鄰里時性情與觀點如何不為人所知，此真理早已深植於周圍家族之心，以致於他必被視為其女兒中某一位之正當歸屬。

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures Austen's meaning and ironic tone, preserving the satirical commentary on marriage conventions. The language is appropriately formal and classical in style, though the sentence structure is somewhat dense and could flow more naturally in modern Chinese.

results.translated_text: 工作室內瀰漫著濃厚的玫瑰香氣，當輕柔的夏日微風拂過園中樹木，透過敞開的門扉，便傳來紫丁香濃重的香氣，或是更細膩的粉花刺幽香。他平躺於波斯鞍袋製成的低矮絨榻一角，習慣性地吸著無數香煙，從那兒恰好瞥見一株金鏈花開滿的枝頭，那蜜甜蜜黃的花朵在微風中閃爍著輕盈的光暈。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic sensibility of Wilde's prose effectively, with accurate rendering of botanical details and atmospheric description. Minor fluency issues in the final clause and slight compression of the original's leisurely pacing prevent a higher score.

results.translated_text: 我察覺你已去過阿富汗了。"你怎麼知道的？"我驚訝地問。"算了。"他輕笑著自語道。"現在我們要談的，是血紅蛋白。"難道你沒看出這項發現的重大意義嗎？"我回應道："從化學角度來看，確實有趣，但實際上—"老天，這可是近年來最實用的法醫學發現！你沒發現它能給我們一種絕對準確的血跡檢測方法嗎？

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and preserves Holmes's deductive brilliance and the dialogue's logical progression. Minor issues include slight punctuation inconsistencies and a few phrasings that could flow more naturally in Chinese, though the overall sense and character voice remain intact.

results.translated_text: 我入山林，乃為有意地生活，直面生命本真，探求其教導，以免臨終時驚覺自己未曾真正活過。我亦不願過非生命之生活，因生命至為珍貴；亦不願行退讓之志，除非實屬必要。我願深入生活，汲取生命精粹。

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency, with excellent rendering of key concepts like 'live deliberately' (有意地生活) and 'essential facts' (生命本真). Minor fluency issues include slightly archaic phrasing ('行退讓之志') that, while stylistically appropriate, reads less naturally than the original's conversational tone.

results.translated_text: 我名伊沙美爾。幾年前——時間長短無須細究——錢袋空空，岸上亦無足為興趣之事，我便想出海遊歷一番，看看這片海洋。這是我排解心鬱、調暢氣血的方式。每當我心中漸漸鬱結，口氣變冷；每當靈魂中浸透濕冷陰雨連綿的十一月，我便認為該即刻出海。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning and archaic tone well, with appropriate classical Chinese phrasing that mirrors Melville's style. Minor issues include slight awkwardness in 'mouth' becoming 'cold air/demeanor' and some phrasing that could flow more naturally, but overall it successfully conveys the introspective, melancholic voice of the original.

results.translated_text: 豊かな財産を持つ独身男性は、必ず妻を必要とするという事実が世界中で認められている。その男性が初めて近所に入り始めた時の感情や考えがどれほど不明確であっても、この事実が周囲の家族の心に深く根付いているため、彼はその家族のいずれかの娘の適切な夫と見なされる。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice and the elegant paradox of the opening. The phrase 'rightful property' becomes 'appropriate husband,' softening the satirical edge, and the prose feels more literal and less flowing than the original's rhythmic irony.

results.translated_text: 部屋にはローズの濃い香りが満ちていた。夏の薄い風が庭の木々を揺らすと、開いているドアからラリカの重い香り、あるいはピンクの花を咲かせる棘の木のより繊細な香りが漂い始めた。彼はペルシャ風のサドルバッグで作られたダイブンの隅に横たわって、いつも通り無数のタバコを吸いながら、ラブンの蜂蜜色で蜂蜜のように甘い花の輝きをわずかに見ることができた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant errors: 'ラリカ' (rarrika) appears to be a mistranslation of 'lilac,' 'ダイブン' (daibun) is incorrect for 'divan,' and the sentence structure becomes convoluted, particularly in the final clause, losing the elegant flow of Wilde's aesthetic prose. The sensory richness is diminished by awkward phrasing and terminology choices.

results.translated_text:
「アフガニスタンにいたと推測している。」  
「どうやって知ったのだろうか？」と驚きながら尋ねた。  
「気にするな」と自分を笑いながら言った。  
「今、問題はヘモグロビンについてだ。」  
「間違いなく、この発見の意義を理解しているだろうか？」  
「化学的には確かに興味深いが、実際には—」  
「えっ、ここ数年で最も実用的な医療法的発見だ。血跡の検出に絶対的に正確な試験法を提供するのを見ないか？」

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic plot points but suffers from awkward phrasing, grammatical issues, and loss of conversational naturalness. Key problems include unnatural dialogue flow, incorrect verb conjugations (「推測している」should be 「推測する」), and the failure to preserve Holmes's characteristic deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment.

results.translated_text: 私は森林へ赴いたのは、意図的に生き、人生の本質的な事実にのみ向き合い、その教えを学べるかを試み、死ぬ際には生きられなかったと気づかないようにするためだった。生きる価値のないものを生きることを望んでいなかった。生きることは非常に貴重であり、必要でない限り諦めを実践することも望んでいなかった。私は深く生き、人生の骨髄を全て吸い出すことを望んでいた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical meaning and core ideas effectively, though some nuances of Thoreau's rhythmic prose are lost. The Japanese reads somewhat formally and occasionally awkwardly (e.g., 「生きる価値のないものを生きることを望んでいなかった」), where more natural phrasing could enhance fluency while maintaining the meditative tone.

results.translated_text: 私をイシャマエルと呼んでください。数年前、正確な期間は気にしないで、財布にほとんどお金がなく、岸で興味を持つものがほとんどない状況だったので、私は少し海を旅して世界の水の部分を観察することにしました。これは、心の鬱を解消し、体の循環を整える方法です。口が険しくなる時や、心が湿り気のある11月の雨の日であると感じる時、できるだけ早く海へ出るべきだと考えます。

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuance and literary power. Key issues include awkward phrasing ('世界の水の部分を観察する' is clunky), failure to preserve Melville's introspective tone, and poor rendering of metaphorical language ('心が湿り気のある11月の雨の日' misses the poetic melancholy of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul'). The archaic, contemplative style is largely flattened into modern, prosaic Japanese.

results.translated_text: 모든 사람들이 인정하는 진리입니다. 부유한 재산을 가진 남자는 반드시 결혼을 해야 한다는 사실입니다. 그러나 그 남자가 처음으로 특정 지역에 들어서는 순간, 그의 감정이나 견해가 얼마나 알려지지 않았는지에 관계없이, 이 진리는 주변 가족들 모두가 마음속에 매우 고정시켜 놓은 사실이기 때문에, 그 남자는 그들의 딸 중 한 명에게 속해 있는 것으로 간주됩니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's iconic ironic tone through overly literal phrasing and awkward sentence structure. The famous opening's satirical bite is diminished by breaking it into separate declarative statements rather than maintaining the original's flowing, ironic cadence.

results.translated_text: 스튜디오에는 장미의 풍부한 향기가 가득 차 있었고, 정원의 나무들 사이에서 흐르는 가벼운 여름 바람이 불 때 열린 문을 통해 진달래의 무거운 향기나 핑크 꽃을 피우는 매의 더 미묘한 향기가 스며들었다. 그는 페르시아 양식의 디바 위에서 수없이 많은 담배를 피우고 있는 그 모서리에서 라브나무의 벌꿀처럼 달콤하고 벌꿀처럼 노란색인 꽃의 반짝임을 잠시 보았다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: '진달래' (azalea) is incorrect for 'lilac', '매' (hawk) is wrong for 'thorn', and the sensory richness is diminished by awkward phrasing and repetitive structure ('벌꿀처럼 달콤하고 벌꿀처럼 노란색인'). The aesthetic elegance of Wilde's prose is lost in the clunky, unnatural Korean construction.

results.translated_text: "아프가니스탄에 간 것 같아요." "어떻게 알게 되었는지?"라고 놀라워하며 물었습니다. "아무런 문제 없어,"라고 그가 속으로 웃으며 말했습니다. "지금은 히에모글로빈에 관한 문제입니다. 이 발견의 중요성을 분명히 알아야 하지 않겠어요?" "화학적으로는 분명 흥미로운데,"라고 답했지만, "실용적으로—" "아니, 인간이야, 이 발견은 수년 만에 가장 실용적인 의학법적 발견이야. 피 흔적을 절대 정확하게 검출할 수 있는 테스트를 제공하니, 이게 아닐 수 있겠어?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains several errors: '아무런 문제 없어' misrepresents 'Never mind,' the dialogue tags are inconsistent in formality, and the final sentence is awkwardly constructed with unclear phrasing ('이게 아닐 수 있겠어?'). The mix of formal and informal speech disrupts the Victorian-era tone and Holmes's characteristic confidence.

results.translated_text: 나는 숲으로 들어가려 했다. 그 이유는 삶을 의도적으로 살아가고 싶어, 생명의 핵심만을 직면하며, 그것이 무엇을 가르칠지 배우고 싶었기 때문이다. 죽을 때에 내가 살아서 살아보지 못한 것을 발견하지 않으려 했다. 나는 생명이 아닌 것을 살아가고 싶지 않았으며, 삶은 너무 소중하므로 필요할 때만 수용하는 태도를 실천하고 싶지 않았다. 나는 깊이 있게 살아가고, 생명의 근본을 모두 뽑아내고 싶었다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but has notable issues: awkward phrasing in places ("살아서 살아보지 못한" is redundant), and the philosophical rhythm of Thoreau's original is diminished. The poetic intensity and parallel structure of the English are not fully preserved in the Korean rendering.

results.translated_text: 이스마엘이라고 부르라. 몇 년 전, 정확한 기간은 상관하지 않아도 되는 때에 지갑에 돈이 거의 없고 해안가에서 관심이 있는 것이 전혀 없었던 중, 나는 소소하게 항해하며 세계의 해양을 둘러보고 싶었다. 이는 내게 정서를 풀고 혈액 순환을 조절하는 방법이다. 입이 어두워지거나 내 마음이 습기 많은 비가 내리는 11월처럼 되는 때면, 나는 가장 빠르게 바다로 가야 할 때라고 생각한다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core narrative meaning but loses significant nuance in Melville's introspective tone and metaphorical language. Phrases like '입이 어두워지거나' (mouth growing dark) and '정서를 풀고' (releasing emotion) feel awkward and miss the psychological depth of the original's 'spleen' and 'grim about the mouth,' while the archaic, contemplative style is flattened into more modern, straightforward Korean.

results.translated_text: Một sự thật được công nhận rộng rãi là: Một người đàn ông độc thân có tài sản lớn chắc chắn phải tìm một người vợ. Dù cảm xúc hay quan điểm của anh ấy có ít người biết đến khi lần đầu tiên anh ấy bước vào làng xóm, sự thật này vẫn được các gia đình xung quanh xác lập vững chắc, khiến anh ấy trở thành người phù hợp để kết hôn với một trong những cô con gái của họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's signature irony and satirical tone through overly literal phrasing. The opening lacks the witty, tongue-in-cheek quality of the original, and 'người phù hợp để kết hôn với' flattens the ironic 'rightful property' metaphor that critiques social attitudes.

results.translated_text: Phòng được tràn ngập mùi hương đậm đà của hoa hồng. Khi làn gió mùa hè nhẹ nhàng thổi qua những hàng cây trong vườn, mùi hương nặng nề của hoa lê hoặc hương thơm tinh tế hơn của những đóa hoa hồng thưa lọt qua cửa mở. Từ góc chiếc divan bằng vải Persia mà anh ấy đang nằm, hút vô số điếu thuốc như thói quen, Chúa Henry Wotton chỉ vừa có thể thấy những đóa hoa laburnum có màu mật ong và hương vị ngọt ngào lấp lánh.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'hoa lê' (pear blossoms) misidentifies lilac, 'hương vị' (flavor) is incorrect for scent, and the syntax becomes awkward and unclear in places. The aesthetic sensibility and lyrical flow of Wilde's prose are substantially diminished, with the poetic accumulation of sensory details losing their delicate progression.

results.translated_text: "Tôi nhận ra bạn đã từng ở Afghanistan." Tôi ngạc nhiên hỏi: "Làm sao bạn lại biết điều đó vậy?" "Đừng quan tâm," anh cười khúc khích một mình. "Vấn đề bây giờ là huyết sắc tố. Chắc chắn bạn thấy ý nghĩa của phát hiện này của tôi chưa?" Tôi đáp: "Về mặt hóa học thì chắc chắn là thú vị, nhưng thực tế—" "Thật ra, anh ơi, đây là phát hiện y khoa pháp y thực tiễn nhất trong nhiều năm. Bạn có thấy rằng nó cho chúng ta một phương pháp thử nghiệm tuyệt đối chính xác để phát hiện dấu máu không?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has some awkward phrasing and inconsistent dialogue attribution that disrupts flow. The tone shifts slightly, particularly with 'anh ơi' (brother) which adds informality not present in the original, and some technical terms could be more naturally integrated into the Vietnamese dialogue.

results.translated_text: Tôi đi vào rừng vì tôi mong muốn sống có chủ đích, chỉ tập trung vào những điều thiết yếu của cuộc sống và tìm xem liệu tôi có thể học được điều gì mà nó phải dạy không, đồng thời không phải đến khi chết tôi mới nhận ra rằng mình chưa từng sống. Tôi không muốn sống những điều không phải là cuộc sống, bởi sống là điều quá quý giá; cũng không muốn thực hành sự phó mặc trừ khi nó thực sự cần thiết. Tôi mong muốn sống sâu sắc và rút sạch mọi tinh hoa của cuộc sống.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical meaning and key concepts accurately, though some nuances of Thoreau's deliberate repetition and rhythmic emphasis are softened. The Vietnamese reads competently but with occasional awkwardness that slightly diminishes the lyrical, meditative quality of the original prose.

results.translated_text: Hãy gọi tôi là Ismael. Một vài năm trước đây—chẳng cần quan tâm đến chính xác bao lâu—với ít tiền hoặc thậm chí không có tiền trong túi, và không có gì đặc biệt khiến tôi quan tâm khi ở bờ, tôi đã nghĩ rằng mình sẽ lên thuyền một chút để khám phá phần thế giới trên mặt nước. Đây là cách tôi dùng để giải tỏa căng thẳng và điều hòa cảm xúc. Khi tôi cảm thấy mặt mũi trở nên lạnh lùng; khi trong tâm hồn tôi có một tháng 11 ẩm ướt, mưa phùn, tôi luôn coi đây là lúc cần phải lên biển ngay lập tức.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but loses some nuance—'driving off the spleen' becomes 'giải tỏa căng thẳng' (relieving stress) rather than the more philosophical melancholy, and 'regulating the circulation' is rendered as 'điều hòa cảm xúc' (regulating emotions) instead of the physical metaphor. The archaic, introspective tone of the original is diminished, and some phrasing feels awkward in Vietnamese ('lên thuyền một chút' is somewhat clunky).

results.translated_text: เป็นความจริงที่ทุกคนรับรู้อย่างแพร่หลายว่า ชายหนุ่มที่มีทรัพย์สินมากมาย ต้องหาภรรยา ไม่ว่าเขาจะมีความคิดหรือความเห็นอย่างไรเมื่อเข้ามาอยู่ในชุมชนครั้งแรก ความจริงนี้ก็ถูกตั้งอยู่ในความคิดของครอบครัวรอบข้างอย่างลึกซึ้ง จนถือว่าเป็นของลูกสาวคนหนึ่งหรือคนอื่นในหมู่พวกเขา

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately, though some nuances of Austen's ironic voice are softened. The phrase 'ต้องหาภรรยา' (must seek a wife) is more direct than the original's subtle irony, and 'ของลูกสาวคนหนึ่ง' (property of one daughter) loses the satirical edge of 'rightful property.' The Thai reads naturally but lacks the formal, witty tone characteristic of Austen's opening.

results.translated_text: ห้องทำงานถูกเต็มไปด้วยกลิ่นหอมอันล้ำลึกของดอกกุหลาบ เมื่อลมฤดูร้อนที่อ่อนโยนพัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน กลิ่นหอมหนักของดอกลิลา หรือกลิ่นหอมอ่อนโยนของดอกไม้สีชมพูที่มีหนาม ไหลผ่านประตูที่เปิดอยู่ จากมุมโซฟาที่ทำจากผ้าปุรุธแบบเปอร์เซีย ที่เขาพักอยู่และกำลังสูบบุหรี่จำนวนไม่สิ้นสุดตามที่เขาทำมาทุกวัน ลอร์ด เฮนรี วอตตัน สามารถเห็นแสงสะท้อนของดอกไม้สีเหลืองที่มีกลิ่นหวานเหมือนน้ำผึ้งและสีน้ำผึ้งได้เพียงเล็กน้อย

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key meanings and sensory details, but the sentence structure becomes convoluted and loses the elegant flow of Wilde's prose. Some phrasing choices (like 'ผ้าปุรุธแบบเปอร์เซีย' for Persian saddle-bags) are awkward, and the aesthetic refinement of the original is diminished by clunky constructions.

results.translated_text: ฉันรู้สึกว่าคุณได้ไปแอฟกานิสถานแล้ว "คุณรู้เรื่องนี้ได้ยังไง?" ฉันถามด้วยความประหลาดใจ "ไม่ต้องห่วง" เขาพูดพร้อมยิ้มขมิ้น "ปัญหาตอนนี้คือฮีโมโกลบิน" "คุณคงเห็นความสำคัญของข้อค้นพบนี้แล้วใช่ไหม?" ฉันตอบว่า "มันน่าสนใจทางเคมีอย่างยิ่ง ไม่ต้องสงสัย" "แต่ทางปฏิบัติ—" "เหตุใด ท่าน มันเป็นข้อค้นพบทางการแพทย์-กฎหมายที่มีประสิทธิภาพที่สุดในหลายปีแล้ว คุณไม่เห็นว่ามันให้การทดสอบเลือดที่ไม่มีข้อผิดพลาดได้หรือ?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic plot points but has significant structural issues: the opening attribution is unclear (reads as narrator's observation rather than Holmes's deduction), dialogue tags are inconsistent, and the flow is disrupted by awkward phrasing like 'ไม่ต้องห่วง' (don't worry) instead of a more natural dismissal. The tone loses Holmes's characteristic arrogance and the dramatic tension of the original exchange.

results.translated_text: ฉันไปป่าเพราะฉันต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างมีเจตนา ที่จะเผชิญเฉพาะข้อเท็จจริงที่สำคัญที่สุดของชีวิต และหาว่าฉันจะได้เรียนรู้สิ่งที่มันต้องสอนได้หรือไม่ โดยไม่ต้องพบว่าเมื่อฉันตายแล้ว ฉันยังไม่ได้ใช้ชีวิตอย่างเต็มที่ ฉันไม่ต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างที่ไม่ใช่ชีวิต เพราะชีวิตมันมีค่ามาก ฉันไม่ต้องการฝึกฝนการยอมรับสิ่งที่ไม่สามารถเปลี่ยนได้ ยกเว้นเมื่อเป็นเรื่องจำเป็นอย่างยิ่ง ฉันต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างลึกซึ้ง และดึงส่วนที่มีคุณค่าสูงสุดของชีวิตทั้งหมดออกมา

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's philosophical meaning but loses some nuance and poetic force. The phrase 'suck out all the marrow of life' becomes overly explanatory ('ดึงส่วนที่มีคุณค่าสูงสุด') rather than maintaining the visceral metaphor, and the rhythm and parallel structure of the original prose are diminished in the Thai rendering.

results.translated_text: เรียกฉันว่า อิส์มีเอล หลายปีก่อน—ไม่ต้องสนใจว่าเป็นเวลาเท่าไร—ที่มีเงินในกระเป๋าเพียงเล็กน้อยหรือไม่มีเลย และไม่มีสิ่งใดที่ทำให้ฉันสนใจเมื่ออยู่บนบก ฉันคิดว่าจะเดินเรือไปมาเล็กน้อยเพื่อสำรวจส่วนของโลกที่เป็นน้ำ นี่คือวิธีที่ฉันใช้เพื่อปลดปล่อยความโกรธและปรับสมดุลการไหลเวียนของเลือด เมื่อฉันรู้สึกว่าปากของฉันเริ่มเย็นชาขึ้น หรือเมื่อจิตใจของฉันเป็นเดือนพฤศจิกายนที่ชื้นเปียกและฝนตกอย่างต่อเนื่อง ฉันคิดว่าเป็นเวลาที่ควรจะเดินเรือไปที่ทะเลทันทีที่สุด

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the literal meaning but loses some nuance in idiomatic expressions (e.g., 'driving off the spleen' becomes overly literal as 'releasing anger'). The archaic, contemplative tone of the original is diminished, and some phrases read awkwardly in Thai, making it feel more like a direct translation than natural prose.

results.translated_text: सभी लोगों द्वारा सार्वजनिक रूप से स्वीकृत एक सत्य है कि एक धनवान अकेला व्यक्ति को पत्नी की ज़रूरत होती है। हालांकि, उस व्यक्ति के पहले स्थानीय क्षेत्र में प्रवेश करते हुए उसके मन के भाव या राय कितने भी अज्ञात हों, यह सत्य स्थानीय परिवारों के मन में इतना स्थायी है कि उसे उनकी किसी एक लड़की का विवाह साथी माना जाता है।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise but loses some nuance in the opening declaration's universality and the property metaphor. The Hindi phrasing is somewhat awkward ('विवाह साथी' is imprecise for 'property'), and the elegant irony of the original is diluted by more literal, less flowing prose.

results.translated_text: स्टुडियो में गुलाब की ताज़ा और भरपूर गंध भरी हुई थी। जब गर्मियों की हल्की हवा बगीचे के पेड़ों के बीच से चलने लगी, तो खुले दरवाज़े से लिलाक की भारी गंध या पिंक फूल वाले काँटे की अधिक सुंदर गंध आती थी। उसके पेरशियन सैडल बैग्स के डिवान के कोने से, जहां वह सो रहा था और उसकी सामान्य आदत में बहुत सारी सिगरेटें चढ़ा रहा था, लॉर्ड हेन्री वॉटन ने केवल लबुनम के फूलों की एक चमक देख सकता था, जो मीठे स्वाद वाले और मीठे रंग वाले थे।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most literal meanings but loses aesthetic nuance and contains significant errors: 'सो रहा था' (sleeping) contradicts 'smoking,' 'चढ़ा रहा था' (loading/mounting) is awkward for smoking cigarettes, and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes clumsy 'मीठे स्वाद वाले और मीठे रंग वाले.' The sensory richness and Wildean elegance are diminished by unnatural phrasing and word choices that don't flow naturally in Hindi.

results.translated_text: मैंने समझा कि आप अफगानिस्तान में रह चुके हैं। "तुम्हें यह कैसे पता चला?" मैं आश्चर्य से पूछा। "कोई बात नहीं," उन्होंने अपने आप से मुस्कुराते हुए कहा। "अब सवाल यह है कि हीमोग्लोबिन। निश्चित रूप से आप इस खोज के महत्व को देख रहे हैं?" "असली रूप से रसायन विज्ञान में रुचि है, निश्चित रूप से," मैंने कहा, "परंतु व्यवहारिक दृष्टिकोण से—" "क्या बात, यह बहुत ही व्यवहारिक चिकित्सा-कानूनी खोज है, जो इतने सालों से आपको नहीं मिली थी। आप नहीं देख रहे हैं कि यह हमें खून के निशानों का निश्चित परीक्षण देता है?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'मैंने समझा' (I understood) incorrectly attributes the deduction to the narrator rather than Holmes; dialogue attribution is confused; and 'जो इतने सालों से आपको नहीं मिली थी' misrepresents the original meaning. The Hindi reads awkwardly with unnatural phrasing and loses the sharp, witty tone of the original dialogue.

results.translated_text: मैं जंगल में गया क्योंकि मैं जीवन को विचारपूर्ण रूप से जीना चाहता था, जीवन के मूल तथ्यों को केवल देखना चाहता था और देखना चाहता था कि मैं जीवन से क्या सीख सकता हूँ जो जीवन ने सिखाना था। और जब मैं मरूंगा तो नहीं देखूंगा कि मैंने जीवन नहीं जीया। मैं उस जीवन को जीना नहीं चाहता जो असली जीवन नहीं है, क्योंकि जीवन बहुत अहम है; और मैं अगर यह बहुत जरूरी नहीं है, तो निराशा का प्रयोग नहीं करना चाहता था। मैं गहराई से जीवन जीना चाहता था और जीवन के सबसे गहरे भाग को निकालना चाहता था।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but contains several errors: 'resignation' is mistranslated as 'निराशा' (despair) instead of 'त्याग' (renunciation), and the philosophical nuance of 'suck out all the marrow' is weakened to 'निकालना' (extract). The sentence structure is awkward and repetitive, lacking the eloquent flow of Thoreau's original prose, and the contemplative tone is diminished by clunky phrasing and grammatical inconsistencies.

results.translated_text: मैं इशमाइल कहूँ। कुछ साल पहले—वह कितने साल होंगे, यह बात नहीं जानता—मेरे पास बहुत कम या कोई भी पैसा नहीं था और तट पर मेरे लिए कोई विशेष चीज़ नहीं थी, इसलिए मैंने सोचा कि मैं थोड़ा सा नाव पर चलकर दुनिया के पानी के हिस्से को देखूँ। यह मेरा एक तरीका है दिल को शांत करना और रक्त के प्रवाह को संतुलित करना। जब मेरा मुँह दुखी हो जाता है या जब मेरे दिल में ठंडा, बरसात वाला नवम्बर होता है, तो मैं बहुत जल्दी नाव पर चलने का फैसला करता हूँ।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses the philosophical depth and archaic elegance of Melville's prose. Key issues include 'नाव पर चलकर' (traveling by boat) being too literal for 'sail about,' 'दिल को शांत करना' (calm the heart) missing the melancholic nuance of 'driving off the spleen,' and the poetic metaphor 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becoming overly concrete rather than maintaining its introspective, archaic tone.

results.translated_text: সমস্ত মানুষের মনে একটি সাধারণ সত্য অবস্থিত যে, যে কোনো বিবাহবিহীন ধনী পুরুষ স্ত্রীর প্রয়োজন করে। যদিও তার প্রথম সম্প্রদায়ে প্রবেশ করার সময় তার ভাবনা বা মত কতটা অজ্ঞাত হয়, তবুও এই সত্যটি সেই পরিবারগুলির মাঝে অত্যন্ত স্থায়ীভাবে অবস্থিত হয়, যে তিনি তাদের কোনো একজন পুত্রীর স্বামী হিসাবে বিবেচিত হয়।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and elegant formality. The phrase 'সমস্ত মানুষের মনে' (in all people's minds) weakens the universal declaration, and 'স্বামী হিসাবে বিবেচিত' (considered as a husband) misses the satirical 'rightful property' phrasing that drives Austen's social critique.

results.translated_text: স্টুডিওটি রসোয়ার সুন্দর সুগন্ধে পূর্ণ হয়ে থাকল। যখন গার্ডেনের গাছপালার মাঝে হালকা গ্রীষ্ম বাতাস ছুঁয়ে দিল, তখন উন্নত দরজা থেকে লিলাকের ভারী সুগন্ধ আসল অথবা পিন্ক ফুল করা কাঠারের সুন্দর সুগন্ধ। লর্ড হেন্রি ওটন যে পেরশিয়ান স্যাডলবাগের ডিভানের একটি কোণে লাগানো ছিলেন, সেখান থেকে তার সাধারণ কর্মে অসংখ্য সিগারেট খেলা করতে থাকলে, তিনি শুধুমাত্র লাবুরনমের মেলা-সুগন্ধ এবং মেলা-রং করা ফুলের আলোক দেখতে পাচ্ছিলেন।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic sensory elements but suffers from awkward phrasing, grammatical issues, and loss of aesthetic elegance. Key problems include 'লাগানো ছিলেন' (planted) instead of 'শুয়ে ছিলেন' (lying), unclear constructions like 'খেলা করতে থাকলে' (playing), and the failure to preserve Wilde's flowing, ornate prose style that defines the passage's aesthetic beauty.

results.translated_text: আমি মনে করি, আপনি আফগানিস্তানে থাকেন। "কোন কোন উপায়ে আপনি এটা জানলেন?" আমি অবাক হয়ে জিজ্ঞেস করলাম। "কিছু না," তিনি নিজের মনে হাসি করে বললেন। "এখন কথা হেমোগ্লোবিনের। নিশ্চয়ই আপনি এই আমার আবিষ্কারের গুরুত্ব দেখেছেন?" "কেমিক্যাল দিক থেকে এটা আকর্ষণীয়, নিশ্চয়ই," আমি উত্তর দিলাম, "কিন্তু বাস্তবিক দিক থেকে—" "হ্যাঁ, বন্ধু, এটা গত কিছু বছরের মধ্যে সবচেয়ে প্রয়োগিক চিকিৎসা-আইনি আবিষ্কার। আপনি না দেখেছেন কি এটি রক্তের অবশেষের অবিভ্রান্ত পরীক্ষা দিতে পারে?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though some phrasings are awkward (e.g., 'আমি মনে করি, আপনি আফগানিস্তানে থাকেন' is passive/uncertain rather than the original's confident observation). The dialogue feels somewhat stilted and unnatural in Bengali, with grammatical constructions that don't fully match native speech patterns, particularly in the longer scientific passages.

results.translated_text: আমি জঙ্গলে যাইলাম কারণ আমি সচেতনভাবে জীবন করতে চাইছিলাম—জীবনের মূল সত্য দেখে যে আমি কি শিখতে পারি, এবং যদি মরে দেখি আমি জীবন করেনি তবে তা নয়। আমি জীবন না হওয়া জীবন করতে চাই নি, কারণ জীবন খুব দামী; আর আমি স্বীকৃতি করতে চাই নি যদি প্রয়োজন হয় না। আমি জীবনের সব মাংসের রক্ত সংগ্রহ করতে চাইছিলাম।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant errors: 'সচেতনভাবে' (consciously) misses 'deliberately,' the phrase 'স্বীকৃতি করতে চাই নি' (did not wish to acknowledge) distorts 'practise resignation,' and critically, 'সব মাংসের রক্ত সংগ্রহ করতে' (collect all flesh's blood) completely misrepresents 'suck out all the marrow of life.' The Bengali reads awkwardly and loses Thoreau's philosophical elegance and poetic intensity.

results.translated_text: আমাকে ইশমেল নামে ডাকুন। কিছু বছর আগে—কত সময় বলা যায় না—আমার হাতে কম বা কোনো ধন নেই এবং তীরে কোনো বিশেষ কিছু আমাকে আকর্ষণ করে না, তাই আমি ভাবলাম কিছুদিন সাগরে ভ্রমণ করে দুনিয়ার জলীয় অংশটি দেখব। এটি আমার একটি উপায় যে আমি ক্রোধ ও রক্তের প্রবাহ নিয়ন্ত্রণ করি। যখন আমার মুখ ক্রোধী হয়, যখন আমার আত্মায় একটি আর্দ্র ও বর্ষার নভেম্বরের অবস্থা হয়, তখন আমি সাগরে যাওয়ার সময় বলি যত দ্রুত সম্ভব।

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuance and philosophical depth. Key issues include mistranslating 'spleen' as 'ক্রোধ' (anger) rather than melancholy, awkward phrasing ('ক্রোধ ও রক্তের প্রবাহ' for regulating circulation), and failure to preserve Melville's introspective, meditative tone. The archaic literary style is largely flattened into more pedestrian Bengali.

results.translated_text: உலகம் முழுவதும் அறியப்பட்ட உண்மை என்பது, ஒரு தனியான ஆண் பெரும் பொருள் கொண்டிருக்கிறான் என்றால் அவர் ஒரு பெண்ணை தேவைப்படுவார். அவர் முதலில் ஒரு பகுதியில் இருக்கும் போது அவரது அனுபவங்கள் அல்லது மனப்பான்மை எவ்வளவு அறியப்படவில்லை என்றாலும், அந்த உண்மை அவரது சுற்றுவட்ட குடும்பங்களின் மனதில் நிறைவாக உள்ளது. அவர் அவரது பெண்களில் ஒருவருக்கு சொந்தமாக கருதப்படுகிறான்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature irony and satirical tone, rendering it more literal and awkward. Several phrases are imprecise ('அனுபவங்கள்' for 'feelings' is inaccurate, and the sentence structure becomes convoluted, diminishing the elegant irony of the original opening).

results.translated_text: அறையில் வெண்ணை பூவின் மிக மெல்லிய வாசனை நிறம்பியிருந்தது. அந்த வெள்ளை காற்று பூக்களில் வேறு வேறு செய்ததும், அறையின் திறந்த வாயிலில் லிலாக்கு பூவின் கடுமையான வாசனை அல்லது பின்னாட்டு வெட்டு பூவின் விரைவான வாசனை வந்தது. பர்சிய வாட்டு காற்களின் முக்கிய பகுதியில் அமர்ந்திருந்த லாபர்னம் பூவின் மாம்பு சுவை மற்றும் மாம்பு வாலை பூக்களின் வெளிச்சோள் அவர் பார்த்துக் கொண்டிருந்தார்.

scores.feedback: The translation contains severe accuracy errors, including mistranslations of key terms ("வெண்ணை" for roses is incorrect, "மாம்பு சுவை" means mango taste rather than honey-sweet), omissions of crucial elements (the divan, Lord Henry Wotton's name and action), and nonsensical phrases that obscure meaning. The prose is fragmented and unnatural in Tamil, completely failing to capture Wilde's aesthetic sensibility and lyrical style.

results.translated_text: உங்கள் அப்பாலிஸ்தானில் இருந்ததை நான் உணர்கிறேன். "எப்படி அதை அறிந்திருக்கிறார்கள்?" என்று அதிசயமாக நான் கேட்டேன். "அது அல்ல," என்று தனியாக சிரித்து கூறினார். "இப்போது கேள்வி ஹெமோக்லோபின் பற்றி இருக்கிறது. இது என் கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவத்தை உங்களுக்கு தெரியுமா?" "கேமிக்கல் விதிகளில் அது சிறமாக இருக்கிறது, உறுதியாக" என்று நான் பதிலளித்தேன், "ஆனால் பயனுள்ள வகையில்—"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic plot points but contains significant errors: 'உங்கள் அப்பாலிஸ்தானில்' is grammatically incorrect (should be 'நீங்கள் ஆப்கானிஸ்தானில்'), 'அது அல்ல' misrepresents 'Never mind,' and 'கேமிக்கல் விதிகளில்' (chemical rules) poorly conveys 'chemically.' The dialogue feels stilted and unnatural, lacking the Victorian conversational tone and Sherlock's characteristic deductive confidence.

results.translated_text: நான் வனம் செல்ல வந்தேன். உறுதியாக வாழ்க்கையை முன்பு விரும்பினேன். உண்மையின் மூலத்தை முழுவதுமாக எடுக்க விரும்பினேன். இறந்து தொடர்ந்து காண்பிக்க வேண்டியதில்லை என்று புரிந்து கொள்ள விரும்பினேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures only partial meaning and omits significant philosophical content (the essential facts of life, learning from nature, living deeply, sucking the marrow of life). The Tamil phrasing is awkward and unclear, particularly in the final sentence, and fails to preserve Thoreau's deliberate, introspective philosophical tone and rhythmic prose style.

results.translated_text: நான் இஷ்மீயல் என்று அழைக்கலாம். கொஞ்சம் நேரம் கழித்து, எவ்வளவு நேரம் என்று பேச வேண்டும் என்று அறிந்து, என் பையில் பணம் இல்லாமல் மற்றும் வெளியில் என்னை ஆசைப்படுத்தும் செயல்கள் இல்லாமல், நான் சில நேரம் கடலில் செல்லி உலகத்தின் நீர் பகுதியைக் கண்டுபிடிக்க விரும்பினேன். இது என் மனதில் உள்ள வலியை தூர்த்துவதற்கான மற்றும் சுழற்சியை நியாயப்படுத்துவதற்கான வழி. என் முகம் கடுமையாக வளரும் போது, அல்லது என் உள்ளே மழை போல் நீர் கொண்டிருக்கும் நவம்பர் என்று இருக்கும் போது, நான் வேகமாக கடலுக்கு செல்ல வேண்டும் என்று தீர்மானிக்கிறேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic plot points but loses significant meaning and nuance—'spleen' becomes vague 'pain,' the philosophical tone is flattened, and the archaic literary voice is entirely absent. Grammatical awkwardness and literal renderings ('damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes confusing) further diminish readability and literary quality.

results.translated_text: Это универсально признанная истина в том, что мужчина, обладающий хорошим состоянием, должен искать жену. Независимо от того, насколько мало известны его чувства или взгляды в момент первого появления в районе, эта истина так твердо укоренена в умах окружающих семей, что его считают принадлежащим одной из их дочерей.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's characteristic ironic wit and elegant phrasing. The Russian reads somewhat mechanically and awkwardly (e.g., 'принадлежащим одной из их дочерей' is clunky), and the opening's famous ironic tone is diminished by the more literal rendering of 'универсально признанная истина.'

results.translated_text: Студия наполнялась богатым ароматом роз. Когда лёгкий летний ветер дунул среди деревьев сада, сквозь открытую дверь доносился тяжёлый аромат лиры или более тонкий аромат куста с розовыми цветами. Сидя на углу персидского дивана, на котором он лежал, куря бесконечно много сигарет по своей привычке, лорд Хенри Вотон увидел лишь блеск медово-сладких и медовых цветов лабуаны.

scores.feedback: The translation has significant issues: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'лиры' (lyres), 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes awkward 'куста с розовыми цветами' (bush with pink flowers), and the syntax becomes confused with contradictory positioning ('sitting on the corner of the divan on which he was lying'). While some sensory details are preserved, the aesthetic precision and flowing elegance of Wilde's prose are substantially compromised.

results.translated_text:
«Вы были в Афганистане, я это воспринимаю.» — «Как же вы это узнали?» — спросил я с удивлением. 
— «Не важно», — усмехнулся он сам себе. 
— «Теперь вопрос касается гемоглобина. Не сомневайтесь, вы видите значение этого моего открытия?» 
— «Химически это интересно, безусловно», — ответил я, — «но практически —» 
— «Почему же, человек, это самое практичное медико-правовое открытие за последние годы! Вы не видите, что оно даёт нам безошибочный тест на кровавые пятна?»

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has notable issues: 'я это воспринимаю' is awkward for 'I perceive' (better: 'я вижу'), and 'кровавые пятна' (bloody stains) misses the technical term 'blood stains.' The dialogue reads somewhat stiffly and loses Holmes's characteristic sharp wit; phrases like 'Почему же, человек' feel unnatural compared to the original's crisp delivery.

results.translated_text: Я пошёл в лес, чтобы жить целенаправленно, сознавать только существенные факты жизни и попытаться узнать, что она должна научить, чтобы, когда умру, не обнаружить, что я не жил. Я не хотел жить не жизнью, так как жизнь так дорога; также не желал сдаваться, если это было совершенно необходимо. Я хотел жить глубоко и выжать из жизни всю её суть.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but has notable issues: 'сознавать только' (be aware of only) weakens the imperative 'front'; 'что она должна научить' is awkward phrasing for 'what it had to teach'; 'выжать из жизни всю её суть' (squeeze out all essence) loses the poetic force of 'suck out all the marrow.' The philosophical intensity and rhythmic cadence of Thoreau's original are diminished, and some constructions feel stilted rather than naturally Russian.

results.translated_text: Зовите меня Ишмаэлем. Несколько лет назад — не важно, как именно долго — имея мало или совсем никаких денег в кошельке и ничего особенного, что бы мне было интересно на суше, я решил немного проплыть и увидеть водную часть мира. Это способ, которым я отвожу грусть и регулирую кровообращение. Когда мое лицо становится мрачным, когда в душе моей влажный и дождливый ноябрь — я считаю, что пора уже уйти в море, как можно скорее.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some nuance—'driving off the spleen' becomes merely 'отвожу грусть' (driving off sadness) rather than conveying the medical/philosophical connotation of spleen. The archaic, introspective tone is somewhat flattened, and phrases like 'account it high time' feel less idiomatic in Russian than the original's deliberate formality.

results.translated_text: Це є універсально прийнятою правдой, що чоловік, який має багатство, обов'язково потребує жінки. Незалежно від того, наскільки мало відомі його почуття або погляди, коли він перший раз входить до району, ця правда так добре закріплена в думках сусідніх сімей, що він вважається власністю однієї з їхніх доньок.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice and elegant rhythm. Phrases like 'універсально прийнятою правдой' and 'обов'язково потребує' are somewhat awkward; the original's subtle mockery and formal grace are diminished by more literal, clunky phrasing.

results.translated_text: Студія була наповнена багатим ароматом роз. Коли легкий літній вітер рухався серед дерев саду, через відкриті двері пронизував тяжкий аромат лілака або більш тонкий аромат рожевих квітів куща. З кута дивану з перських сакві, на якому він лежав, курячись, як звичай, безліч цигарок, Лорд Генрі Вутон мав можливість побачити лише відблиск квітів лабурану, які мали медовий смак і медовий колір.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but has notable issues: 'пронизував' (pierced through) is awkward for scent, and 'медовий смак' (honey taste) incorrectly adds taste to a visual description. The sentence structure becomes convoluted, particularly in the final clause, losing Wilde's flowing aesthetic prose and the sensory precision essential to this passage.

results.translated_text: "Ви були в Афганистані, я це розумію," — сказав я. "Як ви це знали?" — здивовано запитав я. "Нехай це буде," — посміхнувшись собі він сказав. "Тепер питання стосується гемоглобіну. Безумовно, ви бачите значення цього відкриття?" "Хімічно це цікаво, безумовно," — відповів я, "але практично—" "Чому ж, чоловік, це найбільш практичне медико-правове відкриття за останні роки. Ви не бачите, що це дає нам безпомилковий тест для кров'яних слідів?"

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: the first line incorrectly attributes Holmes's observation to the narrator ("я сказав" instead of showing Holmes speaking), and dialogue attribution is confused throughout, disrupting the scene's logic. While vocabulary is generally accurate, the awkward phrasing and incorrect speaker assignments severely compromise both fluency and the original's characteristic Holmesian style.

results.translated_text: Я пішов у ліс, бо бажав жити усвідомлено, зосереджуватися лише на найважливіших аспектах життя та дослідити, чи не навчусь від того, що в ньому було, і не виявити, коли прийде смерть, що я не жив. Я не бажав жити те, що не було життям, оскільки життя так дороге; і не бажав практикувати віддання, якщо це було досить необхідно. Я хотів жити глибоко і витягнути всю суть життя.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but loses some philosophical precision and poetic rhythm. Phrases like 'витягнути всю суть' (extract the essence) weakens the visceral power of 'suck out all the marrow,' and the sentence structure becomes more convoluted, reducing the meditative clarity of the original.

results.translated_text: Називай мене Ішмейл. Чиєїсь кілька років тому — не важливо, як точно — маючи мало або нічого грошей у кошику, і нічого цікавого на березі, я думав, що плисти трохи та побачити водну частину світу. Це спосіб, який я маю, щоб відводити напруженість і регулювати кровообіг. Коли я починаю бути грубим у роті; коли в душі стає мокрий, дощовий листопад, я вважаю, що час відійти на море як найшвидше.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: 'у кошику' (in a basket) misses 'purse,' 'грубим у роті' (rough in the mouth) is awkward for 'grim,' and 'мокрий, дощовий листопад' (wet, rainy November) is clumsy. The archaic, meditative tone of Melville's prose is lost, replaced by stilted, unnatural phrasing that doesn't flow in Ukrainian.

results.translated_text: إنَّها حقيقةٌ تُعْرَفُ عالميًا أنَّ رجلًا وحيدًا يمتلك ثروةً جيدة، يَحتاجُ إلى زوجة. ومع ذلك، على الرغم من أنَّ مشاعره أو آرائه قد لا يُعْرَفُون في البداية عند دخوله لمنطقة السكان المحيطة، فإن هذه الحقيقة مُعَرَّفَةٌ جيدًا في أذهان العائلات المحيطة، فَيُعَدُّ زوجًا لِبَنتِ إحدى العائلات المحيطة.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some of Austen's ironic bite and elegant simplicity. Grammatical awkwardness ('يَحتاجُ إلى زوجة' is somewhat abrupt) and the final phrase's construction ('فَيُعَدُّ زوجًا لِبَنتِ') deviates from the original's subtle irony about being treated as 'property,' reducing the satirical impact of the opening.

results.translated_text: الغرفة كانت ملْمَةً بِرائحة ورود غنية، وعندما تَحَرَّكَتْ الرياح الصيفية الخفيفة بين أشجار الحديقة، تَدْخَلَ من الباب المفتوح رائحة ليلاك ثقيلة، أو رائحة أرقّ من أزهار الشجرة الوردية التي تُلْفُظُ أوراقًا حادة. ومن زاوية الديوان الفارسي المصنوع من الحِمَارِيَّاتِ الذي كان يَلْقَى عَلَيْهِ، يَدخُنُ لورد هنري ووتون عدَّةً هائلة من السيغارات كما كان عادته، يُلْقَى لَمْعَانَةَ أزهار لابورنوم تَحْمِلُ رائحة العُلَّةِ ولونًا عُلَّيًّا.

scores.feedback: The translation struggles significantly with accuracy and fluency, containing multiple errors including mistranslations ('saddle-bags' as 'حِمَارِيَّات', awkward phrasing of sensory descriptions), grammatical issues, and loss of the aesthetic elegance central to Wilde's prose. The poetic sensory richness is substantially diminished.

results.translated_text: أرى أنك كنت في أفغانستان. "كيف عرفت هذا؟" سألتُ بدهشة. "لا يهم،" قال وهو يضحك لوحده. "السؤال الآن يدور حول الهيموجلوبين. لا شك أنك ترى أهمية هذا الاكتشاف الذي أحدثته؟" "هذا مثير للاهتمام من الناحية الكيميائية، لا شك،" أجبتُ، "لكن عمليًا—" "لماذا، يا رجل، هذا هو اكتشاف طبي-قانوني الأكثر عملية منذ سنوات. لا ترى أن هذا يُعطينا اختبارًا لا يُعَرَّض للخطأ لبقع الدم؟"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue structure of the original text, capturing Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment. However, some phrasing feels slightly awkward in Arabic (e.g., 'الأكثر عملية منذ سنوات' and 'لا يُعَرَّض للخطأ'), and the conversational flow could be more natural, though the Victorian tone and character voices are reasonably maintained.

results.translated_text: ذهبتُ إلى الغابات لأنّي أردتُ العيش واعياً، لأتَّصَلُ إلى الحقائق الضرورية في الحياة و أرى إنّي لم أستطع تعلُّم ما يُعلِّمها، ولا أكتشفُ عندما أموت أنّي لم أعيش. لم أرغب في أن أعيش ما ليس حياةً، فالعيش ثمين جدًّا، و لم أرغب في ممارسة الاستسلام إلا إذا كان ضرورياً. أردتُ أن أعيش عميقاً وأستخلص كل جوهر الحياة.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant structural errors and awkward phrasing that obscure Thoreau's philosophical intent. The phrase 'أتَّصَلُ إلى الحقائق' (connect to facts) misrepresents 'front' (confront/face), and 'أرى إنّي لم أستطع' (I see I couldn't) distorts the conditional logic of the original. The flow is choppy and lacks the eloquent, meditative tone essential to Thoreau's prose.

results.translated_text: دُعيّني إسماعيل. قبل سنوات قليلة—لا يهم المدة الدقيقة—لديّ قليل أو لا شيء في جيبي، ولا شيء يُثير اهتمامي على الساحل، فلقد فكرت أن أُسافر قليلاً وأستكشف الجزء المائي من العالم. هذا طريقة أستخدمها لإطلاق الضغط العاطفي وتنظيم الدورة الدموية. كلما شعرت بأن شفتياي تصبحان مُحَمَّلَةً، أو كلما كان نوفمبر رطباً وغائماً في روحِي، أعتبر أن الوقت قد حان للذهاب إلى البحر على أسرع وقت ممكن.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core narrative and philosophical meaning reasonably well, but loses some nuance in idiomatic expressions ("spleen" becomes generic "emotional pressure") and the archaic, introspective tone of the original. The phrasing feels somewhat stilted and literal in places, particularly with "lips become laden" which doesn't match the original's "growing grim about the mouth."

results.translated_text: האמת הידועה על ידי כל האנשים היא שאיש ללא נישואים בעל נכסים טובים חייב להצטיין באישה. אפילו אם הרגשותיו או הראיותיו אינם ידועים כשעוזב את התחום הראשון, האמת הזו מוגדרת היטב במחשבות של המשפחות הסביבות, עד שמחויה כהאישה הנכונה של אחת מהן.

scores.feedback: The translation loses significant meaning and nuance from the original. 'Feelings or views' is mistranslated as 'feelings or evidence,' 'entering a neighbourhood' becomes 'leaving the first domain,' and the ironic tone is completely lost. The phrasing is awkward and unnatural in Hebrew, failing to capture Austen's distinctive satirical voice and the elegant irony of the opening.

results.translated_text: החדר מלא בריח עשיר של רוזים, וכשרוח החם הקלה נסעה בין העצים של הגינה, נגעה דרך הפתח הפתוח ריח חזק של לילאק, או הריח הנקי יותר של התורם עם פרחים פִּין. מהזווית של הדבּן הפסיפי שבו היה לורד הני ווטון, שמחה בדוחק כפי שהוא נוהל, מיליארד סמנים, הוא ראה רק את האור המטיל של פרחים שמכילים ריח מתני וצבע מזג של לברון.

scores.feedback: The translation contains numerous critical errors including mistranslations ("חם" for summer wind, "דבּן" for divan), nonsensical phrases ("מיליארד סמנים" for cigarettes), and severely garbled syntax that obscures meaning throughout. The aesthetic sensibility and lyrical quality of Wilde's prose are completely lost, making this translation largely incomprehensible and unreliable.

results.translated_text: אני מבין שראית באפרגנסטן. "איך היית יודע את זה?" שאלתי במפתיעות. "לא חשוב," אמר הוא, "צוחק לעצמו." "השאלה עכשיו היא על הימורבליין. לא ספק שאתה רואה את המשמעות של ההמצאה הזו שלי?" "זה מעניין כימי, ללא ספק," ענהתי, "אבל בפועל—" "איך, איש, זה ההמצאה היותר מעניינת רפואית-משפטית שנותרו כ-שנים. את לא רואים שנותר לנו בדיקת הבדיקה הבלתי מפסיקה לדימוי דם?"

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors including mistranslations ("haemoglobin" as "הימורבליין" is phonetically incorrect), grammatical mistakes ("ענהתי" should be "ענيתי"), and severely garbled final sentences that are nearly incomprehensible. The dialogue structure and Holmes's characteristic deductive tone are lost, and the Hebrew reads unnaturally throughout.

results.translated_text: לצאת ליער כי רציתי להחיות באופן מכוון, להצטמצם רק למציאות היסודית של החיים, ולראות אם אוכל למד מה שחייב ללמד, ולא למצוא שאני לא חלף חיים כשאתי למות. לא רציתי להחיות דברים שאינם חיים, לחיות הוא כל כך חביב; ולא רציתי לעשות התנתקות, אלא אם זה היה מוחלט. רציתי להחיות עמוק ולהוציא את כל מְרִיּוֹן של החיים.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant structural and grammatical errors that impede comprehension, including awkward verb conjugations ('להחיות' used incorrectly), unclear phrasing ('להצטמצם רק למציאות'), and mistranslations ('חלף חיים' for 'not lived'). While some philosophical intent is preserved, the prose lacks the eloquence and natural flow of Thoreau's original, and key nuances like the deliberate simplicity and moral urgency are lost.

results.translated_text: קרא לי אישמיאל. לפני כמה שנים—לא משנה כמה זמן בדיוק—לديי מעט או אף לא כסף בכליי, וללא מה שיעניין אותי על החוף, חשבתי שאני אוכל לטוס בים קצת ולראות את החלק המים של העולם. זהו אופן שאני משתמש בו כדי להיפוך התלפָה ולכיתל את הזרימה הדם. כל פעם שאני מתחילה להצטמצם בפיה; כל פעם שמתגלה נובמבר רטוב וגשם מטיל בלב שלי, אני מחשב שזה הזמן היותר מופעל ליצא לים כשתוכל.

scores.feedback: The translation contains numerous critical errors including mistranslations (לטוס = 'to fly' instead of 'to sail'), grammatical mistakes (gender and verb conjugation errors), nonsensical phrases ('להיפוך התלפָה' is incoherent), and fails to preserve the archaic, contemplative tone of Melville's prose. The text is largely incomprehensible and unfaithful to the source.

results.translated_text: Il est une vérité universellement reconnue, que tout homme célibataire en possession d'une bonne fortune doit nécessairement épouser une femme. Quel que soit le peu de connaissance que l'on ait des sentiments ou des opinions de cet homme lorsqu'il entre dans une communauté, cette vérité est si bien ancrée dans l'esprit des familles voisines qu'on le considère comme la propriété légitime d'une ou l'autre de leurs filles.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with natural French phrasing. Minor stylistic adjustments ('nécessairement' adds slight emphasis not in original; 'communauté' is less precise than 'neighbourhood') prevent a perfect score, but the overall effect remains faithful and readable.

results.translated_text: Le studio était empli de l'odeur riche des roses, et lorsque le léger vent d'été se mêlait aux arbres du jardin, parvenait par la porte ouverte le parfum lourd des lilas, ou le plus délicat parfum des épanouissements roses des épines. Du coin du divan constitué de coussins de selle persans sur lequel il était allongé, fumant, comme c'était son habitude, une infinité de cigarettes, lord Henry Wotton pouvait à peine apercevoir l'éclat des fleurs de laurier, douces et dorées comme du miel.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning, but loses some aesthetic precision: 'épanouissements roses' is awkward for 'pink-flowering,' and 'coussins de selle persans' (Persian saddle cushions) misses the poetic 'saddle-bags' reference. The prose feels slightly stiff compared to Wilde's flowing elegance, and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes merely 'douces et dorées comme du miel,' losing the original's layered sensory richness.

results.translated_text: « Vous avez été en Afghanistan, je perçois. » « Comment diable avez-vous su cela ? » demandai-je, stupéfait. « Ne vous en faites pas », dit-il, en riant pour lui-même. « La question est maintenant sur l'hémoglobine. N'avez-vous pas vu la signification de cette découverte à laquelle je suis parvenu ? » « C'est intéressant, chimiquement, sans doute », répondis-je, « mais pratiquement — » « Ah, monsieur, c'est la découverte médico-légale la plus pratique depuis des années. Ne voyez-vous pas que cela nous donne un test infaillible pour les traces de sang ? »

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meanings accurately but has minor issues: 'je perçois' is awkward (should be 'je le vois' or 'j'en suis certain'), and 'en riant pour lui-même' loses the warmth of 'chuckling to himself.' The Victorian formality is somewhat diminished, and 'test' feels less natural than 'épreuve' in this context, but overall readability and dialogue flow are maintained.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je souhaitais vivre délibérément, affronter uniquement les faits essentiels de la vie, et voir si je ne pouvais pas apprendre ce qu'il avait à enseigner, et ne découvrir, lorsqu'il serait temps de mourir, que je n'avais pas vécu. Je ne souhaitais pas vivre ce qui n'était pas la vie, la vie est si précieuse ; ni de pratiquer la résignation, à moins que ce ne fût absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre profondément et extirper toute la substance de la vie.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency, with excellent choices like 'délibérément' and 'extirper' capturing the original's intensity. Minor fluency issues include 'affronter uniquement' (slightly awkward phrasing) and 'lorsqu'il serait temps de mourir' (less direct than 'when I came to die'), but the meditative, declarative style and moral weight are well maintained throughout.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ishmaël. Il y a quelques années—pas besoin de préciser combien de temps exactement—ayant peu ou pas d'argent dans mon portefeuille, et rien de particulier à m'intéresser sur la terre ferme, je pensais que je ferais une petite croisière et que je verrais la partie aquatique du monde. C'est une manière que j'ai de chasser ma déprime et de réguler ma circulation. Quand je me trouve dans un état de mauvaise humeur, ou quand il fait humide et pluvieux, comme un novembre, dans mon âme, je considère que c'est le moment de me rendre à la mer aussi tôt que possible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some nuance and archaic elegance. 'Portefeuille' (wallet) is too modern for the 1850s setting, 'déprime' (depression) lacks the philosophical weight of 'spleen,' and the phrasing becomes awkward in places, particularly the mangled final clause about November in the soul.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine Wahrheit allgemein anerkannt, dass ein Mann, der in Besitz eines guten Vermögens ist, zwangsläufig eine Ehefrau benötigt. Wie bekannt der Mann auch sein mag, sobald er in eine Gegend eintritt, ist diese Wahrheit so tief in den Geistern der umliegenden Familien verankert, dass er als das rechtmäßige Eigentum eines oder anderen ihrer Töchter angesehen wird.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some nuance: 'zwangsläufig benötigt' is more forceful than the original's ironic understatement, and 'Wie bekannt der Mann auch sein mag' misses the ironic point about feelings/views being unknown. The phrasing feels somewhat stiff and less elegant than Austen's original ironic tone.

results.translated_text: Das Atelier war erfüllt von dem reichen Duft der Rosen, und wenn der leichte Sommerwind durch die Bäume des Gartens aufgewirbelt wurde, drang durch das geöffnete Fenster der dichte Geruch der Lilien oder der zartere Duft des rosa blühenden Dorns. Von der Ecke des Divans, der persischen Satteltaschen trug, auf dem er sich, wie es seine Gewohnheit war, mit unzähligen Zigaretten rauchend, lag, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade den Glanz der honigsüßen, honigfarbenen Blüten des Laburnums erkennen.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meanings accurately, though 'Lilien' (lilies) for 'lilac' is a notable error, and the syntax becomes awkward in the final clause. The aesthetic sensory richness is largely maintained, but the German sentence structure disrupts the flowing elegance of Wilde's original prose.

results.translated_text: „Sie sind in Afghanistan gewesen, ich nehme wahr.“ „Wie zum Teufel wissen Sie das?“, fragte ich erstaunt. „Nun, egal“, sagte er, kichernd für sich. „Die Frage ist nun bezüglich Hämoglobin. Kein Zweifel, Sie erkennen die Bedeutung meiner Entdeckung?“ „Es ist interessant, chemisch betrachtet, kein Zweifel“, antwortete ich, „aber praktisch—“ „Warum, Mann, es ist die praktischste medizinisch-rechtliche Entdeckung in den letzten Jahren. Siehst du nicht, dass es uns einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren gibt?“

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but has notable issues: awkward phrasing ('kichernd für sich' is unnatural), inconsistent pronoun usage (shifts from 'Sie' to 'du'), and 'ich nehme wahr' is overly literal for Holmes's deductive manner. The dialogue feels stilted rather than flowing naturally as Victorian-era conversation.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich entschlossen leben wollte, nur die wesentlichen Tatsachen des Lebens zu begegnen und zu prüfen, ob ich nicht lernen konnte, was es mir zu geben hatte, und nicht, wenn ich sterben sollte, zu erkennen, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte. Ich wünschte nicht, zu leben, was nicht Leben war, denn Leben ist so kostbar; noch wollte ich Resignation praktizieren, es sei denn, es wäre vollständig notwendig. Ich wollte tief leben und den ganzen Knochenmark aus dem Leben aussaugen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but contains awkward phrasings that disrupt fluency, such as 'die wesentlichen Tatsachen des Lebens zu begegnen' (to encounter essential facts) rather than a more natural construction, and 'den ganzen Knochenmark aussaugen' (suck out the whole marrow) which is grammatically awkward. The philosophical intensity and rhythmic cadence of the original are somewhat diminished.

results.translated_text: Ich heiße Ishmael. Vor einigen Jahren – egal, wie lange genau – hatte ich kaum Geld in meiner Tasche und nichts Besonderes, das mich an Land interessierte, und dachte, ich würde ein wenig segeln und den wasserigen Teil der Welt sehen. Es ist eine Art, die Melancholie zu vertreiben und die Durchblutung zu regulieren. Jedes Mal, wenn ich mich selbst grimmig um den Mund fühle; jedes Mal, wenn es in meiner Seele eine feuchte, regnerische November ist, halte ich es für den besten Zeitpunkt, so schnell wie möglich zur See zu eilen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses the archaic, philosophical tone of the original through modern phrasing and awkward constructions (e.g., 'grimmig um den Mund fühlen' is unnatural; 'eine feuchte, regnerische November' is grammatically awkward). The poetic introspection and rhythmic quality of Melville's prose are significantly diminished.

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero en posesión de una buena fortuna debe de estar en busca de una esposa. Poco importa cuán poco se conozcan las emociones o opiniones de tal hombre al primer ingreso en un vecindario, esta verdad está tan arraigada en las mentes de las familias vecinas, que se le considera la propiedad legítima de alguna de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and ironic tone effectively, with accurate rendering of Austen's famous opening. Minor fluency issues: 'debe de estar' is slightly awkward (better as 'debe estar'), and 'al primer ingreso' is less elegant than 'al llegar por primera vez,' but these are minor deviations that don't significantly impact the overall quality.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba lleno del rico olor a rosas, y cuando el suave viento de verano soplaba entre los árboles del jardín, llegaba a través de la puerta abierta el intenso olor del lilac, o el más delicado aroma de los espinos con flores rosadas. Desde la esquina del diván de bolsas de asiento persas sobre el cual se encontraba tumbado, fumando, según era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton podía captar apenas el resplandor de las flores dulces como miel y de color miel de un laburno.
