scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone about marriage expectations, though 'comunità' is slightly less precise than 'neighbourhood' and some phrasing feels slightly more formal than the original's elegant simplicity. The structure and wit are well-preserved overall.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era pieno dell'intenso profumo dei rosa, e quando il leggero vento d'estate si muoveva tra gli alberi del giardino, attraverso la porta aperta giungeva il forte odore dell'acero, o il più delicato profumo del ramo spinoso con fiori rosa. Dall'angolo del divano formato da sacchi da sella persiani su cui giaceva, fumando, come era sua abitudine, innumerevoli sigarette, Lord Henry Wotton poteva appena scorgere la luce dorata e il dolce aroma dei fiori gialli del laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general sensory richness but contains significant errors: 'acero' (maple) misrepresents 'lilac,' and the aesthetic precision of Wilde's botanical descriptions is compromised. While the Italian flows reasonably well, the loss of key sensory details and the awkward phrasing of 'ramo spinoso con fiori rosa' (thorny branch with pink flowers) instead of 'spina fiorita rosa' diminishes both accuracy and the refined aestheticism central to the original passage.

results.translated_text: «Sei stato in Afghanistan, lo percepisco.» «Come diavolo hai fatto a saperlo?» domandai, stupito. «Non importa» disse lui, ridacchiando tra sé. «La questione adesso è sull'emoglobina. Non dubito che tu veda l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?» «È interessante, certamente dal punto di vista chimico» risposi, «ma praticamente...» «Perché, uomo, è la scoperta più utile dal punto di vista medico-legale degli ultimi anni. Non vedi che ci dà un test infallibile per le macchie di sangue?»

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. Minor issues include 'lo percepisco' being slightly formal for Holmes's tone, and 'Perché, uomo' feeling slightly awkward compared to the original's casual interjection, but these are minor deviations that don't significantly impact comprehension or readability.

results.translated_text: Sono andato nei boschi perché volevo vivere con deliberazione, fronteggiare solo i fatti essenziali della vita e vedere se non fossi riuscito a imparare ciò che aveva da insegnare, e non, quando sarei morto, scoprire di non aver vissuto. Non volevo vivere ciò che non era vita, la vita è così cara; né volevo praticare la rassegnazione, a meno che non fosse assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere profondamente e succhiare tutta la midolla della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and intensity well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like 'deliberazione' and 'midolla della vita.' Minor fluency issues arise from the complex conditional construction 'se non fossi riuscito' which feels slightly awkward compared to the original's directness, though the archaic tone appropriately mirrors Thoreau's style.

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ishmael. Qualche anno fa—non importa esattamente da quanto tempo—avendo poco o nessun denaro nella borsa e niente di particolare che mi interessasse a terra, pensai che sarebbe stata una buona idea fare un po' di viaggio in mare e vedere la parte acquatica del mondo. È un modo che ho per sbarazzarmi della melanconia e regolare la circolazione. Ogni volta che mi trovo a diventare cupo in volto; ogni volta che dentro di me c'è un novembre umido e piovoso, considero il momento giusto per andare in mare il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and philosophical weight. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become 'sbarazzarmi della melanconia' (getting rid of melancholy), which is more modern and less evocative than the original's medical-philosophical tone. The fluency is natural Italian, though occasionally more straightforward than the source's deliberate complexity.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida, que um homem solteiro que possua uma boa fortuna, deve estar em busca de uma esposa. Por mais desconhecidas que sejam as emoções ou opiniões de tal homem ao entrar pela primeira vez em uma vizinhança, essa verdade está tão bem fixada na mente das famílias circundantes, que ele é considerado a propriedade legítima de uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and famous opening of Pride and Prejudice, with excellent rendering of the ironic tone. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'por mais desconhecidas que sejam' and 'de uma ou outra de suas filhas' that could be more elegant, though the overall style and voice remain well-maintained.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava cheio do rico odor de rosas, e quando o leve vento de verão agitava-se entre os arbustos do jardim, chegava pela porta aberta o pesado cheiro da lavanda ou o perfume mais delicado da espinheira com flores cor de rosa. Do canto do divã de almofadas de sela persas sobre o qual estava deitado, fumando, como era seu costume, inúmeros cigarros, Lorde Henry Wotton conseguia apenas avistar o brilho das flores doce e douradas de um laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and meaning, though 'lavanda' (lavender) replaces 'lilac' (lilás), which is a notable error. The prose flows reasonably well in Portuguese but loses some of Wilde's aesthetic elegance through slightly awkward phrasing like 'agitava-se entre os arbustos' and the compressed final clause.

results.translated_text: Você esteve na Afeganistão, percebo. — Como diabos você soube disso? — perguntei, surpreso. — Não se preocupe — disse ele, rindo para si mesmo. — A questão agora é sobre hemoglobina. Não duvido que você veja a importância dessa descoberta minha? — É interessante, quimicamente, sem dúvida — respondi —, mas praticamente... — Por que, homem, é a descoberta mais prática do campo médico-legal dos últimos anos. Não vê que nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment, though some dialogue feels slightly stiff compared to the original's natural flow. Minor issues include 'Não duvido que' being slightly awkward phrasing and the loss of some conversational naturalness in the exchanges.

results.translated_text: Fui para a floresta porque desejava viver de forma deliberada, enfrentar apenas os fatos essenciais da vida e ver se seria capaz de aprender o que ela tinha a ensinar, e não, ao morrer, descobrir que não havia vivido. Não desejava viver o que não era vida, pois a vida é tão preciosa; tampouco desejava praticar a resignação, a menos que fosse absolutamente necessária. Queria viver profundamente e extrair toda a medula da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with only minor nuances lost. The prose flows naturally in Portuguese, though some constructions feel slightly more formal than the original's conversational intensity, and 'extrair toda a medula' captures the visceral 'suck out all the marrow' effectively but with marginally less force.

results.translated_text: Chamem-me Ishmael. Há alguns anos — nem importa há quanto tempo exatamente —, com pouco ou nenhum dinheiro no bolso e nada em particular para me interessar na terra, pensei que navegaria um pouco e veria a parte aquática do mundo. É um jeito que tenho de afastar a tristeza e regular a circulação. Sempre que me vejo ficando sério no rosto; sempre que é um novembro úmido e chuvoso na minha alma, considero o momento certo para ir ao mar o mais rápido possível.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning well with minor deviations ("parte aquática" is slightly less poetic than "watery part"), and maintains the archaic tone reasonably. However, some phrases feel slightly more modern than the original's deliberate formality, and the rhythm of Melville's prose is not fully captured in the Portuguese rendering.

results.translated_text: Powszechnie uznawana jest prawda, iż singiel posiadający dobre majątki musi pragnąć żony. Choćby nawet uczucia i poglądy takiego mężczyzny na początku przybycia do sąsiedztwa byłyby najmniej znane, ta prawda jest tak mocno zakorzeniona w umysłach rodzin otaczających, że uważany jest za właściwego kandydata wśród jednej z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice and elegant rhythm. The word 'singiel' (slang for bachelor) undermines the formal tone, and 'właściwego kandydata' (suitable candidate) weakens the satirical bite of 'rightful property,' making the critique less sharp.

results.translated_text: Studium było wypełnione bogatym zapachem róż, a gdy delikatny letni wiatr poruszał się wśród drzew ogrodu, przez otwarte drzwi wchodził ciężki zapach fiołków albo delikatny perfumy różanowców. Z rogu divana z perskich siodłanych worków, na którym leżał, paląc, jak było jego zwyczajem, niewyliczalną liczbę papierosów, lord Henry Wotton mógł zaledwie dostrzec blask miodowosłodkich i miodowoczerwonych kwiatów laburantu.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meanings but contains errors: 'fiołków' (violets) should be 'bzu' (lilac), and 'miodowoczerwonych' (honey-red) misrepresents 'honey-coloured' (should be 'miodowożółtych'). Phrasing like 'perfumy różanowców' is awkward; fluency suffers from literal constructions that don't flow naturally in Polish, diminishing the aesthetic sensibility of Wilde's original prose.

results.translated_text: „Byłeś w Afganistanie, dostrzegam.” – „Jak na licho wiedziałeś?” – zapytałem z zdumieniem. „Niech to diabeł” – rzucił, zachichotawszy do siebie. „Pytanie teraz dotyczy hemoglobiny. Chyba widzisz znaczenie mojego odkrycia?” – „Zdaje się, że ciekawe jest to chemicznie” – odpowiedziałem – „ale praktycznie—” – „Dlaczego, człowieku, to najpraktyczniejsze odkrycie medyczno-prawnego w ciągu lat. Nie widzisz, że daje nam niezawodny test na śladach krwi?”

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning and captures Holmes's deductive character, but has some awkward constructions ('najpraktyczniejsze odkrycie medyczno-prawnego w ciągu lat' is grammatically clunky) and minor phrasing issues that slightly impede natural Polish flow. The dialogue structure and tone are reasonably maintained.

results.translated_text: Poszedłem do lasu, ponieważ chciałem żyć z rozmysłem, stawiać czoła tylko istotnym faktom życia i sprawdzić, czy nie potrafię nauczyć się tego, co miałoby nauczyć, by nie odkryć, kiedy przyszedł czas umrzeć, że nie żyłem. Nie chciałem żyć tego, co nie jest życiem, bo życie jest tak cenne; ani też praktykować rezygnacji, chyba że byłaby bardzo konieczna. Chciałem żyć głęboko i wypić wszystki szpik życia.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but contains awkward constructions and minor errors that disrupt the philosophical flow. 'Nauczyć się tego, co miałoby nauczyć' is convoluted, 'wypić wszystki szpik' has grammatical issues (should be 'wszystek szpik' or 'cały szpik'), and the overall rhythm lacks the meditative quality of the original prose.

results.translated_text: Nazywajcie mnie Ishmaelem. Niechętnie przyznam, że nie pamiętam dokładnie, ile to było lat — miałem w portfelu praktycznie nic, a nic nie przyciągało mnie na ląd — zdecydowałem, że wyjedę na morze na trochę i zobaczę wodny świat. To moja metoda zwalczania melancholii i regulowania krążenia. Kiedy w mojej duszy pada mokry, deszczowy listopad, kiedy zaczynam się złościć — to dla mnie najwyższy czas, by jak najszybciej wyruszyć w morze.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but introduces significant deviations from the original text. The opening 'Nazywajcie mnie Ishmaelem' is awkward compared to the direct 'Call me Ishmael,' and key phrases like 'growing grim about the mouth' are omitted entirely. The archaic, contemplative tone of Melville's prose is diluted by more modern phrasing and structural changes that weaken the philosophical meditation of the original.

results.translated_text: 众所周知，一位单身男子若拥有巨额财产，必定需要一位妻子。无论这位男子的内心想法或观点在最初进入某个社区时多么不为人知，这一真理在周围家庭的脑海中根深蒂固，以至于他们认为他理所当然是某位女儿的合法财产。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, though 'needs a wife' (需要一位妻子) slightly softens Austen's more pointed 'must be in want of,' and the phrasing feels somewhat more literal than the original's satirical elegance. The irony is preserved but with minor loss of the original's sophisticated wit.

results.translated_text: 工作室里弥漫着浓郁的玫瑰香气，当夏日微风轻拂花园中的树木时，透过敞开的门扉，紫罗兰的浓郁芬芳或粉红荆棘的清雅香气便随之飘入。躺在装饰着波斯马鞍袋的躺椅上，像他一贯的习惯那样，抽着无数支香烟的沃顿勋爵，刚好能望见窗外金盏花丛中闪烁着蜂蜜般甜美、色泽如蜜的花簇。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic atmosphere but contains significant botanical errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as '紫罗兰' (violet), and 'laburnum' is incorrectly rendered as '金盏花' (calendula) rather than the correct '金链花' (laburnum). These errors distort Wilde's specific floral imagery. The prose flows naturally in Chinese but loses some of the original's delicate precision and poetic cadence.

results.translated_text: “你去过阿富汗，我察觉到了。”“你怎么会知道的？”我惊讶地问道。“不必提了，”他自言自语地轻笑着，“现在的问题是关于血红蛋白的。你一定明白这个发现的重要性吧？”“从化学角度来看，这无疑很有趣，”我回答，“但实际应用方面——”“难道你没意识到这为我们提供了一种无懈可击的血迹检测方法吗？”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue flow of the original text, with proper preservation of Holmes's deductive manner and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include 'self-talk' (自言自语地) being slightly redundant with 'chuckling,' and the final exclamation losing some of Holmes's characteristic imperious tone, but overall it reads naturally in Chinese and maintains the Victorian-era detective fiction style effectively.

results.translated_text: 我走进森林，是因为我希望有意识地生活，只面对生命中本质的事实，看看是否能够学到它要教授的东西，以免在临终时发现我并未真正活过。我不想活那些不是真正生活的东西，因为生活如此珍贵；我也不希望练习忍耐，除非万不得已。我想活得深刻，汲取生命所有的精髓。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage well, with faithful rendering of key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's marrow. However, some phrasings feel slightly awkward (e.g., '学到它要教授的东西' is more formal than the original's conversational tone), and the poetic rhythm of the original is somewhat diminished in the Chinese version.

results.translated_text: 叫我以实玛利吧。几年前——确切时间无须深究——当时我口袋里几乎没有什么钱，岸上也没什么特别吸引我的东西，我便想出去航海，看看这个世界的海洋部分。这对我来说是一种驱散心中郁闷、保持血液循环顺畅的方式。每当我发现自己脸上露出阴郁的表情；每当我的灵魂中阴冷潮湿得仿佛十一月的雨天，我便觉得是时候尽快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening effectively, with good preservation of the introspective voice. However, some nuances are slightly altered: 'spleen' becomes '郁闷' (melancholy) losing the medical/humoral reference, and the poetic metaphor 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes more literal. The archaic literary style is reasonably maintained but lacks some of the original's rhythmic elegance.

results.translated_text: 這是一個眾所周知的真理：凡是有財產的單身男子，必定需要一位妻子。即使這樣的男子剛剛進入某個社區時，人們對他的情感或想法知之甚少，這個真理已經深植於周圍家庭的腦中，他們認為這位男士必定是某個女兒的婚配對象。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise but loses some of Austen's sophisticated wit and the elegant flow of the original. The phrase '婚配對象' (marriage match) is less pointed than 'rightful property,' and the sentence structure feels more rigid than Austen's flowing irony.

results.translated_text: 這間工作室裡瀰漫著濃郁的玫瑰香氣，當輕柔的夏風在花園裡的樹叢間輕拂時，透過敞開的門戶飄來紫丁香的濃烈芬芳，或粉紅花刺那更為嬌柔的香氣。他正躺臥在裝飾著波斯馬鞍袋的沙發上，一如往常地抽著無數煙絲，從沙發角落處，他剛好能望見窗外那株蜂蜜般甜美且呈蜂蜜色的金鏈花樹，其花朵在陽光下閃爍著微光。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic focus of Wilde's prose, with accurate rendering of the botanical imagery and atmospheric details. However, some minor issues include slight awkwardness in phrasing ("無數煙絲" is imprecise for cigarettes), and the addition of "在陽光下閃爍著微光" (glimmering in sunlight) adds interpretation not present in the original, which specifically uses "gleam" in a more subtle way.

results.translated_text: 「你曾到過阿富汗，我察覺到了。」「你怎麼會知道的？」我驚訝地問。「無所謂，」他自顧自地笑了笑，「現在的問題是關於血紅蛋白的。難道你不明白這個發現的重要性嗎？」「從化學角度來說，的確很有趣，」我回答，「但實際應用上——」「我的天，這可是多年來最重要的實用發現，」他說，「難道你不明白這給我們提供了一種檢測血跡的絕對可靠方法嗎？」

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include slight awkwardness in phrasing (「無所謂」 is somewhat informal for Holmes's character) and the addition of 「他說」 that wasn't in the original, though overall fluency and readability in Traditional Chinese are strong.

results.translated_text: 我之所以前往山林，是希望能夠刻意地生活，只面對生命中最重要的事實，看看是否能夠學到生命所要教導我的東西，待我死時，不會發現自己未曾真正活過。我不願虛度這寶貴的生命，也無意練習順從，除非萬不得已。我渴望深入生活，吸盡生命的骨髓。

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings effectively, with natural Chinese phrasing that preserves the contemplative tone. Minor areas: 'suck out all the marrow' as '吸盡生命的骨髓' is slightly less visceral than the original, and some of the original's rhythmic parallelism is softened in the rendering.

results.translated_text: 稱我為以實瑪利吧。許多年前——不必深究究竟多久以前——當時我口袋裡幾乎沒有錢，岸上也沒有什麼特別吸引我的東西，我便想出海走走，去看看這個世界的水路部分。這是我排遣鬱悶、調節血液循環的方法。每當我感到嘴邊浮現陰鬱的神情；每當我的靈魂中陰冷濕潤如十一月的雨天，我便認為是時候盡快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening effectively, with accurate rendering of key concepts like the spleen and maritime escape. However, some phrasings feel slightly awkward in Chinese (e.g., '水路部分' for 'watery part'), and the archaic, meditative quality of the original prose is somewhat diminished by more literal constructions rather than idiomatic Chinese equivalents.

results.translated_text: これは、全世界に知られている真実である。財産をもつ独身の男は必ず妻を求めており、その男の気持ちや意見がその地域に初めて足を踏み入れた時どれほど知られていなかったとしても、周囲の家族たちの心にはこの真実が深く根付き、彼は必ずそのうちのどちらかの娘の所有者と見なされるのである。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's signature irony and elegant structure. The sentence becomes unwieldy and overly literal, missing the satirical tone that makes the original so distinctive. Key issues: 'rightful property' becomes 'owner' (所有者), the ironic understatement is flattened, and the prose lacks the flowing sophistication of the original.

results.translated_text: スタジオには豊かなバラの香りが満ちており、軽やかな夏の風が園の木々をかき乱すと、開いたドアからすみれの濃厚な香りや、ピンクの棘に咲く花の繊細な香りが漂って来た。ペルシャのサドルバッグの上で横たわっていたロード・ヘンリー・ウォッテンは、いつものように無数のタバコを吸っているが、その視線の端で、ハチミツのように甘く、琥珀色の花を咲かせるラブランムの花びらがわずかに光るのを捉えた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning accurately, though 'すみれ' (violet) may not be the intended flower and some nuances of Wilde's aesthetic precision are softened. The prose flows reasonably well in Japanese but lacks some of the languid, luxurious rhythm characteristic of Wilde's original style.

results.translated_text: アフガニスタンにいたことが、私は理解しています。」　「どうしてそんなことに気づいたのですか？」　私は驚いて尋ねた。「どうでもいいです。」　彼は自分自身でニヤニヤと笑いながら言った。「現在の問題はヘモグロビンに関することです。間違いなく、この発見の意義をご理解いただけますよね？」　「化学的には間違いなく興味深いでしょう。」　私は答えた。「しかし実用的には—」　「なぜ、これは血痕に確実な検査を与えてくれないのですか？」

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant structural and grammatical errors that impede comprehension. The opening line is incorrectly attributed to Watson rather than Holmes, dialogue punctuation is inconsistent, and the final sentence is garbled with inverted logic ('why...doesn't it give us' instead of 'why, it gives us'). While some vocabulary choices are reasonable, the overall execution fails to preserve the original meaning and natural flow of this iconic Sherlock Holmes introduction.

results.translated_text: 私は、意図的に生きることを望み、生命の本質的な事実に直面し、それが何を教えてくれるかを学ぶことができればよいと考えた。死の際に、自分が本当に生きていないことに気付かずに終わることを避けたいのである。私は、生命ではないものを生きることを望まなかった。生きることはそれほど貴重である。また、断念することを実践することも、それがどうしても必要でない限り望んでいなかった。私は深く生き、人生の骨髄をすべて吸い取ることを望んだのである。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning accurately, though some nuances are lost—particularly the emphatic negation structure and the philosophical weight of 'live deliberately.' The Japanese reads somewhat stiffly and awkwardly in places (e.g., 'それほど貴重である' disrupts flow), and the poetic intensity and rhythmic cadence of the original prose are diminished, making it feel more like a literal rendering than a natural philosophical meditation.

results.translated_text: 私をイシュメールと呼んでくれ。数年前のことだが、正確な年数は憶えていない。財布にほとんどお金がなく、岸辺で特に興味を引くものもなかったため、少しくらい航海して、この世界の水の部分を目に焼き付けてみようと考えた。これは私が脾臓を駆逐し、循環を調整するための方法である。自分自身が口元が険しくなったり、魂に湿った、霧雨の十一月が訪れる度に、できるだけ早く海へと出かけなければならないと感じる。

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but loses significant nuance and literary elegance. Phrases like '脾臓を駆逐し' (literally 'expel the spleen') and '水の部分を目に焼き付けてみよう' (burn into eyes) are awkward and miss Melville's philosophical tone. The archaic, introspective voice is largely flattened into modern, mechanical Japanese.

results.translated_text: 모든 이가 인정하는 진실은, 좋은 재산을 가진 미혼 남자는 반드시 아내를 필요로 한다는 점이다. 그러한 남자의 감정이나 의견이 처음으로 이웃에 들어서는 순간 아무리 잘 알려지지 않았다 하더라도, 주변 가족들은 그 사실이 너무나 명확히 머릿속에 각인되어 있어서 그를 자신들의 딸들 중 한 명의 적법한 재산으로 여기고 있다.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, though the sentence structure becomes somewhat dense in Korean, slightly reducing natural fluency. The irony about women viewing eligible bachelors as 'property' is preserved, but the elegant simplicity of the original's satirical voice is somewhat diminished by the more complex grammatical construction.

results.translated_text: 튜브는 장미의 풍부한 향기로 가득 차 있었고, 가벼운 여름 바람이 정원의 나무 사이를 스치면서, 창문을 통해 희미한 라일락의 무거운 향기나 핑크빛 가시덤불의 섬세한 향기가 들어왔다. 페르시아 양말 가방으로 된 쿠션 위에 누워 무수한 연필을 피우고 있던 워튼 귀족은, 그가 늘 그렇듯이, 라부른의 꿀처럼 달콤하고 금빛을 띤 꽃을 바라보았다.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: 'studio' is mistranslated as 'tube' (튜브), 'cigarettes' as 'pencils' (연필), and 'saddle-bags' as 'socks' (양말), fundamentally distorting the passage's meaning and aesthetic sensibility. The sensory richness and Wildean elegance are severely compromised by these critical mistranslations and awkward phrasing.

results.translated_text: 아프가니스탄에 다녀온 적이 있겠군. "어떻게 그런 것을 알았을 까?" 나는 놀라며 물었다. "그건 중요하지 않다"고 그는 자신만만하게 웃으며 말했다. "이제 문제는 헤모글로빈에 관한 것이야. 분명히 당신은 내 발견의 중요성을 알아보겠지?" "화학적으로는 흥미롭겠지만, 실제로는—" 내가 대답했다. "왜, 인간, 이건 수년 만에 가장 실용적인 의법학적 발견이다. 피 얼룩에 대해 오류 없는 검사를 제공하는 것이 아닌가 보지 못하는가?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant issues: awkward phrasing ("어떻게 그런 것을 알았을 까?" lacks natural flow), inconsistent formality levels mixing casual and formal speech, and the final sentence is convoluted and difficult to parse in Korean. The dialogue feels stilted rather than natural, and some character voice distinctiveness is lost.

results.translated_text: 나는 의도적으로 삶을 살고, 생명의 본질적인 사실들만에 직면하여, 그것이 가르쳐 줄 수 있는 것을 배우지 못할지 보고 싶었다. 죽을 때쯤 내가 살지 못했다는 것을 발견하지 않도록 하고 싶었다. 나는 생명이 아닌 것을 삶으로 삼고 싶지 않았다. 삶은 너무 소중하니까. 또한 필요하지 않는 한 포기할 마음도 원하지 않았다. 나는 깊이 살고, 삶의 모든 본질을 빨아들일 수 있도록 하고 싶었다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the core meaning but has notable issues: 'see if I could not learn' is awkwardly rendered as 'see if I could not learn' (confusing double negative handling), and 'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'suck out all the essence' (losing the visceral, organic metaphor). The prose reads somewhat stilted and fragmented compared to Thoreau's flowing, meditative rhythm, and the philosophical weight of the original is diminished by awkward phrasing and sentence breaks.

results.translated_text: 나를 이스마엘이라고 부르라. 몇 년 전이었는지, 정확히 기억나지 않지만, 당시 내 지갑엔 거의 없거나 전혀 돈이 없었고, 육지에서는 특별히 흥미를 느낄 만한 것이 없어서, 나는 물 위를 조금 떠다녀 보고 싶었다. 이는 내가 불쾌감을 해소하고 혈액 순환을 조절하는 방법이다. 내가 입가에 어두운 그림자를 느낄 때면, 내 영혼에 습기 찬, 비가 내리는 11월이 찾아올 때면, 나는 가능한 한 빨리 바다로 향할 때가 바로 때다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' as melancholy becomes generic '불쾌감'), and the final sentence becomes awkwardly constructed ('때가 바로 때다' is redundant). The archaic, contemplative tone of the original is diminished, reading more modern and less poetic than Melville's introspective voice.

results.translated_text: Đây là một chân lý được công nhận rộng rãi rằng một người đàn ông độc thân sở hữu tài sản lớn chắc chắn cần một người vợ. Dù cảm xúc hoặc quan điểm của người đàn ông như vậy có thể ít được biết đến khi anh ta mới đến một khu vực, điều này đã được ghi sâu trong tâm trí các gia đình xung quanh đến mức anh ta được coi là tài sản hợp pháp của một trong những cô con gái của họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise accurately, but the sentence structure becomes awkward and loses the elegant flow of Austen's original prose. The opening phrase 'Đây là một chân lý được công nhận rộng rãi rằng' is clunky compared to the original's directness, and the ironic tone is somewhat diluted by the more literal rendering.

results.translated_text: Phòng studio ngập tràn hương thơm đậm đà của hoa hồng, và khi làn gió mùa hè nhẹ nhàng lay động những tán cây trong vườn, hương thơm nồng nàn của hoa nhài hoặc mùi hương tinh tế hơn của hoa hồng đâm chồi từ bụi gai hoa hồng lại len lỏi qua cửa mở. Từ góc chiếc đệm divan bằng túi ngựa Ba Tư nơi ngài Lord Henry Wotton đang nằm nghỉ, hút điếu thuốc liên tiếp như thói quen của mình, có thể thoáng thấy ánh sáng rực rỡ của những chùm hoa vàng rực rỡ, ngọt ngào như mật ong của cây laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'hoa nhài' (jasmine), and 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes confusing as 'hoa hồng đâm chồi từ bụi gai hoa hồng' (redundant rose references). The prose is awkward and loses Wilde's flowing aesthetic elegance, with awkward phrasing like 'ngài Lord Henry Wotton' and overly literal constructions that disrupt the sensory immersion of the original.

results.translated_text: "Anh đã từng ở Afghanistan, tôi nhận ra." "Làm sao anh lại biết điều đó?" Tôi hỏi với sự ngạc nhiên. "Đừng hỏi nữa," anh ấy cười khúc khích, nói. "Bây giờ câu hỏi là về huyết sắc tố. Chắc chắn anh thấy rõ ý nghĩa của phát hiện này của tôi?" "Nó thú vị về mặt hóa học, chắc chắn," tôi đáp, "nhưng về mặt thực tiễn—" "Tại sao, thằng ngốc, đây là khám phá pháp y thực tiễn nhất trong nhiều năm qua. Anh không thấy rằng nó cho chúng ta một phương pháp kiểm tra không thể sai lầm về các vết máu sao?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has notable issues: 'Đừng hỏi nữa' (don't ask anymore) misrepresents 'Never mind' (dismiss the question), 'thằng ngốc' (you fool) is too harsh for the original's casual 'man,' and the dialogue flow feels stilted compared to the original's natural Victorian-era conversational tone. Vocabulary choices like 'huyết sắc tố' for haemoglobin are technically correct but the overall phrasing lacks the fluidity of native Vietnamese dialogue.

results.translated_text: Tôi vào rừng vì tôi muốn sống một cách chủ đích, chỉ đối mặt với những sự thật thiết yếu của cuộc sống, và xem liệu tôi có thể học được những điều cuộc sống muốn dạy, chứ không muốn đến lúc chết mới phát hiện ra mình đã không thực sự sống. Tôi không muốn sống một cuộc sống không thực sự là sống, bởi sống là điều quý giá đến vậy; tôi cũng không muốn thực hành sự an phận, trừ khi hoàn toàn cần thiết. Tôi muốn sống sâu sắc và tận hưởng trọn vẹn mọi tinh hoa của cuộc sống.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage well, with faithful rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately' (chủ đích) and 'essential facts' (sự thật thiết yếu). However, some nuances are lost: 'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'tận hưởng trọn vẹn mọi tinh hoa' which softens the visceral intensity of the original metaphor, and the rhythm and parallel structure of the English prose is somewhat diminished in Vietnamese, affecting the contemplative tone sli

results.translated_text: Hãy gọi tôi là Ishmael. Cách đây vài năm—không cần phải nói chính xác là bao lâu—khi túi tiền của tôi hầu như không có đồng nào, và trên đất liền chẳng có điều gì đặc biệt thu hút tôi, tôi nghĩ mình nên đi du ngoạn một chút và tận mắt chứng kiến phần nước của thế giới này. Đó là một cách của tôi để xua tan nỗi buồn và điều hòa tuần hoàn máu. Mỗi lần tôi cảm thấy mặt mày u ám, mỗi lần tâm hồn tôi chìm trong cảm giác ẩm ướt, mưa phùn của tháng Mười Một, tôi đều cho rằng đó là lúc cần ra biển ngay lập tức.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately but loses some of the original's philosophical nuance and poetic rhythm. The archaic, contemplative tone is somewhat diminished, and phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become more literal and less evocative in Vietnamese, affecting both fluency and stylistic authenticity.

results.translated_text: เป็นเรื่องที่ถูกยอมรับอย่างกว้างขวางว่า ชายโสดที่มีฐานะดี ย่อมต้องมีความต้องการในเรื่องของภรรยา อย่างไรก็ตาม แม้ความรู้สึกหรือมุมมองของชายคนดังกล่าวจะไม่เป็นที่รู้จักมากนักเมื่อเข้าสู่พื้นที่ใหม่ครั้งแรก ความจริงนี้ก็ถูกจดจำอย่างลึกซึ้งในจิตใจของครอบครัวรอบข้าง จนเขาถูกมองว่าเป็นสมบัติที่ควรได้รับของหนึ่งในบุตรสาวของพวกเขา

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures the ironic tone of Austen's opening, though some phrasing feels slightly formal and the natural flow is occasionally disrupted by literal renderings. The key concepts of universal acknowledgment, fortune-seeking, and the commodification of unmarried men are well-preserved.

results.translated_text: สตูดิโอถูกเต็มไปด้วยกลิ่นหอมอันเน่าเปื่อยของกุหลาบ และเมื่อลมร้อนฤดูร้อนอ่อนโยนพัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน กลิ่นหอมหนักแน่นของดอกลิลลี่หรือกลิ่นหอมนุ่มนวลของดอกไม้สีชมพูที่มีหนามก็พัดเข้ามาผ่านประตูที่เปิดอยู่ ลORD เฮนรี่ วอทตัน มองเห็นแสงระยิบระยับของดอกไม้สีเหลืองอร่ามที่มีกลิ่นหอมหวานฉ่ำของไม้เลื้อยลาเบอรัมได้เพียงแค่ขอบสายตา จากมุมหนึ่งของโซฟาที่ทำจากถุงม้าเปอร์เซียที่เขานอนอยู่ กำลังสูบบุหรี่จำนวนมหาศาลตามนิสัยของเขาอย่างต่อเนื่อง

scores.feedback: The translation captures most semantic content but suffers from significant structural issues: the sentence order is scrambled (the laburnum description appears before the divan setup), 'เน่าเปื่อย' (rotten/decayed) is an inappropriate descriptor for rose scent, and 'ลORD' is improperly transliterated. The aesthetic sensibility and flowing prose rhythm of Wilde's original are lost due to awkward phrasing and disrupted narrative flow.

results.translated_text: คุณเคยไปอัฟกานิสถานมาแล้ว ฉันรู้ว่าอย่างนั้น "คุณรู้ได้อย่างไร?" ฉันถามด้วยความประหลาดใจ "ไม่สำคัญ" เขาพูดพร้อมหัวเราะเบาๆ ด้วยตัวเอง "ประเด็นที่ต้องพูดถึงตอนนี้คือฮีโมโกลบิน ไม่ต้องสงสัยเลยว่าคุณคงเห็นความสำคัญของค้นพบนี้ของผมอยู่แล้วใช่ไหม?" "มันน่าสนใจในแง่ของเคมีแน่นอน" ฉันตอบ "แต่ในแง่ของความใช้งาน—" "ทำไม คุณไม่เห็นหรือว่ามันเป็นการค้นพบที่มีประโยชน์มากที่สุดในด้านการแพทย์และกฎหมายในหลายปีมานี้ ไม่เห็นหรือว่ามันให้เราการทดสอบที่แม่นยำที่สุดสำหรับรอยเลือดไหม?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and technical content accurately, but the dialogue flow is awkward with repetitive phrasing ('ไม่เห็นหรือว่า' appears twice) and the opening attribution is unclear. The conversational tone and Victorian-era formality are somewhat lost in the Thai rendering.

results.translated_text: ฉันเดินทางไปยังป่าเพื่อใช้ชีวิตอย่างตั้งใจ เผชิญหน้าเพียงข้อเท็จจริงที่จำเป็นของชีวิต และตรวจสอบว่าฉันสามารถเรียนรู้สิ่งที่ชีวิตมีสอนได้หรือไม่ ไม่ให้เมื่อถึงวันตาย ต้องพบว่าตัวเองไม่เคยใช้ชีวิตจริง ฉันไม่ต้องการใช้ชีวิตที่ไม่ใช่ชีวิต การใช้ชีวิตนั้นเป็นสิ่งมีค่ามาก ฉันก็ไม่ต้องการฝึกฝนการยอมรับความจริง ยกเว้นในกรณีที่จำเป็นจริงๆ ฉันต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างลึกซึ้งและดูดซับสารสำคัญทั้งหมดของชีวิต

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning accurately, though some philosophical nuances are lost—particularly the paradoxical tension in 'I did not wish to live what was not life' becomes somewhat mechanical. The Thai reads somewhat stilted and overly literal in places, lacking the lyrical, meditative quality of the original prose.

results.translated_text: เรียกฉันว่าอิชมาเอลเถิด หลายปีก่อน—อย่าไปคิดถึงว่าเป็นเวลานานแค่ไหน—เมื่อฉันมีเงินในกระเป๋าน้อยมากหรือไม่มีเลย และไม่มีอะไรน่าสนใจบนบก ฉันคิดว่าฉันควรออกไปเดินทางทางทะเลสักพัก เพื่อชมโลกที่เป็นน้ำ มันคือวิธีของฉันในการขจัดความหม่นหมองและปรับสมดุลการไหลเวียนของเลือด ทุกครั้งที่ฉันรู้สึกหม่นหมอง ทุกครั้งที่จิตวิญญาณของฉันรู้สึกมืดมนและเศร้าหมองเหมือนเดือนพฤศจิกายนที่มีฝนตกหนัก ฉันก็ถือว่าเป็นเวลาที่ดีที่สุดที่จะออกทะเลโดยเร็วที่สุด

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, but loses some nuance in the archaic formality and poetic compression of the original. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become more literal ('ขจัดความหม่นหมอง'), and the elegant metaphor of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' is somewhat flattened by the addition of 'ฝนตกหนัก' (heavy rain), making it less abstract and more concrete than intended.

results.translated_text: एक ऐसी सच्चाई है जो सारे लोग स्वीकृत करते हैं, कि एक ऐसा आदमी जो अच्छा संपत्ति रखता है, विवाह की आवश्यकता में होता है। चाहे ऐसे आदमी के भावनाओं या विचारों के बारे में कोई भी जानकारी न हो जब वह पहली बार किसी इलाके में प्रवेश करता है, इस सच्चाई को आसपास के परिवारों के मन में इतना ज्ञात होता है कि वह अपनी किसी भी बेटी के लिए सही अधिकारी माना जाता है।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's ironic tone and elegant structure. Grammatical awkwardness ('एक ऐसा आदमी जो अच्छा संपत्ति रखता है') and clunky phrasing ('सही अधिकारी') diminish both fluency and the satirical voice essential to the original.

results.translated_text: स्टूडियो में गुलाब की समृद्ध गंध भरी हुई थी, और जब उस लहरदार गर्मियों के हवा बागान के पेड़ों में हिली, तो खुले दरवाजे से लिलीक की भारी गंध या गुलाब के फूल वाले कील की अधिक सुगंध आई। पर्सियन सिंहासन के दिवान के कोने से जहां वह अपनी आदत के अनुसार असंख्य सिगरेट पर धूम्रपान करते हुए पड़े हुए थे, लॉर्ड हेनरी वॉटन लैबरम के मक्खन सुगंध और मक्खन रंग के फूलों के चमक को अपनी आंखों तक पहुंचा सकते थे।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant issues: 'saddle-bags' is mistranslated as 'सिंहासन' (throne), 'could just catch' becomes awkwardly 'अपनी आंखों तक पहुंचा सकते थे' (could reach to eyes), and the sensory richness of Wilde's aestheticism is diminished by awkward phrasing and grammatical inconsistencies that disrupt the lyrical flow.

results.translated_text: आप अफगानिस्तान में रहे हैं, मैं देखता हूँ।" "आपको कैसे पता चला कि मैं अफगानिस्तान में रहा है?" मैं आश्चर्य से पूछा। "अब इस पर बात न करें," उसने अपने आपको हँसते हुए कहा। "अब के बारे में सवाल हीमोग्लोबिन के है। कोई संदेह नहीं कि आप इस खोज के महत्व को देखते हैं?" "केमिस्ट्री में यह दिलचस्प है, बिल्कुल," मैंने उत्तर दिया, "लेकिन व्यावहारिक रूप से—" "अरे आदमी, यह सालों में सबसे व्यावहारिक चिकित्सा-कानूनी खोज है। क्या आप नहीं देखते कि यह हमें खून के धब्बों के लिए गलत नहीं होने वाला परीक्षण देता है?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains several errors: 'Never mind' is mistranslated as 'अब इस पर बात न करें' (don't talk about this), the dialogue attribution is awkwardly phrased, and 'infallible test' becomes 'गलत नहीं होने वाला परीक्षण' (literally 'not wrong test') rather than a clearer equivalent. The conversational flow and Victorian-era formality are lost, making it read more stiffly than the original.

results.translated_text: मैं जंगल गया क्योंकि मैं सोच-समझकर जीना चाहता था, केवल जीवन के आवश्यक तथ्यों के सामने खड़ा रहूं और देखूं कि क्या मैं जीवन द्वारा सिखाए गए बातों को सीख न सकता हूं, और जब मैं मरता हूं, तो पता चले कि मैंने जीवन नहीं जीता। मैं उस जीवन को नहीं जीना चाहता जिसे जीवन नहीं कहा जाता, क्योंकि जीवन इतना महत्वपूर्ण है; और मैं उदासी का अभ्यास नहीं करना चाहता अगर वह बिल्कुल आवश्यक न हो। मैं गहराई से जीना चाहता था और जीवन के सभी मूल तत्वों को चूस लेना चाहता था।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's core meaning but has notable issues: 'resignation' is rendered as 'उदासी' (sadness) rather than the more appropriate 'त्याग' (renunciation), and the phrase 'living is so dear' becomes awkwardly 'जीवन इतना महत्वपूर्ण है' (life is so important) losing the emotional weight. The prose reads somewhat stilted and lacks the philosophical eloquence of the original, particularly in the final metaphor about 'sucking the marrow of life.'

results.translated_text: मुझे इश्माइल कहिए। कुछ साल पहले—कोई भी विशेष अवधि नहीं—मेरी जेब में बहुत कम या कोई भी पैसा था, और जमीन पर कोई विशेष चीज नहीं थी जो मुझे रुचिकर बनाती, इसलिए मैं सोचा कि मैं कुछ दूर यात्रा करूंगा और दुनिया के जलीय हिस्से को देखूंगा। यह मेरा एक तरीका है, जिससे मैं प्लीहा को दूर करता हूं और रक्त परिसंचरण को नियंत्रित करता हूं। जब मैं अपने मुंह के गंभीर हो जाने के बारे में सोचता हूं; जब मेरे आत्मा में एक नम, बरसाती नवंबर होता है, तो मैं जल्द से जल्द समुद्र के लिए जाने के लिए अपने लिए बहुत अच्छा समय मानता हूं।

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but suffers from awkward phrasing, grammatical issues ("मैं सोचा कि मैं" is incorrect), and fails to preserve Melville's philosophical tone and archaic elegance. Key metaphors like 'spleen' and 'damp, drizzly November' lose their poetic resonance through literal translation.

results.translated_text: এটি একটি সার্বজনীন সত্য যে একজন অবিবাহিত মানুষ যার কাছে ভালো ধন আছে, তিনি কোনো স্ত্রী চান। যতটুকু অজানা থাকুক এমন একজন মানুষের মনের ভাব বা মত যতটুকু অজানা থাকুক তাঁর প্রথম প্রবেশের সময় কোনো পাড়ায়, এই সত্য তাঁর চারপাশের পরিবারগুলির মনে খুব স্পষ্টভাবে স্থাপিত যে তিনি তাদের কোনো একটি কন্যার সম্পত্তি হিসাবে বিবেচিত হন।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but suffers from awkward phrasing, grammatical issues ('তিনি কোনো স্ত্রী চান' is incomplete), and fails to preserve Austen's ironic tone and elegant sentence structure. The complex second sentence becomes convoluted and difficult to parse in Bengali.

results.translated_text: স্টুডিওটি গোলাপের গন্ধে ভরপুর ছিল, এবং যখন হালকা গরম বাতাস বাগানের গাছগুলির মধ্যে দুলছিল, তখন খোলা দরজা দিয়ে লিল্যাকের গুরুতর গন্ধ বা গোলাপ ফুলের বুঝামত চুরমুর সুগন্ধ প্রবেশ করছিল। যে ডিভানে তিনি অসংখ্য সিগারেট খাওয়া তার প্রথিত প্রথা ছিল, সেই পারসিক বাহুবন্ধন দিয়ে তৈরি ডিভানের কোণে থেকে লর্ড হেনরি উটন ল্যাবারনামের মধুর এবং মধুবর্ণ ফুলগুলির আভা দেখতে পাচ্ছিলেন।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'গরম বাতাস' (hot wind) contradicts the original 'light summer wind,' 'খাওয়া' (eating) is incorrect for smoking cigarettes, and 'চুরমুর' is an awkward colloquialism unsuitable for Wilde's aesthetic prose. The sensory richness and refined tone of the original are substantially diminished.

results.translated_text: আপনি আফগানিস্তানে ছিলেন, আমি বুঝতে পেলাম।" "আপনি কিভাবে জানলেন এটা?" আমি বিস্ময়ে জিজ্ঞাসা করলাম। "বাজে বাজে," তিনি নিজে হাসতে হাসতে বললেন। "এখনকার প্রশ্ন হিমোগ্লোবিন সম্পর্কে। নিশ্চয় আপনি আমার এই আবিষ্কারের গুরুত্ব দেখতে পাচ্ছেন?" "রসায়নিকভাবে নিশ্চয় এটি আকর্ষণীয়," আমি উত্তর দিলাম, "কিন্তু প্রায়োগিকভাবে—" "হাঁ, মানুষ, এটি বছরের পর বছর চিকিৎসা-আইনি ক্ষেত্রে সবচেয়ে প্রায়োগিক আবিষ্কার। আপনি কি দেখছেন না যে এটি আমাদের রক্তের দাগের জন্য ত্রুটিহীন পরীক্ষা দেয়?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, including the key plot points and scientific terminology, but suffers from awkward phrasing in places (e.g., 'বাজে বাজে' is unclear, 'হাঁ, মানুষ' feels forced) and loses some of the Victorian-era formality and natural dialogue flow of the original. The technical terms are handled reasonably well, but the overall naturalness of Bengali speech is compromised.

results.translated_text: আমি জঙ্গলে গেলাম কারণ আমি সচেতনভাবে জীবনযাপন করতে চাই, কেবলমাত্র জীবনের অপরিহার্য সত্যগুলির মুখোমুখি হতে চাই এবং দেখতে চাই যে কি শিখতে পারি না যা শিখাবে তা, এবং যখন আমি মৃত্যুর দিকে যাব তখন আমি আসলে জীবন যাপন করিনি এমন কথা আবিষ্কার করি না। আমি যা জীবন নয় তার জীবন যাপন করতে চাইনি, কারণ জীবন অত্যন্ত মূল্যবান; আর আমি অকাম্যতা অনুশীলন করতেও চাইনি, যদি খুব প্রয়োজন না হয়। আমি গভীরভাবে জীবনযাপন করতে চাই এবং জীবনের সমস্ত মাংস বাহু থেকে সাদৃশ্য করতে চাই।

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant grammatical errors, awkward constructions, and meaning distortions that undermine comprehension. Key phrases like 'সাদৃশ্য করতে' (create analogy) for 'suck out all the marrow' are incorrect, and the overall syntax is convoluted, making it difficult to read naturally in Bengali.

results.translated_text: আমাকে আইসমেল বলুন। কয়েক বছর আগে—এখন মনে করুন কতদিন ঠিক হয়েছিল—আমার পকেটে খুব কম বা কোনো টাকা ছিল না, এবং উপকূলে কিছু বিশেষ আকর্ষণ ছিল না, তখন আমি কিছু সময় জলে ভ্রমণ করতে চাইলাম এবং জলের অংশটি দেখতে চাইলাম। এটা আমার একটি উপায় যাতে আমি আমার ক্ষুদ্র বুদ্ধি দূর করতে এবং চক্রানুবর্তন নিয়ন্ত্রণ করতে পারি। যখন আমি আমার মুখ কালো হয়ে যাই, যখন আমার মনে একটি আর্দ্র, ঝোড়ো নভেম্বর হয়, তখন আমি সমুদ্রে যাওয়ার জন্য তাতে আমার সময় হয়ে যায়।

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant meaning distortions and awkward phrasing that obscure the original's philosophical tone. Key phrases like 'driving off the spleen' are mistranslated as 'ক্ষুদ্র বুদ্ধি দূর করতে' (removing small intellect), and the poetic metaphor of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes literal and confusing, failing to capture Melville's introspective archaic style.

results.translated_text: ஒரு மனிதன் செல்வத்தை வைத்திருப்பது என்பது ஒரு பொதுவாக ஏற்றுக்கொள்ளப்படும் உண்மையாகும், அதனால் திருமணம் செய்துகொள்ள வேண்டிய தேவையில் இருக்க வேண்டும். ஒரு மனிதன் ஒரு குடியேற்றத்திற்கு முதல் முறையாக வந்து சேரும்போது அவனது உணர்வுகள் அல்லது கருத்துகள் எவ்வளவு குறைவாக அறியப்பட்டாலும், இந்த உண்மை அவனை சுற்றியுள்ள குடும்பங்களின் மனங்களில் மிகவும் பதிந்திருக்கிறது, இதனால் அவன் தங்கள் மகளில் ஒருவருக்கு சரியான சொத்து என்று கருதப்படுகிறான்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's signature ironic tone and elegant simplicity through awkward phrasing and structural complexity. Key ironic elements like the paradoxical opening are diluted, and the prose reads more mechanical than literary.

results.translated_text: பூக்களின் மிகுந்த புற்று மணம் படிவத்தை நிரப்பியிருந்தது. காலை காற்று மரங்களுக்கிடையே இயங்கியபோது, திறந்த வாசகத்தின் மூலம் பொன்னிப்பூவின் கனமான புற்று மணம் அல்லது சிவப்பு பூக்கள் வளர்ந்த முளையின் மிக மென்மையான துவர்ப்பு வந்தடைந்தது. பெர்சிய குடைகள் மீது வைக்கப்பட்ட படுக்கையின் கோணத்தில் அவர் பல சிகரெட்டுகளை புகைப்பதன் மூலம் வழக்கமான முறையில் படுத்திருந்தார். லாபர்னத்தின் மீன் சுவையான மற்றும் மீன் நிறமான பூக்களின் ஒளி அவர் கவனத்தை ஈர்த்தது.

scores.feedback: The translation attempts to convey the sensory descriptions but contains significant errors: 'படிவத்தை' (form/structure) is incorrect for 'studio', 'புற்று' (shrub) is misused for 'odour', and 'மீன் சுவையான' (fish-flavored) is a nonsensical mistranslation of 'honey-sweet'. The aesthetic refinement and lyrical quality of Wilde's prose are lost, and the Tamil reads awkwardly with grammatical inconsistencies.

results.translated_text: அஃப்கானிஸ்தானில் இருந்து வந்திருக்கிறீர், நான் உறுதியாக கண்டுபிடித்தேன்." "எப்படி என்னை அறிந்தீர்கள்?" என்று நான் அதிர்ச்சியுடன் கேட்டேன். "அதை விட்டுவிடுங்கள்," என்று அவர் தன்னை சிரித்துக் கொண்டிருந்தார். "இப்போது கேள்வி ஹீமோக்குளின் பற்றியது. நிச்சயமாக இந்த கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவதை உங்களுக்கு தெரியும்?" "அது கேமிக்கலாக சுவாரசியமானது, நிச்சயமாக," என்று நான் பதிலளித்தேன், "ஆனால் செயல்பாட்டளவில்—" "ஏன், மனிதனே, இது ஆண்டுகளாக மருத்துவ-தீர்ப்பு துறையில் மிகவும் செயல்பாட்டு கண்டுபிடிப்பு. உங்களுக்கு இது இரத்த தெரிவுக்கு தவறாமல் சோதனையை வழங்குகிறது என்பது தெரியாதா?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains grammatical errors, awkward phrasing, and inconsistent terminology (e.g., 'ஹீமோக்குளின்' vs standard Tamil scientific terms). The dialogue feels stilted and unnatural, losing the Victorian-era conversational flow and Sherlock's characteristic deductive confidence.

results.translated_text: நான் வாழ்வை நேர்மையாக வாழ விரும்பி, வாழ்வின் அடிப்படை உண்மைகளை மட்டுமே முன்னேற்றி, அது என்னை என்ன கற்பிக்க வேண்டும் என்பதை கற்றுக்கொள்ள முடியுமா என்பதை பார்க்க காட்டுக்கு சென்றேன். நான் இறப்பு வரும்போது நான் வாழவில்லை என்பதை கண்டறியாமல் இருக்க விரும்பவில்லை. நான் வாழ்வு அல்லாததை வாழ விரும்பவில்லை, வாழ்வு மிகவும் மதிப்புமிகு; எனவே இல்லாமல் இருப்பதை தவிர்க்க விரும்பவில்லை, அது மிகவும் தேவையானதாக இருக்க வேண்டும். நான் உயிர் முழுமையாக வாழ விரும்பினேன் மற்றும் வாழ்வின் உள்ளுணர்வை முழுமையாக வாங்குவதை விரும்பினேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general philosophical intent but contains significant structural issues and meaning distortions. Phrases like 'முன்னேற்றி' (advance/promote) misrepresent 'front' (confront), and the complex sentence structure becomes fragmented and unclear, losing Thoreau's deliberate rhetorical flow and the profound simplicity of his prose.

results.translated_text: என்னை இசுமாயேல் என்று அழைக்கவும். சில ஆண்டுகளுக்கு முன்பு—நீங்கள் அது எவ்வளவு நேரம் என்பதை கவனிக்க வேண்டாம்—என் கைப்பையில் குறைவான அல்லது எந்த பணமும் இல்லாமல், கடற்கரையில் எது என்னை ஈர்க்க முடியாது, நான் பயணம் செய்ய விரும்பினேன் மற்றும் உலகின் நீர் பகுதியை பார்க்க விரும்பினேன். இது எனது இரத்த சுழற்சியை சீராக்குவதற்கும், எனது உடலில் கோபத்தை தள்ளிவிடுவதற்கும் ஒரு வழியாகும். என் முகம் கருமையாக ஆகும்போதெல்லாம், என் உள்ளத்தில் குளிர்ச்சி மற்றும் கோடை மழையான நவம்பர் இருந்தால், என் கடலுக்கு விரைவாக செல்வது நல்லது என்று நான் கருதுகிறேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'spleen' is mistranslated as 'anger/blood circulation' rather than melancholy, 'damp, drizzly November' becomes confused ('குளிர்ச்சி மற்றும் கோடை மழையான' - cold and summer rain), and the archaic, introspective tone is lost in favor of awkward, literal phrasing that reads unnaturally in Tamil.

results.translated_text: Известно всему миру, что холостой мужчина, обладающий хорошим состоянием, неизбежно нуждается в жене. Независимо от того, насколько мало известны чувства или взгляды такого мужчины при его первом посещении какого-либо района, эта истина настолько глубоко укоренилась в сознании окружающих семей, что он считается достоянием одной из их дочерей.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some of Austen's ironic bite and elegant formality. 'Известно всему миру' is less precise than the original's 'universally acknowledged,' and 'достанием' (property/possession) weakens the satirical edge of 'rightful property.' The phrasing feels more literal and less naturally Russian than Austen's original prose rhythm.

results.translated_text: Студия была наполнена насыщенным ароматом роз, и когда лёгкий летний ветерок колыхался среди деревьев сада, сквозь открытую дверь проникал тяжёлый запах ландыша или более тонкий аромат розового шипа. Сидя на углу дивана, устланного персидскими седельными мешками, где он, как было его привычкой, курил бесчисленное количество сигарет, сэр Генри Ватсон мог едва различить сверкание мёдово-сладких и мёдово-жёлтых цветов лабазника.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most sensory details but contains critical errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'ландыша' (lily of the valley), and 'laburnum' becomes 'лабазника' (meadowsweet), fundamentally altering Wilde's specific botanical imagery. The prose flows reasonably well in Russian but loses some of the original's aesthetic precision and delicate sensory layering.

results.translated_text: Вы были в Афганистане, я понимаю. — Как вы вообще могли это знать? — спросил я, изумленно. — Не стоит, — сказал он, усмехаясь про себя. — Теперь речь идет о гемоглобине. Без сомнения, вы видите значение этого моего открытия? — Безусловно, это интересно с химической точки зрения, — ответил я, — но практически… — Почему, человек, это самое практическое медико-юридическое открытие за годы. Разве вы не видите, что это дает нам непогрешимый тест для обнаружения кровяных пятен?

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but contains awkward phrasings like 'Почему, человек' (literal 'Why, man') and 'за годы' (should be 'за много лет') that disrupt natural Russian flow. The Victorian tone and Holmes's characteristic enthusiasm are somewhat diluted by these infelicities.

results.translated_text: Я пошёл в лес, чтобы жить осознанно, сталкиваться лишь с главными фактами жизни и понять, не смог ли я извлечь из неё уроки, чтобы, умирая, не обнаружить, что не жил. Я не хотел жить тем, что не является жизнью, ведь жизнь так дорога; я не хотел учиться смирению, если это совсем не обязательно. Я хотел жить глубоко и выжать из жизни всё её сокровище.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, though some nuances are lost or altered. The phrase 'see if I could not learn what it had to teach' becomes awkwardly phrased as 'понять, не смог ли я извлечь из неё уроки,' and 'suck out all the marrow' is softened to 'выжать из жизни всё её сокровище' (squeeze out all its treasure), diminishing the visceral intensity of the original metaphor. The fluency is generally good but occasionally stiff, and the philosophical

results.translated_text: Зовите меня Ишмалем. Несколько лет назад — не важно, как долго именно — у меня в кошельке было мало или вовсе не было денег, и на суше меня ничто особенное не интересовало, поэтому я решил немного поплавать и увидеть водную часть мира. Это мой способ избавляться от меланхолии и поддерживать кровообращение в порядке. Каждый раз, когда я чувствую, как мое лицо становится мрачным, каждый раз, когда в моей душе наступает мокрый, дождливый ноябрь, я считаю, что настало время как можно скорее отправиться в море.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning well with only minor deviations (e.g., 'поплавать' suggests casual swimming rather than sailing), and captures the philosophical tone effectively. However, some archaic English nuances are slightly modernized in Russian, and the prose occasionally reads as more formal than the original's conversational intimacy.

results.translated_text: Це така правда, яку визнають усюди, що одинокий чоловік, який має добру фортуну, обов'язково шукає собі дружину. Незважаючи на те, наскільки мало відомі почуття або думки такого чоловіка на початку його в’їзду в сусіднє місцеве населення, ця правда настільки глибоко вкорінена в думках оточуючих родин, що його вважають правомірною власністю однієї чи іншої з їхніх дочок.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic intent reasonably well, but suffers from awkward phrasing and structural issues that diminish readability. Phrases like 'його в'їзду в сусіднє місцеве населення' are clunky compared to the original's elegance, and the overall flow feels more labored than Austen's characteristic wit.

results.translated_text: Студія була наповнена багатим ароматом роз, і коли легкий літній вітер рухався серед дерев саду, через відчинене вороття проникали важкий запах фіалки або навіть тонший аромат рожевоцвітного терну. З кутка дивану із перськими сідлами, на якому він лежав, курив, як було його звичкою, безліч цигарок, Лорд Генрі Ваттон міг лише на мить зловити блиск м’яких і золотистих квітів лабурну.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'фіалки' (violets), 'saddle-bags' becomes 'сідлами' (saddles) losing the object reference, and 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is weakened to 'м'яких і золотистих' (soft and golden). The aesthetic sensibility and precise sensory imagery of Wilde's prose are diminished, and the Ukrainian phrasing feels somewhat awkward in places.

results.translated_text: Ви були в Афганистані, я бачу. — Як на ділі ви це зрозуміли? — запитав я, здивований. — Не зважайте, — сказав він, засміхаючись сам на себе. — Тепер питання в тому, що стосується гемоглобіну. Не сумнівайтеся, ви бачите значення цього моєго відкриття? — Це цікаво, хімічно, без сумніву, — відповів я, — але практично— О, чоловіче, це найбільш практичне медико-правове відкриття за роки. Не бачите, що це дає нам непомильний тест для виявлення кров'яних плям?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive character and Watson's astonishment, though some phrasing feels slightly awkward (e.g., 'засміхаючись сам на себе' is literal rather than idiomatic). The dialogue structure and Victorian tone are mostly preserved, but minor word choices could be more natural in Ukrainian.

results.translated_text: Я пішов у ліс, бо хотів жити обдумано, зустрітися лише з необхідними фактами життя і з'ясувати, чи не можу я навчитися того, чого він навчав, і не виявити, коли прийде час померти, що я не жив. Я не хотів жити тим, чим не є життя, бо життя так багато коштує; ніби не хотів практикувати пригнічення, якщо це дуже необхідно. Я хотів жити глибоко й висмоктати всі кістки життя.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but has notable issues: 'висмоктати всі кістки життя' (suck out all bones) misses the metaphorical richness of 'marrow,' and 'практикувати пригнічення' (practice oppression) is awkward for 'practise resignation.' The phrasing is sometimes stiff and the philosophical cadence of the original is diminished.

results.translated_text: Звоніть мені Ішмаель. Деякі роки тому — не зважаймо на те, наскільки саме давно — маючи в кишені майже нічого, або взагалі нічого, і нічого особливого, що б зацікавило мене на суші, я подумав, що зайду трохи на море й побачу водну частину світу. Це моє звичайне заняття — відводити печінку й регулювати кровообіг. Коли я починаю зневажливо дивитися, коли в моїй душі мокрий, дощовий листопад — я вважаю, що найкращий час вирушити на море, як тільки можна.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative but contains significant errors: 'Звоніть мені' (literally 'call/ring me') is incorrect—should be 'Називайте мене' or 'Зовіть мене'; 'відводити печінку' (drive off the liver) misses the idiomatic 'spleen'; 'зневажливо дивитися' (look contemptuously) doesn't match 'growing grim'; and the archaic, contemplative tone of the original is lost in favor of more modern phrasing. The translation reads awkwardly and fails to preserve Melville's distinctive voic

results.translated_text: إنها حقيقة معروفة على نطاق واسع أن كل رجل أعزب يمتلك ثروة كبيرة يجب أن يكون بحاجة إلى زوجة. مهما كانت مشاعر أو آراء هذا الرجل مجهولة عند دخوله لأول مرة إلى منطقة ما، فإن هذه الحقيقة مثبتة بوضوح في أذهان العائلات المحيطة به، بحيث يُعتبر ملكًا مضمونًا لواحدة من بناتهن على الأرجح.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, though 'معروفة على نطاق واسع' (widely known) slightly softens the universality of 'universally acknowledged,' and some phrasing feels slightly more literal than the elegant flow of Austen's original prose.

results.translated_text: كان الاستوديو ممتلئًا برائحة الورود الغنية، وإذا هبّت الرياح الخفيفة في صيفها بين أشجار الحديقة، جاء من الباب المفتوح رائحة البنفسج الثقيلة، أو العطر الأرقى للشوك المزهري الوردي. من زاوية الديوان المغطى بحقائب السرج الفارسية التي كان ينام عليها، مُدخّنًا، كما كان عادته، عددًا لا نهائيًا من السجائر، يستطيع اللورد هنري ووتن رؤية لمعان أزهار البلاطوم التي تشبه العسل في الحلاوة ولونها.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'البنفسج' (violet), 'laburnum' becomes 'البلاطوم' (sycamore), and the sensory aestheticism is diluted by awkward phrasing and structural issues that disrupt Wilde's flowing, luxurious prose rhythm.

results.translated_text: لقد كنت في أفغانستان، أدرك. كيف بالله عرفت بذلك؟ سألتُ بدهشة. لا داعي للقلق، قال وهو يبتسم لنفسه. السؤال الآن هو حول الهيموجلوبين. بلا شك ترى أهمية هذا الاكتشاف الذي قمت به؟ بالطبع، إنه مثير من الناحية الكيميائية، لكن عمليًا — يا إنسان، إنه الاكتشاف الطبي والقانوني الأكثر عملية في السنوات الأخيرة. ألا ترى أن هذا يمنحنا اختبارًا لا يخطئ لبقع الدم؟

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but has significant structural issues: the opening phrase 'لقد كنت في أفغانستان، أدرك' is grammatically awkward and doesn't properly convey Holmes's deductive statement. Dialogue attribution is unclear in places, and the conversational flow is disrupted by awkward phrasing like 'لا داعي للقلق' (don't worry) instead of the more appropriate dismissive tone. The Victorian-era detective voice and Sherlock's characteristic arrogance are diminished.

results.translated_text: ذهبت إلى الغابة لأنني أردت العيش بشكل واعٍ، والتوجه فقط إلى الحقائق الأساسية للحياة، ولأرى ما إذا كنت أستطيع تعلمه، ولن أكتشف عند موتي أنني لم أعيش. لم أرغب في العيش في ما ليس الحياة، فالحياة ثمينة جداً؛ ولم أرغب في ممارسة الاستسلام إلا إذا كان ضرورياً. أردت العيش بعمق وسحب كل العُظم من الحياة.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, though some nuances are lost—particularly the poetic force of 'front only the essential facts' and the metaphorical richness of 'suck out all the marrow.' The Arabic reads naturally but occasionally feels more literal than the original's lyrical philosophical tone.

results.translated_text: اسماوني إسماعيل. قبل سنوات قليلة—لا داعي للتوسع في التفاصيل—مع غياب المال تقريبًا في جيبي، ولا شيء يثير اهتمامي على اليابسة، فقررت أن أسير في رحلات بحرية قصيرة لأرى الجزء المائي من العالم. إنها طريقة أتبعها لطرد الغضب وتنظيم الدورة الدموية. كلما شعرت بظلام يخيم على وجهي، أو شعرت بحزن عميق يخيم على روحي مثل نوفمبر رطب وممطر، أعتبر تلك اللحظة مناسبة للانطلاق إلى البحر فورًا.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, with appropriate handling of Melville's introspective tone. However, some nuances are lost: 'spleen' is translated as 'غضب' (anger) rather than the more accurate 'الاكتئاب' (melancholy), and the archaic, meditative quality of the original prose is somewhat diminished by more straightforward phrasing, though the Arabic remains fluent and readable.

results.translated_text: האמת המוכחת באופן כללי היא שرجل נשוי שבעלתו מוניטין טוב חייב להיות בצרה של נישום. עם זאת, גם אם הרגשות והעמדות של איש כזה ידועות מעט מאוד כאשר הוא פונה לראשונה ל الحي, האמת הזו נשמרת היטב בחובשות של המשפחות הסובבות אותו, כך שהוא נחשב לממון מוצדק של אחת מה딸ות שלהם.

scores.feedback: This translation is severely compromised by multiple critical errors: it contains untranslated Arabic and Korean text mixed into Hebrew, fundamentally misrepresents the meaning (changing 'single man' to 'married man'), uses incorrect Hebrew vocabulary ('נישום' is not a real word), and completely fails to preserve Austen's ironic tone and elegant prose structure. The translation is essentially unusable.

results.translated_text: הסטודיו נמלא בסם עז של שיחים, וכאשר הרוח הקלה של הקיץ הבהילה בין העצים בגינה, הגיעה דרך הדלת הפתוחה ריח עז של לילך, או הריח הדק יותר של תרנגולת צהובה. מפינה של הספסל הפרסי שבו הוא נ lies, מעשן, כפי שמהווה לו הרגל, מספר cigarettes אינסופיות, אב"ד ווטון יכול היה בדיוק לראות את ניצוץ של פרחים של לברנום שמחוברים בדבש וצבע דבש.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors including untranslated English words ('lies', 'cigarettes'), incorrect botanical terms ('תרנגולת צהובה' means chicken, not thorn), and awkward phrasing that obscures Wilde's sensory elegance. The poetic flow and aesthetic precision of the original are largely lost.

results.translated_text: "אתה היה באפגניסטן, אני מפקיר." "איך לעזאזל ידעת את זה?" שאלתי בהלצה. "לא נורא," אמר הוא, צוחק לעצמו. "השאלה עכשיו היא על הämoglobin. אין ספק שאתה רואה את החשיבות של גילויי הזה?" "זה מעניין, כימית, אין ספק," עניתי, "אבל בפועל—" "למה, אדם, זהו הגילוי המונחה-قانونי самый מעשי לسنوات. לא רואים שנותן לנו מבחן בלתי מזדה לטביעות דם?"

scores.feedback: This translation is severely compromised by multiple critical errors: untranslated English words (haemoglobin), mixed languages (Arabic script, Cyrillic), grammatical mistakes ("אתה היה" should be "היית"), and nonsensical phrases ("מפקיר," "מונחה-قانونی"). The text is essentially unusable and fails on all evaluation criteria.

results.translated_text: לפני שהלכתי ליער רציתי לחיות בכוונה, ל直面 רק את الحقائق הבסיסיות של החיים, ולראות אם אצליח ללמוד מה יש לה ללמד, ולא, כשיגיע הזמן למות, לגלות שלא חייתי. לא רציתי לחיות משהו שאינו חיים, שכן החיים כל כך יקרים; וגם לא רציתי לתרגל נחתנות, אלא אם כן הייתה דרישה חמורה. רציתי לחיות עמוק ולהשאף את כל המרקם של החיים.

scores.feedback: The translation contains critical errors including mixed language contamination (Chinese and Arabic characters embedded in Hebrew text), incorrect phrase constructions, and significant meaning distortions that severely compromise comprehension and readability. The philosophical depth and eloquence of Thoreau's original prose is completely lost.

results.translated_text: зовני אותי יִשְׁמָעֵל. לפני מספר שנים—לא נצטער על היקף המדויק—עם מעט או כלום בקופתי, ולא היה משהו מיוחד שיגרוף אותי על היבשה, חשבתי שאצא לדרך ימית קצת ולקראת חלק המים של העולם. זהו דרך יש לי להיפטר מהמרחה ולשמור על הדם. כל זמן שאני מוצא את עצמי מתעכב על הפה; כל זמן שבסלמי יש נובמבר רטוב ומזופף, אני מחשיב את זה זמן מדויק לצאת לים כמה שיותר מהר.

scores.feedback: The translation contains a Cyrillic character at the start ('зовни' instead of Hebrew), numerous mistranslations ('קופתי' for purse is awkward, 'מרחה' misses 'spleen', 'סלמי' is nonsensical), and fails to capture Melville's contemplative, philosophical tone. The archaic literary style is completely lost, replaced by awkward, unnatural Hebrew phrasing.

results.translated_text: C'est une vérité universellement reconnue qu'un homme célibataire, possédant une bonne fortune, doit nécessairement être à la recherche d'une épouse. Cependant, peu importe à quel point les sentiments ou les idées de cet homme sont ignorés à son arrivée dans le voisinage, cette vérité est si bien ancrée dans l'esprit des familles environnantes qu'il est considéré comme le bien propre de l'une ou l'autre de leurs filles.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, with accurate rendering of Austen's opening sentiment. However, some phrasings like 'peu importe à quel point' and 'bien propre' slightly deviate from the elegant simplicity of the original, and the rhythm of Austen's prose is somewhat diminished in places.

results.translated_text: Le studio était rempli de l'odeur riche des roses, et quand la légère brise d'été soufflait parmi les arbres du jardin, le lourd parfum du lilas ou le parfum plus délicat de l'églantine en fleur parvenait par la porte ouverte. Du coin du divan garni de sacs de selle persans, sur lequel il était allongé, fumant comme c'était son habitude des centaines de cigarettes, Lord Henry Wotton pouvait à peine apercevoir l'éclat des fleurs mielleuses et mielées du laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'innumerable cigarettes' becomes 'des centaines de cigarettes' (hundreds), which slightly diminishes the hyperbolic effect. The sensory richness is mostly maintained, but the French phrasing feels occasionally stiff compared to Wilde's flowing aestheticism, particularly in the final clause structure.

results.translated_text: « Je remarque que vous avez été en Afghanistan », dit-il. « Comment diable avez-vous su cela ? » demandai-je, étonné. « Ne vous en faites pas », dit-il, riant doucement. « La question porte désormais sur l'hémoglobine. Sans doute voyez-vous l'importance de cette découverte ? » « C'est intéressant, sur le plan chimique, sans doute », répondis-je, « mais pratiquement — » « Mon Dieu, c'est la découverte la plus pratique en matière médico-légale depuis des années. Ne voyez-vous pas qu'elle nous offre un test infaillible pour les taches de sang ? »

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with appropriate French phrasing and vocabulary choices. Minor stylistic adjustments (e.g., 'riant doucement' vs. 'chuckling to himself,' 'Mon Dieu' vs. 'Why, man') slightly soften the Victorian tone and character voice.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je voulais vivre délibérément, ne faire face qu'aux faits essentiels de la vie, et voir si je ne pouvais pas apprendre ce qu'elle avait à m'enseigner, et ne pas, en arrivant à la mort, découvrir que je n'avais pas vécu. Je ne voulais pas vivre ce qui n'était pas la vie, la vie est si précieuse ; ni ne voulais-je pratiquer la résignation, à moins que ce ne fût absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre profondément et sucer toute la moelle de la vie.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency with strong equivalents like 'vivre délibérément' and 'sucer toute la moelle de la vie.' Minor fluency issues exist ('ne faire face qu'aux' is slightly awkward, and 'ni ne voulais-je' uses formal inversion that slightly disrupts rhythm), but the contemplative tone and rhetorical power are well maintained overall.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ishmaël. Il y a quelques années, peu importe combien de temps exactement, n'ayant guère d'argent dans ma bourse et rien de particulier pour m'intéresser à terre, je me suis dit que je ferais un petit voyage en mer pour voir les eaux du monde. C'est une façon que j'ai de chasser le spleen et de réguler ma circulation. Chaque fois que je me sens sombre sur le visage, chaque fois qu'un novembre humide et pluvieux règne dans mon âme, je considère qu'il est grand temps de gagner la mer dès que possible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some nuance and poetic quality. Key issues: 'growing grim about the mouth' becomes 'sombre sur le visage' (gloomy on the face), which is less idiomatic; 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' loses the metaphorical depth; 'sail about' becomes 'voyage en mer' which is more formal than the original's casual tone. The archaic, introspective voice is somewhat flattened.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine allgemein anerkannte Wahrheit, dass ein unverheirateter Mann mit gutem Vermögen unbedingt eine Frau sucht. Wie wenig auch die Empfindungen oder Ansichten eines solchen Mannes bei seinem ersten Eintreffen in einer Gegend bekannt sein mögen, diese Wahrheit ist den umliegenden Familien so fest in den Köpfen verankert, dass er als rechtliches Eigentum einer oder anderer ihrer Töchter gilt.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures most of Austen's ironic tone, though 'unbedingt' slightly weakens the original's sardonic certainty, and 'rechtliches Eigentum' adds a legal specificity not present in the original. The prose reads naturally in German but with minor awkwardness in phrasing that a native speaker might refine.

results.translated_text: Das Studio war erfüllt vom reichen Aroma der Rosen, und als der leichte Sommerwind durch die Bäume des Gartens strich, drang durch die offene Tür der schwere Duft der Lilie oder der zartere Duft des rosa blühenden Weißdorns. Aus der Ecke des Divans, auf dem persische Satteltaschen lagen und auf dem er lag, rauchend wie gewohnt unzählige Zigaretten, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade den Glanz der honigsüßen und honigfarbenen Blüten eines Laburnums erkennen.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meanings accurately, though 'Lilie' (lily) for 'lilac' is a significant error that affects botanical accuracy. The sentence structure becomes awkward in German, particularly the clause about the divan and cigarettes, disrupting the flowing sensory rhythm of Wilde's original prose.

results.translated_text: Sie waren in Afghanistan, wie ich sehe. „Wie zum Teufel haben Sie das herausgefunden?“, fragte ich verblüfft. „Ach, das ist unwichtig“, sagte er und lachte leise vor sich hin. „Jetzt geht es um Hämoglobin. Sie sehen zweifellos die Bedeutung meiner Entdeckung?“ „Es ist chemisch zweifellos interessant, praktisch aber—“ „Mein Lieber, das ist die praktischste medizinisch-rechtliche Entdeckung der letzten Jahre. Sehen Sie nicht, dass dies einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren bietet?“

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with appropriate register shifts between Watson and Holmes. Minor points: 'Wie zum Teufel' is slightly more colloquial than the original's 'How on earth,' and 'Mein Lieber' adds formality not present in 'Why, man,' but these choices work well for German conventions and maintain the character dynamics effectively.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich absichtsvoll leben wollte, nur den wesentlichen Tatsachen des Lebens gegenüberstehen und sehen, ob ich nicht lernen könnte, was es zu lehren hatte, und nicht, wenn ich starb, feststellen, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht leben, was kein Leben war, denn das Leben ist so kostbar; und ich wollte auch nicht Resignation üben, es sei denn, es war unbedingt notwendig. Ich wollte tief leben und das gesamte Mark des Lebens herauspressen.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and deliberate intensity well, with strong choices like 'absichtsvoll' and 'das Mark des Lebens herauspressen.' Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'nur den wesentlichen Tatsachen des Lebens gegenüberstehen' and the somewhat stiff 'feststellen, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte,' which slightly diminish the natural flow of the original's rhythmic prose.

results.translated_text: Nenn mich Ishmael. Vor einigen Jahren – es spielt keine Rolle, wie lange es her ist –, als ich kaum oder kein Geld in der Tasche hatte und an Land nichts Besonderes, was mich interessierte, dachte ich, ich würde ein wenig segeln und die Wasserwelt erkunden. Es ist eine Art, den Spleen zu vertreiben und die Durchblutung zu regulieren. Jedes Mal, wenn ich merke, dass mein Mund grimmig wird; wenn in meiner Seele ein feuchter, nieseliger November herrscht, halte ich es für höchste Zeit, so schnell wie möglich aufs Meer zu gehen.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and philosophical tone well, with accurate rendering of key metaphors like 'spleen' and the November imagery. However, some phrasings feel slightly stiff ('es spielt keine Rolle' is more casual than the original's parenthetical aside, and 'aufs Meer zu gehen' is less idiomatic than 'to sea'), and the archaic, introspective voice could be more elegantly rendered to fully capture Melville's distinctive narrative intimacy.

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero con fortuna debe necesitar una esposa. Aunque poco se conozcan los sentimientos o opiniones de tal hombre al llegar por primera vez a un vecindario, esta verdad está tan firmemente arraigada en la mente de las familias circundantes que se le considera como la propiedad legítima de alguna de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and ironic tone effectively, with accurate rendering of Austen's social commentary. Minor fluency issues include 'necesitar' (need) being slightly weaker than 'must be in want of,' and the phrasing feels marginally more direct than the original's elaborate irony.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del intenso aroma de las rosas, y cuando la suave brisa de verano agitaba los árboles del jardín, llegaba a través de la puerta abierta el intenso aroma de los lilas o el perfume más delicado del espino en flor rosa. Desde la esquina del diván de cojines persas sobre el que yacía, fumando, como era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton podía apenas captar el destello de las flores melosas y de color miel del laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys most meanings but loses some nuance in the aesthetic precision—'intenso aroma' is repeated awkwardly where Wilde varies his sensory language, and 'flores melosas' is less elegant than the original's poetic 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured blossoms.' The fluency is generally natural but occasionally stiff, particularly in the phrase 'del espino en flor rosa' which feels less graceful than the source.

results.translated_text: "Ve que has estado en Afganistán", dije. "¿Cómo diablos lo supiste?" pregunté, asombrado. "Olvida eso", respondió él, riéndose para sí mismo. "Lo importante ahora es la hemoglobina. Seguro que comprendes la importancia de este descubrimiento mío." "Es interesante desde el punto de vista químico, sin duda", contesté, "pero prácticamente..." "¡Vamos, hombre! Es el descubrimiento más práctico en años para el ámbito médico-legal. ¿No ves que nos ofrece una prueba infalible para detectar manchas de sangre?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning but contains a critical error in the opening line (incorrectly attributes Holmes's observation to Watson), and loses the natural dialogue flow and Victorian formality of the original. The technical terminology is handled well, but the conversational tone and character voice are noticeably altered.

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir deliberadamente, afrontar solo los hechos esenciales de la vida y ver si no podía aprender lo que tenía que enseñarme, sin descubrir, cuando llegara mi hora de morir, que no había vivido. No quería vivir lo que no era vida, pues vivir es tan precioso; tampoco quería practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera absolutamente necesaria. Quería vivir profundamente y sacar toda la médula de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with excellent fidelity, capturing key concepts like 'deliberately,' 'essential facts,' and the vivid 'marrow of life' metaphor. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'lo que tenía que enseñarme' and the restructured conditional clause, which slightly diminish the original's rhythmic power, though the philosophical weight remains intact.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ishmael. Hace algunos años—no importa cuánto tiempo exactamente—con muy poco o nada en mi bolsa y nada particular que me interesara en tierra, pensé que navegaría un poco y vería la parte acuática del mundo. Es una manera que tengo de deshacerme de la melancolía y regular la circulación. Cada vez que me encuentro con el semblante sombrío o cuando en mi alma reina un noviembre húmedo y lluvioso, considero que es hora de salir a mar lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice well, though some nuances are lost—'driving off the spleen' becomes 'deshacerme de la melancolía' (getting rid of melancholy) which slightly simplifies the original's medical-philosophical tone, and 'parte acuática' is more clinical than the poetic 'watery part.' The archaic literary style is somewhat diminished in the Spanish version, which reads more contemporary despite generally natural phrasing.

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che un uomo celibe in possesso di una buona fortuna deve necessariamente cercare una moglie. Tuttavia, nonostante i sentimenti o le opinioni di un simile uomo possano essere poco noti al suo primo arrivo in un paese, questa verità è così ben radicata nella mente delle famiglie circostanti che egli è considerato come la proprietà legittima di una delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains Austen's ironic tone well, though 'deve necessariamente cercare' is slightly more direct than the original's subtle 'must be in want of.' The prose flows naturally in Italian, though the opening's famous irony could be marginally sharper.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era pieno del profumo ricco delle rose, e quando la lieve brezza estiva agitava gli alberi del giardino, attraverso la porta aperta giungeva il profumo pesante del lilà o la fragranza più delicata della robinia a fiori rosa. Dall'angolo del divano ricoperto di sacchi da sella persiani, su cui era disteso fumando, come era sua abitudine, innumerevoli sigarette, Lord Henry Wotton riusciva appena a cogliere il bagliore dei fiori dolci come il miele e di colore dorato del laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys most meanings and preserves the aesthetic sensibility, though 'robinia a fiori rosa' (locust tree with pink flowers) is a questionable botanical choice for 'pink-flowering thorn,' and the phrase 'dolci come il miele e di colore dorato' slightly flattens Wilde's poetic 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured.' The prose flows reasonably well but lacks some of the original's lyrical elegance.

results.translated_text: "Sei stato in Afghanistan, lo percepisco." "Come diavolo hai fatto a saperlo?" chiesi con stupore. "Non importa," disse lui, ridacchiando tra sé. "La domanda ora riguarda l'emoglobina. Senza dubbio vedi l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?" "È interessante, dal punto di vista chimico, senza dubbio," risposi, "ma praticamente—" "Ma insomma, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non vedi che ci offre un test infallibile per le macchie di sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. Minor stylistic considerations: 'lo percepisco' is slightly formal compared to Holmes's casual tone, and 'Ma insomma' adds emphasis not present in the original 'Why, man,' though both work contextually.

results.translated_text: Sono andato nella foresta perché desideravo vivere deliberatamente, affrontare solo i fatti essenziali della vita e vedere se non avrei potuto imparare ciò che essa aveva da insegnare, senza scoprire, quando fossi morto, di non aver vissuto. Non desideravo vivere ciò che non era vita, la vita è così cara; né volevo praticare la rinuncia, se non era assolutamente necessaria. Volevo vivere a fondo e succhiare tutto il midollo della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency, with excellent handling of key concepts like 'deliberately' and 'suck out all the marrow.' Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'affrontare solo i fatti essenziali' and the conditional construction 'se non era assolutamente necessaria' which slightly softens the original's intensity, but overall maintains the contemplative, declarative style effectively.

results.translated_text: Chiamami Ishmael. Qualche anno fa – non importa esattamente quanto tempo – avendo poco o niente in tasca e nulla di particolare che mi interessasse sulla terraferma, pensai di fare un piccolo giro per mare e vedere la parte acquatica del mondo. È un modo che ho per scacciare il spleen e regolare la circolazione. Ogni volta che mi accorgo di diventare cupo in volto; ogni volta che nel mio animo si fa un novembre umido e piovoso, considero che è tempo di andare in mare il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning accurately with only minor deviations (e.g., 'spleen' kept untranslated rather than explained), and maintains the archaic tone reasonably well. However, some phrasings feel slightly awkward in Italian ('la parte acquatica del mondo' is literal but less elegant than possible alternatives), and the poetic melancholy of the original is marginally diminished.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida que um homem solteiro, possuindo uma boa fortuna, deve estar à procura de uma esposa.
