Embora pouco se conheçam os sentimentos ou opiniões desse homem ao entrar pela primeira vez na vizinhança, essa verdade está tão firmemente estabelecida na mente das famílias circunvizinhas que ele é considerado como propriedade legítima de uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's meaning and ironic tone, with excellent vocabulary choices like 'verdade universalmente reconhecida' and 'propriedade legítima.' Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'pouco se conheçam' and 'circunvizinhas' that could be more natural, though the overall style and formal register are well-maintained.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava cheio do perfume rico de rosas, e quando a leve brisa de verão agitava as árvores do jardim, através da porta aberta vinha o perfume intenso do lilás ou o perfume mais delicado do espinheiro de flores rosa. Do canto do divã de almofadas persas de sela, sobre o qual ele estava deitado, fumando inúmeros cigarros, como era seu costume, Lord Henry Wotton podia apenas avistar o brilho das flores do laburno, doces como mel e de cor melada.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'almofadas persas de sela' is slightly awkward for 'Persian saddle-bags' and the poetic phrase 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes more literal as 'doces como mel e de cor melada.' The aesthetic sensibility is mostly maintained but with minor losses in lyrical flow and elegance.

results.translated_text: Percebo que você esteve no Afeganistão. “Como diabos você soube disso?” perguntei, espantado. “Deixe pra lá,” disse ele, rindo para si mesmo. “A questão agora é sobre a hemoglobina. Sem dúvida você vê a importância desta minha descoberta?” “É interessante, do ponto de vista químico, sem dúvida,” respondi, “mas praticamente—” “Pois, homem, é a descoberta mais prática no campo médico-legal nos últimos anos. Você não vê que isso nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment, though some phrasing feels slightly formal and the colloquial tone of the original dialogue is somewhat diminished. Minor issues include 'Deixe pra lá' being more casual than the original 'Never mind,' and 'Pois, homem' lacking the natural flow of 'Why, man.'

results.translated_text: Fui à floresta porque desejava viver deliberadamente, enfrentar apenas os fatos essenciais da vida e ver se não poderia aprender o que ela tinha a ensinar, para não descobrir, ao chegar à morte, que não tinha vivido. Não queria viver o que não era vida, pois a vida é tão preciosa; tampouco queria praticar a resignação, a menos que fosse absolutamente necessária. Queria viver a fundo e sugar toda a essência da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with excellent fidelity, capturing key concepts like deliberate living and life's essence. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in the conditional structure and 'sugar' (sugar out) being less idiomatic in Portuguese than the original, though 'sugar toda a essência' effectively conveys the metaphor.

results.translated_text: Chama-me Ishmael. Há alguns anos — não importa exatamente há quanto tempo —, tendo pouco ou nenhum dinheiro no bolso e nada de particular que me interessasse na terra firme, pensei em navegar um pouco e ver a parte aquática do mundo. É uma maneira que tenho de afastar o spleen e regular a circulação. Sempre que me vejo com a boca carrancuda; sempre que minha alma é um novembro úmido e chuvoso, considero que é hora de ir para o mar assim que puder.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meanings accurately, though 'com a boca carrancuda' (with a frowning mouth) slightly simplifies Melville's 'growing grim about the mouth.' The fluency is generally natural but occasionally feels slightly formal; 'parte aquática' is accurate but less poetic than the original's 'watery part,' and retaining 'spleen' in Portuguese works well for the archaic tone, though the overall rhythm is somewhat less flowing than the English original.

results.translated_text: Powszechnie przyjęta prawda jest taka, że pan samotny posiadający dobry majątek musi szukać żony. Choćby niewiele znane były uczucia lub poglądy takiego mężczyzny na początku jego przybycia do sąsiedztwa, ta prawda jest tak głęboko zakorzeniona w umysłach sąsiednich rodzin, że jest uważany za prawomocną własność jednej z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and preserves Austen's ironic tone, though 'powszechnie przyjęta prawda' is slightly less elegant than the original's declarative opening. Minor awkwardness in phrasing ('jest uważany za prawomocną własność') slightly disrupts the natural flow compared to the source's sophisticated irony.

results.translated_text: Studio było wypełnione gęstym zapachem róż, a gdy lekki letni wiatr poruszał gałęziami ogrodu, przez otwarte drzwi dobiegał ciężki zapach lilii lub delikatniejszy aromat różowej kwitnącej róży. Z rogu divanu z perskich torb siodłowych, na którym leżał, paląc jak to było jego zwyczajem niezliczone papierosy, Lord Henry Wotton mógł dostrzec blask miodowych i miodowatych kwiatów laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'lilii' (lilies), and 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'różowej kwitnącej róży' (pink flowering rose), losing botanical precision. The prose feels awkward and clunky compared to Wilde's flowing aestheticism, with phrases like 'jak to było jego zwyczajem' disrupting the elegant rhythm of the original.

results.translated_text: „Byłeś w Afganistanie, widzę.” „Skąd w ogóle to wiedziałeś?” zapytałem z zdumieniem. „Nie ma za co,” powiedział, uśmiechając się cicho. „Teraz pytanie dotyczy hemoglobiny. Na pewno widzisz znaczenie mojego odkrycia?” „Jest ciekawe z chemii, na pewno,” odpowiedziałem, „ale praktycznie—” „Dlaczego, człowieku, to jest najbardziej praktyczne odkrycie medyko-prawne w ostatnich latach. Nie widzisz, że daje nam nieomylny test na plamy krwi?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue structure of the original, with Holmes's deductive character and Watson's astonishment well conveyed. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing ('Nie ma za co' is colloquial for 'Never mind'), and the style loses some of the Victorian formality and Holmes's distinctive intellectual tone present in the original.

results.translated_text: Poszedłem do lasu, ponieważ chciałem żyć celowo, stawić czoła jedynie istotnym faktom życia i zobaczyć, czy nie mogę się nauczyć, czego mi ma nauczyć, a nie odkryć, że nie żyłem, kiedy przyjdzie mi umrzeć. Nie chciałem żyć tym, co nie było życiem, bo życie jest tak cenne, ani chciałem praktykować rezygnacji, chyba że było to konieczne. Chciałem żyć głęboko i wycisnąć z życia całą miazgę.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and intent very well, capturing the deliberate life philosophy and the famous 'suck out all the marrow' metaphor effectively with 'wycisnąć z życia całą miazgę.' Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing in places (e.g., 'czego mi ma nauczyć' is somewhat clunky), and the prose reads as translated rather than naturally composed, though the philosophical tone and style are well maintained overall.

results.translated_text: Nazywaj mnie Ishmael. Niektóre lata temu — nie ma to znaczenia, jak długo to trwało — mając w portfelu mało pieniędzy i niczego konkretnego, co by mnie zainteresowało na lądzie, postanowiłem nieco popłynąć i zobaczyć wodną część świata. To jest sposób, w jaki pozbywam się złego humoru i reguluję krążenie. Kiedy zauważam, że moje usta stają się ponure, kiedy w mojej duszy panuje wilgotny, deszczowy listopad, uważam, że nadszedł czas, by jak najszybciej udać się na morze.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but loses the archaic, contemplative tone of Melville's prose. Phrases like 'pozbywam się złego humoru' feel modern and colloquial rather than elevated, and 'Kiedy zauważam, że moje usta stają się ponure' is awkwardly literal, missing the introspective melancholy of the original.

results.translated_text: 凡是有钱的单身汉，总需要娶位太太，这已经成了一条举世公认的真理。然而，不管这位先生初次踏入邻里时内心如何，周围人家早已认定，他必定是某位小姐的未婚夫。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and maintains readability in Chinese, but loses some of Austen's signature ironic bite and the nuanced phrase 'rightful property' is simplified to 'fiancé,' which weakens the satirical critique of how women are viewed as possessions.

results.translated_text: 书房里弥漫着浓郁的玫瑰香气。当夏日的微风轻拂花园中的树木时，敞开的门扉间飘来紫丁香的浓香，或是粉花荆棘那更为清雅的芬芳。亨利·沃顿勋爵正躺在铺着波斯鞍袋的长沙发上，照例抽着烟，从沙发一角，他刚好能瞥见金合欢那蜜甜、蜜色花朵的微光。

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves the sensory richness and aesthetic qualities of Wilde's prose, with excellent rendering of the floral imagery and atmospheric details. Minor points: '书房' (study/studio) is slightly narrower than 'studio,' and the poetic flow of the original's compound descriptors is marginally compressed, though the Chinese maintains elegant parallelism and maintains the decadent tone effectively.

results.translated_text: “我推断你曾到过阿富汗。”“你究竟是怎么知道的？”我惊讶地问道。“别管了，”他自嘲地笑了笑，“现在的问题是关于血红蛋白的。想必你明白我这个发现的意义吧？”“从化学角度看，这确实有趣，”我答道，“但实际应用上——”“这可是近年来最实用的法医学发现！你难道没意识到它能提供一种绝对可靠的血迹检测法吗？”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue flow of the original text, with proper preservation of Holmes's deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include '自嘲地笑了笑' (self-mockingly) which slightly misinterprets 'chuckling to himself' (more self-satisfied than self-mocking), and the style is slightly more formal than the original Victorian-era conversational tone.

results.translated_text: 我步入森林，是因为我想认真生活，直面生命的本质，看看能否领悟它所要传授的智慧，以免在生命终结时，才惊觉自己从未真正活过。我不愿过那种非真正的生活，因为生命如此珍贵；也不愿轻易屈从于无奈，除非万不得已。我渴望深入生活，汲取生命的精髓。

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and existential concerns with strong fidelity, preserving key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's essence. Minor accuracy issues include 'front' rendered as 'direct face' (slightly weakening the confrontational tone) and slight compression of nuance, but the Chinese flows naturally with appropriate formality for philosophical prose.

results.translated_text: 叫我以实玛利。几年前——实在记不清是多久了——我身上几乎没什么钱，岸上又没什么特别吸引我的事，便想出海转转，看看这世界的水边风光。这正是我驱散闷气、调节身心的法子。每当我的面容阴沉下来，每当心头阴雨连绵的十一月降临，我就觉得该尽快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning and philosophical tone of the opening effectively, with natural Chinese phrasing. However, some archaic literary qualities and specific metaphorical nuances (like 'spleen' and 'circulation') are slightly simplified, and the meditative rhythm of the original prose is marginally diminished.

results.translated_text: 世人公認，凡家資豐厚的單身漢，必定需要娶妻。儘管這位先生初入鄰里時，其性情或見解尚不為人所知，但此理已深植於鄰近各戶心中，他自然被視為某位女兒的當然夫婿。

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with natural Chinese phrasing. However, the distinctive ironic voice—particularly the sardonic understatement of 'However little known'—is slightly softened by the more straightforward rendering '儘管...尚不為人所知,' losing some of the original's subtle wit.

results.translated_text: 工作室裡瀰漫著玫瑰的濃郁芬芳，當輕柔的夏日微風掠過花園樹梢，從敞開的門扉透入丁香的濃郁芬芳，或粉花荊棘更為清雅的幽香。從波斯鞍袋堆疊的長榻一角，他如慣常般吸著煙，無數煙蒂散落四周，亨利·沃頓勛爵可瞥見金雀花蜜意甜香、蜜色花蕊的微光。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and aesthetic details of the original, with good vocabulary choices for the floral imagery. However, there are some awkward phrasings ("無數煙蒂散落四周" misses the nuance of "innumerable cigarettes" as an ongoing habit), and the sentence structure becomes somewhat convoluted in places, affecting natural readability in Chinese.

results.translated_text:
「你曾到過阿富汗，我猜測。」
「你怎麼會知道的？」我驚訝地問。
「不必多問，」他自顧自地笑了笑。
「現在的問題是關於血紅蛋白。難道你沒看出這項發現的重要性嗎？」
「從化學角度來說，這確實有趣，」我回答，「但實際上——」
「啊，朋友，這可是近年來最實用的法醫發現。難道你沒看出這為我們提供了一種絕對可靠的血跡檢測方法嗎？」

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. The rendering of technical terms (血紅蛋白, 法醫) is appropriate, though minor stylistic choices like "我猜測" (I perceive/guess) and "啊，朋友" (Ah, my friend) slightly soften Holmes's characteristic precision and Watson's astonishment compared to the original's sharper tone.

results.translated_text: 我步入森林，是為了以最清醒的意識生活，直面生命的本質，探求它所要教導的真理，以免臨終之際才驚覺自己未曾真正活過。我不願過非真實的生活，因生命如此珍貴；亦不願屈服，除非萬不得已。我渴望深入生活，吸盡生命的精髓。

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and existential urgency with remarkable fidelity. The rendering of key concepts like "live deliberately" as "以最清醒的意識生活" and "suck out all the marrow of life" as "吸盡生命的精髓" demonstrates sophisticated understanding of both languages and the source material's deeper meanings. Minor stylistic variations exist (e.g., "屈服" for "practise resignation" is slightly more literal than interpretive), but the overall effect preserves Thoreau's passionate,

results.translated_text: 請稱我為以實瑪利。數年前——究竟過了多久，也無須細究——手頭拮據，岸上又無甚可牽掛，我便想出海遊歷，遍覽四海。這便是我排解鬱結、調和心緒的法子。每當我面露愁容，或靈魂深處陰冷多雨的十一月降臨，我便覺是時候盡快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning and melancholic tone of the original effectively, with good preservation of Melville's philosophical voice. Minor deviations include slight compression of some phrases (e.g., 'watery part of the world' to '四海') and the omission of 'driving off the spleen' as a specific idiom, though the overall intent is preserved through 'regulating the circulation' equivalent.

results.translated_text: 豊かな財産を持つ独身の男は、必ず妻を求めていると世間一般に認められている真実である。彼が近隣にやって来た際、その気持ちや考えがどれほど不明瞭であろうと、周囲の家族は、彼を娘たちのいずれかの当然の相手と見なす。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic tone and the elegant flow of her prose. The structure feels more literal and less natural in Japanese, and the subtle social commentary embedded in the original's irony is diminished.

results.translated_text: スタジオはバラの濃厚な香りに満ちており、夏の軽い風が庭の木々を揺らすと、開けられたドアからライラックの重い香りや、ピンクの花を咲かせるトウの繊細な香りが漂ってきた。ペルシア式の鞍袋が敷かれたダイヴァンの隅で、いつも通り無数のタバコを吸いながら横になっているロード・ハリー・ウォットンは、ラバーンムの蜂蜜色の花の光りと蜂蜜のような甘い香りをほのかに捉えることができた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key sensory details and maintains the aesthetic focus, but struggles with natural Japanese phrasing and loses some of Wilde's lyrical rhythm. Minor issues include awkward constructions like 'ピンクの花を咲かせるトウ' (unclear botanical reference) and 'ほのかに捉える' (slightly weakens the original's visual clarity).

results.translated_text:
「アフガニスタンにいたのですね、私は察しています。」
「一体どうしてそれがわかるのですか？」私は驚きを隠さず尋ねた。
「気にしないで。」と彼は自分自身に笑いながら言った。
「さて、今話題はヘモグロビンです。私のこの発見の意義はご理解いただけるでしょう。」
「化学的には興味深いでしょうが、実際には—」と私は答えた。
「さあ、これは近年で最も実用的な医事法医学的発見です。血痕の検出に誤りのない検査を提供してくれるのですよ。」

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has notable fluency issues with awkward phrasing (e.g., 'I perceive' rendered as 'I am perceiving') and loses some of the natural conversational tone and Victorian-era voice characteristic of the original dialogue.

results.translated_text: 森へ行ったのは、人生の本質的な事実に直面し、それが教えるべきことを学び、死の際に生きていなかったことに気づかないためだった。本物の生命でない生活を送りたくはなく、生命はとても尊いからだ。また、必要でなければ諦めの姿勢を取ることも望まなかった。深く生き、生命の骨髄をすべて吸い尽くしたいと願った。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key ideas but omits the crucial opening phrase 'deliberately' and weakens the personal conviction of 'I wished' by converting it to passive construction. While generally readable, it loses some of Thoreau's emphatic, declarative tone and the philosophical weight of his deliberate choices.

results.translated_text: わたしをイシュマエルと呼んでください。数年前、正確には覚えていませんが、財布にほとんどお金がなく、岸辺で特に興味を引くものもなかったため、少し海を旅して世界の海を見て回ろうと思い立ちました。これは私の気分を晴らし、心を落ち着かせる方法なのです。口元が険しくなったり、心の中がしとどとした11月のようになるたび、できるだけ早く海に出る時だと考えています。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative meaning but loses significant nuance and archaic tone. Key issues include awkward phrasing ('心を落ち着かせる' is too mild for 'regulating the circulation'), unclear expressions ('しとどとした11月' is confusing), and failure to preserve Melville's distinctive voice and philosophical meditation. The opening is solid, but the latter half deteriorates in both clarity and stylistic fidelity.

results.translated_text: 부유한 독신 남자는 반드시 아내를 원한다는 것이 보편적으로 인정되어 있다. 이 남자가 이웃에 처음 들어서면 그의 감정이나 생각이 얼마나 알려지지 않았든지, 이 사실은 주변 가족들의 마음에 고정되어 있어서, 그는 어느 한 딸의 정당한 소유물로 여겨진다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice and formal elegance. The phrasing feels stilted and overly literal (e.g., '정당한 소유물' for 'rightful property'), missing the satirical bite of the original opening.

results.translated_text: 스튜디오는 장미의 풍부한 향기로 가득 차 있었고, 여름의 가벼운 바람이 정원의 나무 사이를 스치며 열린 문을 통해 라일락의 짙은 향기나 분홍 꽃 피는 가시나무의 더 섬세한 향기가 흘러 들어왔다. 페르시아산 안장 주머니로 둘러싸인 소파 끝자락에서 그의 습관대로 담배를 피우고 있던 로드 헨리 와튼은 수없이 많은 담배를 피우며, 라버늄의 꿀처럼 달콤하고 꿀빛의 꽃이 반짝이는 것을 조금 보았다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most literal meanings but loses aesthetic precision and sensory elegance. Awkward phrasing ('수없이 많은 담배를 피우며' is redundant and confusing), mistranslation of 'divan of Persian saddle-bags' as '안장 주머니로 둘러싸인 소파', and failure to preserve Wilde's lyrical, flowing prose rhythm significantly diminish the work's sensory and aesthetic qualities.

results.translated_text: "아프가니스탄에 있었던 것 같군요." "어떻게 그걸 알았던 거죠?!" 놀라며 물었다. "그건 그렇고," 그는 혼자 웃으며 말했다. "지금 중요한 건 헤모글로빈이야. 내 발견의 중요성을 깨닫지 못했나요?" "화학적으로는 흥미로운 것 같긴 하지만, 실용적으로는..." "글쎄요, 이건 오랜만에 나온 법의학적 실용적 발견이야. 피 얼룩을 오류 없이 확인할 수 있는 검사가 된다는 걸 모르겠소?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure but has inconsistencies in tone and register shifts between characters that don't match the original. Some phrases like '그건 그렇고' (never mind) and awkward constructions like '오류 없이 확인할 수 있는 검사' reduce naturalness, and the mix of formal and informal speech patterns disrupts the Victorian-era character voice.

results.translated_text: 나는 숲으로 갔다. 의식적으로 살고자 했기 때문이다. 삶의 핵심을 마주하고, 삶이 가르쳐 줄 것을 배워보려 했으며, 죽음에 이르러서도 살지 않았음을 깨닫지 않으려 했다. 나는 삶이 아닌 것을 살고 싶지 않았다. 삶이 너무 소중했기 때문이다. 또한 반드시 필요한 경우가 아니면 포기하는 태도를 보이고 싶지 않았다. 나는 깊이 살고, 삶의 진수를 모두 빨아들여야 했다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and maintains fidelity to Thoreau's intent, though some nuances are slightly altered (e.g., 'should' vs. 'had to' in the final clause). The prose reads naturally in Korean but occasionally feels more fragmented than the flowing, meditative quality of the original.

results.translated_text: 저를 이스마엘이라고 불러 주세요. 몇 년 전, 정확히 언제인지 상관없이, 주머니에 돈이 거의 없고 육지에서는 별다른 흥미로운 것이 없을 때, 저는 조금씩 바다를 항해하며 세상의 물길을 보고 싶다고 생각했어요. 이는 제 화를 풀고 기분을 조절하는 방법입니다. 입가가 침울해지거나 내 마음속에 습하고 이슬비 내리는 11월이 느껴질 때, 나는 곧바로 바다로 떠나야 할 때라고 여깁니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately but loses the archaic literary tone and philosophical weight of Melville's prose through modern phrasing and inconsistent formality. The metaphorical language (spleen, damp drizzly November) is rendered literally rather than idiomatically, diminishing the poetic impact.

results.translated_text: Đó là một sự thật được công nhận rộng rãi rằng một người đàn ông độc thân có gia tài phải cần một người vợ. Dù cảm xúc hay quan điểm của người đàn ông ấy có ít được biết đến khi mới đến khu vực, sự thật này lại quá sâu sắc trong tâm trí các gia đình xung quanh, đến mức anh ta được xem là người chồng hợp pháp của một trong các con gái họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some of Austen's ironic bite and elegant phrasing. 'Người chồng hợp pháp' (lawful husband) misses the satirical 'rightful property' nuance, and the sentence structure feels awkward compared to the original's flowing irony.

results.translated_text: Phòng làm việc tràn ngập hương thơm nồng nàn của hoa hồng. Khi làn gió mùa hè nhẹ thổi qua tán cây trong vườn, từ cánh cửa mở, hương nặng nề của hoa lilac hay hương dịu nhẹ của hoa hồng gai nở hoa màu hồng lan vào phòng. Từ góc chiếc ghế dài phủ túi da Ba Tư nơi ông đang nằm, hút thuốc như thói quen, vô số điếu thuốc, Lord Henry Wotton có thể thoáng thấy ánh sáng của những bông hoa laburnum ngọt như mật ong và màu mật ong.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements and sensory details but suffers from awkward phrasing and structural issues that disrupt the lyrical flow. The phrase 'hương dịu nhẹ của hoa hồng gai nở hoa màu hồng' is redundant and confusing, and 'ánh sáng của những bông hoa' (light of blossoms) misses Wilde's aesthetic precision where 'gleam' refers to the visual appearance of the blossoms themselves, not light reflecting from them.

results.translated_text: "Anh đã từng ở Afghanistan, tôi nhận ra." "Làm sao anh biết được điều đó?" Tôi hỏi một cách kinh ngạc. "Đừng hỏi nữa," hắn nói, cười khúc khích. "Câu hỏi bây giờ là về huyết sắc tố. Chắc chắn anh thấy được ý nghĩa của phát hiện này chứ?" "Về mặt hóa học thì thú vị, không nghi ngờ gì," tôi đáp, "nhưng thực tế —" "Ồ, này, đây chính là phát hiện có tính ứng dụng cao nhất trong nhiều năm qua. Anh không thấy sao, nó cho chúng ta một phương pháp kiểm tra vết máu không thể sai lầm?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning of the original dialogue, capturing Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include slightly awkward phrasing in places (e.g., 'Đừng hỏi nữa' is less precise than the original 'Never mind') and some loss of the Victorian formality and natural flow of the English dialogue, though the overall character voices remain recognizable.

results.translated_text: Tôi đến rừng vì mong muốn sống có chủ đích, đối diện trực tiếp với những điều cốt lõi của cuộc sống, xem liệu tôi có thể học được điều gì từ nó, và không để đến khi chết mà lại phát hiện mình chưa từng sống thực sự. Tôi không muốn sống những điều không phải là cuộc sống, vì cuộc sống quá quý giá; cũng không muốn chấp nhận sự cam chịu, trừ khi hoàn toàn không thể tránh khỏi. Tôi muốn sống sâu thẳm và hút cạn hết tinh hoa của cuộc sống.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with strong rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately' (có chủ đích) and 'suck out all the marrow' (hút cạn hết tinh hoa). Minor fluency variations exist in phrasing, and the meditative, urgent tone is well-maintained throughout.

results.translated_text: Hãy gọi tôi là Ishmael. Cách đây một vài năm—chẳng cần biết chính xác là bao lâu—với ít tiền hoặc không có tiền trong ví, và chẳng có điều gì đặc biệt hấp dẫn trên bờ, tôi quyết định ra khơi một chút để khám phá phần biển cả của thế giới. Đó là cách tôi xua tan nỗi buồn và điều hòa tâm trạng. Mỗi khi tôi cảm thấy mặt mũi u ám, mỗi khi tâm hồn tôi như tháng Mười Một ẩm ướt, mưa phùn, tôi liền cho rằng đây là lúc phải ra biển ngay.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' becomes generic 'buồn' rather than preserving the medical-philosophical concept, 'circulation' becomes 'tâm trạng'). The archaic, meditative tone is somewhat flattened, and phrases like 'grim about the mouth' and 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' feel less poetic and introspective in Vietnamese, making the prose read more straightforwardly than Melville's original philosophical register.

results.translated_text: เป็นความจริงที่เข้าใจกันทั่วไปว่าชายโสดผู้มีฐานะร่ำรวยย่อมต้องการหาภรรยา ไม่ว่าความรู้สึกหรือความคิดของชายผู้นั้นจะไม่เป็นที่รู้จักมากนักเมื่อเข้ามาอยู่ในละแวกนั้น ความจริงนี้ถูกฝังลึกอยู่ในจิตใจของครอบครัวใกล้เคียงจนถือว่าเขาเป็นสิ่งของที่ถูกต้องของลูกสาวของครอบครัวใดครอบครัวหนึ่ง

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the core meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with good preservation of the logical structure and satirical commentary on marriage expectations. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ('สิ่งของที่ถูกต้อง' for 'rightful property' is somewhat stiff) and the style, while capturing irony, reads slightly more formal than the original's conversational wit.

results.translated_text: ห้องนั่งเล่นเต็มไปด้วยกลิ่นกุหลาบหอมเข้ม เมื่อลมฤดูร้อนเบาๆ พัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน กลิ่นหอมเข้มของดอกลิเลคหรือกลิ่นหอมอ่อนๆ ของดอกไม้สีชมพูที่มีหนามค่อยๆ ลอยเข้ามาผ่านประตูเปิด จากมุมหนึ่งของโซฟาที่ประดับด้วยถุงนั่งแบบเปอร์เซีย ที่เขาได้นั่งพัก ดูดบุหรี่อย่างที่เขาทำเป็นนิสัย บุหรี่ไม่รู้กี่มวน ลอร์ด เฮนรี วอตตัน สามารถสังเกตเห็นแสงระยิบระยับของดอกไม้สีน้ำผึ้งที่หวานหอมของต้นลับบัรนัมได้เพียงเล็กน้อย

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements and sensory details but suffers from awkward phrasing and structural issues that disrupt the aesthetic flow. The prose feels choppy and overly literal in places, losing some of Wilde's elegant, flowing style and the refined sensuality of the original passage.

results.translated_text: "ท่านเพิ่งกลับมาจากอัฟกานิสถาน ดูเหมือนจะเป็นเช่นนั้น" "ท่านรู้ได้อย่างไรเล่า?" ฉันถามด้วยความประหลาดใจ "ไม่ต้องถามหรอก" เขากล่าวพร้อมหัวเราะเบาๆ ภายในใจ "คำถามตอนนี้คือเรื่องฮีโมโกลบิน แน่ใจแล้วใช่ไหมว่าคุณเข้าใจความสำคัญของการค้นพบนี้?" "มันน่าสนใจด้านเคมีอย่างแน่นอน" ฉันตอบ "แต่ในทางปฏิบัติ—" "ทำไมล่ะ มนุษย์! มันเป็นการค้นพบที่มีประโยชน์ที่สุดทางการแพทย์-กฎหมายในรอบหลายปี คุณไม่เห็นหรือว่ามันให้เราทดสอบคราบเลือดได้อย่างไม่ผิดพลาดเลย?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and preserves the deductive dialogue characteristic of Holmes, though some phrasing feels slightly stiff (e.g., 'ทำไมล่ะ มนุษย์' for 'Why, man') and the natural flow of Thai conversation could be smoother in places.

results.translated_text: ฉันไปป่าเพราะอยากใช้ชีวิตอย่างตั้งใจ เพื่อเผชิญหน้ากับสิ่งสำคัญเพียงอย่างเดียวของชีวิต และเรียนรู้สิ่งที่มันมีไว้สอน ไม่ให้เมื่อถึงวันสิ้นชีวิต ต้องรู้ว่าฉันยังไม่ได้ใช้ชีวิตอย่างแท้จริง ฉันไม่ต้องการใช้ชีวิตแบบที่ไม่ใช่ชีวิต ที่การใช้ชีวิตนั้นมีค่ายิ่งนัก ไม่ต้องการยอมรับความสิ้นหวัง ยกเว้นเมื่อจำเป็นจริงๆ ฉันต้องการใช้ชีวิตให้ลึกซึ้ง และดูดเนื้อแท้ของชีวิตให้หมด

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's core philosophical meaning and key metaphors (living deliberately, sucking the marrow of life), but the sentence structure becomes convoluted in Thai, particularly in the middle section, making it harder to follow than the original. The poetic and meditative tone is somewhat diminished by awkward phrasing and repetitive use of 'ชีวิต' (life), which disrupts the philosophical flow.

results.translated_text: เรียกฉันว่าอิชมาเอล หลายปีก่อน... ไม่สำคัญว่าจะนานแค่ไหน ที่กระเป๋าไม่มีเงินหรือมีน้อยนิด ไม่มีสิ่งใดน่าสนใจบนบก ฉันจึงคิดจะออกเดินทางไปเรือสักหน่อย เพื่อสัมผัสโลกที่เต็มไปด้วยน้ำ นี่คือวิธีที่ฉันใช้ขับไล่ความเครียดและปรับสมดุลเลือด เมื่อฉันรู้สึกว่าหน้าตาขมขื่น หรือเมื่อในใจมีฤดูพฤศจิกายนที่เปียกชื้น ฉันก็รู้สึกว่าถึงเวลาแล้วที่จะออกทะเลโดยเร็วที่สุด

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' as melancholy becomes generic 'stress,' 'circulation' becomes literal 'blood balance'). The archaic, introspective tone of Melville's prose is diminished, and some phrasing feels awkwardly literal rather than naturally Thai, particularly in the metaphorical passages about emotional states.

results.translated_text: यह एक सार्वभौमिक रूप से मान्यता प्राप्त सत्य है कि एक अकेला आदमी जिसके पास अच्छी आर्थिक स्थिति हो, उसे किसी लड़की की तलाश में होना चाहिए। हालांकि ऐसे व्यक्ति के विचार या भावनाएँ पड़ोस में पहली बार आने पर कितनी भी अज्ञात हों, यह सत्य इतना मजबूत है कि पड़ोसी परिवार उसे किसी लड़की की अधिकारिक संपत्ति मानते हैं।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise effectively, though it loses some of Austen's subtle wit in the phrasing. The phrase 'अधिकारिक संपत्ति' (official property) slightly shifts the irony compared to 'rightful property,' and the overall tone feels somewhat more direct than Austen's delicate sarcasm.

results.translated_text: स्टूडियो में गुलाब की घनी खुशबू से भरा था, और जब गर्मियों की हल्की हवा बगीचे के पेड़ों में लहराती, तो खुली दरवाजे से लिलैक की भारी खुशबू या गुलाबी फूलों वाले थॉर्न की सूक्ष्म खुशबू आती थी। डिवान पर पर्सियन सैडल बैगों के कोने से लेटे हुए, जैसा कि उनकी आदत थी, अनगिनत सिगरेट धूम्रपान करते हुए, लॉर्ड हेनरी वॉटन को लैबर्नम के मधुर और मधुर रंग के फूलों की चमक दिखाई देती थी।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning accurately, but the sentence structure becomes convoluted and loses the elegant flow of Wilde's prose. The repetition of 'मधुर' (sweet) twice and some awkward phrasing ('डिवान पर पर्सियन सैडल बैगों के कोने से') diminish the aesthetic refinement characteristic of the original.

results.translated_text: "आप अफगानिस्तान में रहे हैं, मुझे लगता है।" "आप ऐसा कैसे जान गए?" मैं हैरानी से पूछा। "क्या बात है," उन्होंने खुद ही हँसते हुए कहा। "अब का सवाल हीमोग्लोबिन का है। निश्चय ही आपको इस खोज का महत्व समझ आया होगा?" "यह रसायन विज्ञान की दृष्टि से दिलचस्प है, निश्चय ही," मैंने जवाब दिया, "लेकिन व्यावहारिक रूप से—" "अरे, आदमी, यह कई वर्षों में सबसे व्यावहारिक चिकित्सा-कानूनी खोज है। क्या आप नहीं समझते कि यह हमें खून के दागों के लिए एक निर्भावित परीक्षण देती है?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has some awkward phrasings ('क्या बात है' is unclear, 'निर्भावित' is incorrect—should be 'अचूक' or 'निर्विवाद') and loses the natural conversational flow of the original dialogue. The formal register is somewhat preserved but the character voices lack distinctiveness.

results.translated_text: मैं जंगल गया क्योंकि मैं सचेत ढंग से जीना चाहता था, केवल जीवन के मूल तथ्यों का सामना करना चाहता था, और देखना चाहता था कि क्या मैं उससे सीख नहीं सकता, और जब मैं मरूँगा तो यह न पाऊँ कि मैंने जीवन नहीं जिया। मैं ऐसा जीवन नहीं चाहता जो जीवन नहीं था, क्योंकि जीवन इतना प्यारा है; और न ही मैं निराशा की आदत बनाना चाहता था, जब तक कि यह बिल्कुल आवश्यक न हो। मैं गहराई से जीना चाहता था और जीवन का सार सब कुछ निकालना चाहता था।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately,' 'essential facts,' and 'marrow of life.' However, some phrases feel slightly awkward in Hindi (e.g., 'यह न पाऊँ' is archaic; 'निराशा की आदत बनाना' is less precise than the original 'practise resignation'), and the rhythmic, meditative quality of Thoreau's prose is somewhat diminished, affecting overall stylistic fidelity.

results.translated_text: मुझे इश्मायल कहो। कुछ साल पहले—कितने साल ठीक-ठीक याद नहीं—जब मेरे पास पैसे बहुत कम थे और जमीन पर कोई खास बात नहीं थी जो मुझे रोके, मैंने सोचा कि थोड़ा सा समुद्र पर घूम आऊँ और दुनिया के पानी के हिस्से को देखूँ। यह मेरी आदत है दिल का दुख दूर करने और खून का संचार ठीक करने की। जब मैं मुंह पर गंभीरता आने लगता हूँ; जब मेरी आत्मा में भीगी-बदर नवंबर का मौसम छा जाता है, तब मुझे लगता है कि समुद्र की ओर जाने का समय आ गया है।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical essence of Melville's opening, but loses some nuance in the archaic, contemplative tone. Phrases like 'दिल का दुख दूर करने' (removing heartache) and 'खून का संचार' (blood circulation) are somewhat literal and lack the poetic resonance of the original's 'spleen' and 'regulating the circulation,' and the Hindi phrasing occasionally feels stilted rather than naturally flowing like Melville's distinctive voice.

results.translated_text: একটি সার্বজনীন সত্য, যে একজন অবিবাহিত পুরুষ যার ভালো সম্পদ আছে, তাকে অবশ্যই বিবাহের প্রয়োজন হবে। যদিও এই ধরনের একজন ব্যক্তির প্রথম আশেপাশের অঞ্চলে আসার পর তার অনুভূতি বা মতামত কেউ জানে না, তবুও সেই পরিবারগুলোর মনে এটি এতটাই নিশ্চিত যে, তাকে কোনও এক কন্যার অধিকারী হিসেবে গণ্য করা হয়।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic tone and elegant phrasing; the sentence structure becomes awkward and the satirical edge of 'rightful property' is dulled, making it read more literally than literarily.

results.translated_text: স্টুডিওটি গোলাপের সমৃদ্ধ গন্ধে ভরে আছে, এবং গ্রীষ্মের হালকা বাতাস বাগানের গাছের মাঝে উড়ে যাওয়ার সময় খোলা দরজা দিয়ে লিলাকের ভারী সুবাস বা গোলাপি ফুলের থর্নের আরও নরম সুগন্ধ প্রবেশ করত। তার পারস্য স্যাডেল ব্যাগের ওপর শুয়ে সাধারণ অনুযায়ী অসংখ্য সিগারেট ধরিয়ে থাকা লর্ড হেনরি ওটনের ডিভানের কোণ থেকে মাত্র একটু সামনে থেকে ল্যাবার্নাম গাছের মধুর সুবাস ও মধুর রঙের ফুলের আলো দেখতে পাচ্ছিলেন।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses significant nuance in Wilde's sensory aestheticism. Awkward phrasing ('মাত্র একটু সামনে থেকে' for 'could just catch'), grammatical issues ('ধরিয়ে থাকা' is imprecise), and failure to preserve the delicate, flowing rhythm of the original prose diminish both fluency and style.

results.translated_text: "আপনি আফগানিস্তানে ছিলেন, আমি অনুমান করছি।" "আপনি কীভাবে জানলেন?" আমি অবাক হয়ে জিজ্ঞাসা করলাম। "কেবল মনে রাখুন," তিনি নিজের মনে হেসে বললেন। "এখন প্রশ্ন হল হিমোগ্লোবিন সম্পর্কে। নিশ্চয়ই আপনি এই আবিষ্কারের গুরুত্ব বুঝতে পারছেন?" "রাসায়নিকভাবে এটা আকর্ষণীয়, নিশ্চয়ই," আমি উত্তর দিলাম, "কিন্তু ব্যবহারিকভাবে—" "হ্যাঁ, মানুষ, এটা কয়েক বছরের মধ্যে সবচেয়ে ব্যবহারিক চিকিৎসা-আইনি আবিষ্কার। আপনি কি বুঝতে পারছেন যে এটি রক্তের দাগ নির্ণয়ের অপরিহার্য পরীক্ষা দেয়?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though 'কেবল মনে রাখুন' (only remember) misses the dismissive tone of 'Never mind,' and some phrasing feels awkward. The dialogue reads somewhat stiffly in Bengali with occasional unnatural constructions that don't fully match the original's Victorian conversational style and Holmes's characteristic intellectual confidence.

results.translated_text: আমি বনে গিয়েছিলাম, কারণ আমি সচেতনভাবে জীবন যাপন করতে চেয়েছিলাম, জীবনের মৌলিক তথ্যগুলোর সম্মুখীন হতে, এবং দেখতে চাই যে আমি কি জীবনের যা শেখানো আছে তা শিখতে পারি না, আর মৃত্যুর সময় না বুঝি যে আমি জীবন যাপন করিনি। আমি চাইনি যে আমি জীবন নয় এমন কিছু জীবন যাপন করি, কারণ জীবন এত দামি; আর আমি চাইনি যে আমি অবশ্য কর্তব্য বলে স্বীকার করি, যদি তা অত্যাবশ্যক না হয়। আমি চেয়েছিলাম জীবনকে গভীরভাবে জীবন যাপন করি এবং জীবনের সমস্ত মজ্জা চুষে নেব।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but suffers from awkward phrasing, grammatical issues, and unclear constructions that obscure Thoreau's philosophical clarity. Key phrases like 'সচেতনভাবে জীবন যাপন' and 'মজ্জা চুষে নেব' are reasonable, but the overall syntax is convoluted and the poetic resonance of the original is lost.

results.translated_text: আমাকে ইশ্মায়েল বলুন। কিছু বছর আগে—কোন মাপে ঠিক করা নেই—আমার পকেটে কিছু টাকা নেই, বরং কোনও বিশেষ কাজ নেই যা আমাকে শুকনো ভূমির উপর আকর্ষণ করে, তাই আমি ভেবেছিলাম, একটু জলপথে ঘুরে বেড়াব এবং পৃথিবীর জলাভূমি অংশটুকু দেখব। এটাই আমার অভ্যাস, ক্ষুধা দূর করে আর রক্ত প্রবাহ নিয়ন্ত্রণ করার জন্য। যখনই আমার মুখ কঠিন হয়ে যায়; যখনই আমার আত্মায় ভিজে-ভিজে নভেম্বরের মতো আবহাওয়া ছড়িয়ে পড়ে, তখন আমি বুঝি, সময় এসে গেছে যত দ্রুত সম্ভব সমুদ্রে যাওয়ার।

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant meaning distortions and awkward phrasings that undermine comprehension. Key errors include 'ক্ষুধা' (hunger) instead of 'melancholy/spleen,' 'জলাভূমি' (wetland) instead of 'watery,' and grammatically incorrect constructions that make the text difficult to parse, failing to capture Melville's contemplative, archaic tone.

results.translated_text: ஒரு செல்வச் சிங்கில் ஆண் ஒருவன் மனைவியைத் தேடுவது என்பது உலகமெங்கும் உறுதியாக ஏற்றுக்கொள்ளப்பட்ட உண்மையாகும். அவன் புதிதாக ஒரு குடியிருப்பில் வந்திருக்கும்போது அவனுடைய உணர்வுகளைப் பற்றி யாரும் அறியாதிருந்தாலும், அந்த உண்மை அங்குள்ள குடும்பங்களின் மனதில் உறுதியாக பதிந்திருப்பதால், அவனை அவர்களுடைய மகள்களில் ஒருத்தியின் தகுதியான கணவனாக கருதுகிறார்கள்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise but loses some of Austen's satirical edge and the elegant paradox of 'rightful property.' The phrasing is somewhat awkward and doesn't flow as naturally as the original, with 'தகுதியான கணவனாக' (worthy husband) diluting the biting irony of treating women as possessions.

results.translated_text: ஸ்டூடியோவில் மலர்களின் தீவிர மணம் நிரம்பியிருந்தது. கோபுர வீதிகளில் குளிர்ந்த காலை காற்று மரங்களை அசைக்கும்போது, திறந்த கதவின் வழியாக லிலாக்கின் கனமான மணம் அல்லது சிவப்பு மலர்கள் கொண்ட தோட்டத்தின் நுணுக்கமான மணம் உள்ளே வந்தது. அவர் பெர்சிய செட்டில் பைகள் நிரம்பிய மேடையின் மூலையில் அமர்ந்து, அவரது வழக்கமான முறையில் பல சிகரெட்டுகளை புகைத்துக்கொண்டிருக்க, லாபர்னம் மலர்களின் தேன் மணமும் தேன் நிறமும் கொண்ட மலர்களின் மின்னலை லார்டு ஹென்றி வாட்டன் கவனிக்க முடிந்தது.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements but contains significant issues: 'கோபுர வீதிகளில்' (tower streets) is an inaccurate rendering of 'garden,' the sentence structure becomes convoluted and loses the flowing elegance of the original, and sensory aestheticism is diminished through awkward phrasing like 'மின்னலை' (lightning) for 'gleam,' which disrupts the delicate impressionistic tone Wilde intended.

results.translated_text: "நீங்கள் அப்கானிஸ்தானத்தில் இருந்திருக்கிறீர்கள், என்று நான் உணர்கிறேன்." "எப்படி அதை அறிந்தீர்கள்?" என்று நான் ஆச்சரியத்துடன் கேட்டேன். "கவலைப்படாதீர்கள்," என்று அவர் தன்னை மட்டும் குனிந்து சிரித்தபடி சொன்னார். "இப்போது கேள்வி ஹீமோகிளோபினைப் பற்றியது. எனது கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவத்தை உங்களுக்குத் தெரியுமா?" "இது வேதியியலில் ஆர்வமூட்டும் விஷயம், உண்மையில்," நான் பதிலளித்தேன், "ஆனால் உண்மையான பயன்பாட்டில்—" "என்னைப் பார், மனிதனே, இது பல வருடங்களாக இருந்த மருத்துவ-சட்ட ரீதியான மிகச்சிறந்த கண்டுபிடிப்பு. இது இரத்த புள்ளிகளை தவறுபடாத சோதனையாக அடையாளம் காண்பிக்கிறது என்று உங்களுக்குத் தெரியவில்லையா?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though some phrases like 'தன்னை மட்டும் குனிந்து சிரித்தபடி' (bending only to himself while laughing) misrepresents 'chuckling to himself.' The dialogue reads somewhat stiffly in Tamil with occasional awkward constructions that don't flow naturally, and the Victorian-era conversational tone and Holmes's characteristic intellectual arrogance are partially diluted by the translation choices.

results.translated_text: நான் காட்டிற்கு சென்றேன், தெளிவாக வாழ விரும்பினேன்; வாழ்க்கையின் முக்கிய உண்மைகளை முகம் நேராக சந்திக்க, அது எனக்கு கற்றுக்கொடுக்கும் பாடத்தை கற்றுக்கொள்ள, இறப்புக்கு முன் வாழவில்லை என்று கண்டுகொள்ளாமல் இருக்க விரும்பினேன். வாழ்க்கை அப்படி அருமையானது; அதனால் வாழ்க்கையில்லாத வாழ்க்கையை வாழ விரும்பவில்லை. தேவையில்லாமல் பொறுமையாக ஏற்றுக்கொள்ள விரும்பவில்லை. வாழ்க்கையை ஆழமாக வாழ்ந்து, அதன் மிகச்சிறந்த பகுதியை உறிஞ்சிப்பிடுவேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's philosophical meaning and key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's essence, but some nuances are lost or awkwardly rendered (e.g., 'முகம் நேராக சந்திக்க' is somewhat clunky for 'front'). The prose lacks the rhythmic eloquence and meditative flow of the original, reading more like a literal conversion than natural Tamil philosophical writing.

results.translated_text: என்னை இசுமாயேல் என்று அழைக்கவும். சில ஆண்டுகளுக்கு முன்பு - எவ்வளவு நேரம் என்று கவலைப்பட வேண்டாம் - எனது பணம் மிகக் குறைவாக இருந்தது, கடற்கரையில் எனக்கு கவனிக்கத்தக்க எதுவும் இல்லாமல், நான் கடலில் சிறிது பயணம் செய்து, உலகின் கடல் பகுதிகளைப் பார்க்க விரும்பினேன். இது எனக்கு வழக்கமான முறை, எனது மனதில் ஏற்படும் கோபத்தை தீர்த்துக்கொள்ளவும், மனதின் ஓட்டத்தை சரிசெய்யவும். என்னை முகத்தில் கோபம் ஏற்படும்போது, எனது மனதில் மழை பெய்யும் நவம்பர் நாள் போல இருக்கும்போது, விரைவில் கடலுக்கு செல்ல வேண்டும் என்று நினைக்கிறேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative content but loses significant nuance and philosophical depth. The archaic, introspective tone of Melville's prose is largely flattened, and several key metaphors ("spleen," "circulation," "grim about the mouth") are either mistranslated or rendered awkwardly, making the passage feel more literal and less poetic than the original.

results.translated_text: Известно всему миру, что богатый холостяк непременно ищет жену. Хотя чувства или взгляды такого человека на первых порах могут быть малоизвестны, эта истина настолько укоренилась в умах окружающих семей, что он считается законным достоянием одной из их дочерей.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Austen's ironic formality and the opening's philosophical weight. 'Известно всему миру' (known to the whole world) is less precise than 'universally acknowledged,' and the ironic tone is somewhat flattened, though the Russian reads naturally and the final clause about daughters as 'property' is well-rendered.

results.translated_text: Студия была наполнена насыщенным ароматом роз, и когда легкий летний ветерок шевелил деревья сада, через открытую дверь проникал тяжелый аромат сирени или более изысканный аромат цветущего розового терна. С края дивана, обитого персидскими седельными мешками, на котором он лежал, куря, как это было его привычкой, несметное количество сигарет, Лорд Генри Воттон едва замечал блеск медово-сладких и медово-желтых цветов лаберны.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meanings accurately, though 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'розового терна' (pink hawthorn), which is a minor semantic shift. The sensory richness is maintained well, but the Russian phrasing occasionally feels slightly more formal and less flowing than Wilde's original prose, particularly in the construction of the final clause.

results.translated_text: — Вы были в Афганистане, я вижу. — Как вы, черт возьми, об этом узнали? — спросил я, поражённый. — Не обращайте внимания, — усмехнулся он самодовольно. — Вопрос сейчас о гемоглобине. Не сомневаюсь, вы понимаете значение этого моего открытия? — Химически, безусловно, интересно, — ответил я, — но практически… — Что ж, друг, это самое практическое медицинско-юридическое открытие за последние годы. Не видите ли вы, что это даёт нам непогрешимый тест для обнаружения кровяных пятен?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow with only minor deviations (e.g., 'самодовольно' adds a nuance of self-satisfaction not explicitly in 'chuckling'). The Russian reads naturally and maintains the Victorian-era scientific discourse, though 'медицинско-юридическое' is slightly awkward compared to the smoother English 'medico-legal.'

results.translated_text: Я пошел в лес, потому что хотел жить осознанно, встретиться лицом к лицу с существенными фактами жизни, чтобы понять, что она мне может преподать, и не обнаружить в момент смерти, что я не жил. Я не хотел жить не жизнью, так как жизнь дорога, и не хотел смиряться, если только это было необходимо. Я хотел жить глубоко и высосать из жизни весь сок.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with excellent rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately' (осознанно) and 'essential facts' (существенные факты). Minor fluency issues include 'жить не жизнью' (live non-life) which is slightly awkward compared to 'live what was not life,' and 'высосать' (suck out) is more colloquial than the contemplative tone of the original, though 'сок' (marrow/juice) captures the metaphor well.

results.translated_text: Зовите меня Ишмаэль. Несколько лет назад — неважно, сколько именно — у меня в кошельке было мало или совсем не было денег, и на суше не было ничего особенного, что могло бы меня заинтересовать, я решил немного поплавать и увидеть водную часть мира. Это способ, которым я избавляюсь от хандры и привожу в порядок кровообращение. Когда я начинаю хмуриться, когда в душе царит сырая, дождливая ноябрьская погода, я считаю, что самое время как можно скорее отправиться в море.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Melville's distinctive voice and philosophical tone. Phrases like 'поплавать' (to swim a bit) misses the nautical weight of 'sail about,' and the archaic, meditative quality of the original is diminished by more straightforward phrasing, making it read less like 19th-century literary prose.

results.translated_text: Це загальновідома істина, що холостий чоловік, який має достаток, не може не мати дружини. Проте, незважаючи на те, наскільки мало відомі почуття чи думки такого чоловіка під час його першого вступу до сусідства, ця істина настільки закріплена в розумінні оточуючих сімей, що він вважається законним майном однієї з їхніх дочок.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some of Austen's ironic bite and elegant simplicity. The phrase 'не може не мати дружини' (cannot not have a wife) is awkward compared to the original's 'must be in want of,' and the second sentence becomes convoluted, diminishing the satirical tone that defines this famous opening.

results.translated_text: Студія була наповнена багатим запахом троянд, і коли легкий літній вітерець пронизував дерева саду, через відкриту двері доносився важкий запах сирину або ніжніший аромат рожевих квітів шипки. З кутка дивану з персидських сідлових сум, на якому він лежав, курячи незлічені сигарети, як звичай, Лорд Генрі Воттон міг лише помітити блиск медово-солодких і медового кольору квітів лабірнуму.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'пронизував' (pierced through) is slightly stronger than 'stirred amidst' and some sensory nuance is lost. The aesthetic tone is maintained reasonably well, but the Ukrainian phrasing feels occasionally stiff compared to Wilde's flowing prose, particularly in the final clause construction.

results.translated_text: "Ви були в Афганістані, я бачу", — сказав він. "Як ти це визначив?" запитав я з подивом. "Нехай собі", відповів він, сміючись сам до себе. "Зараз питання про гемоглобін. Звичайно, ти розумієш значення цього моєго відкриття?" "Хімічно це цікаво, звичайно," відповів я, "але практично—" "О, хлопче, це найбільш практичне медико-правове відкриття останніх років. Чи не бачиш, що це дає нам непомилковий тест для виявлення кров'яних плям?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the detective story's intellectual tone, though some phrasing feels slightly stiff (e.g., 'непомилковий тест' is more formal than the original's conversational 'infallible test') and the shift from 'I perceive' to 'я бачу' loses some of Holmes's characteristic precision.

results.translated_text: Я пішов до лісу, бо хотів жити свідомо, стикатися лише з найсуттєвішими фактами життя, дізнатися, що воно може мені навчити, і не зрозуміти, коли настане смерть, що я не жив. Не хотів жити тим, що не є життям, бо життя так цінне; не хотів піддаватися поступці, якщо це не було необхідно. Хотів жити глибоко, витягуючи весь сік життя.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and maintains Thoreau's deliberative tone, though some nuances are slightly softened. Minor awkwardness in phrasing (e.g., 'стикатися' is less elegant than alternatives, 'витягуючи весь сік' slightly shifts the metaphorical intensity) prevents higher scores, but overall it successfully conveys the existential urgency of the original.

results.translated_text: Звуть мене Ішмаел. Деякі роки тому — не важливо, скільки саме — маючи мало або жодних грошей у гаманці, і нічого особливого, що б зацікавило мене на березі, я подумав, що зроблю невелику морську подорож, щоб подивитися на водну частину світу. Це спосіб, яким я відганяю сум і регулюю кровообіг. Коли я помічаю, що на моєму обличчі з'являється мрачний вираз; коли в моїй душі встановлюється вологий, дрібний листопад, я вважаю, що час вирушати до моря якнайшвидше.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning well with only minor shifts (e.g., 'growing grim about the mouth' becomes 'мрачний вираз' which slightly simplifies the original), and maintains the archaic literary tone. However, some phrasings feel slightly stiff in Ukrainian, and the poetic metaphor of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' loses some of its original evocative power through literal translation.

results.translated_text: إنها حقيقة مسلّمة بها أن الرجل الأعزب الذي يمتلك ثروة جيدة يُفترض أنه بحاجة إلى زوجة. ومهما كانت مشاعره أو آراؤه غير معروفة عند دخوله الحي لأول مرة، فإن هذه الحقيقة مسلّمة في أذهان العائلات المحيطة به لدرجة أنهم يعتبرونه ملكاً شرعيّاً لأحد بناتهن.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and maintains the ironic tone of Austen's opening, with natural Arabic phrasing. However, the repetition of 'مسلّمة' (acknowledged/accepted) slightly weakens the original's rhetorical elegance, and the formal register, while appropriate, could better emphasize Austen's subtle satirical voice.

results.translated_text: كانت الاستوديو مليئة برائحة الورود الغنية، وعندما تُثير الرياح الصيفية الخفيفة بين أشجار الحديقة، تصل من الباب المفتوح رائحة الليلاك الكثيفة، أو العطر الرقيق لشجرة الشوك الوردي المزهر. من ركن الدفنة المغطاة بأكياس السرج الفارسية التي كان مستلقيًا عليها، يدخن وفق عادته عددًا لا يُحصى من السجائر، كان لورد هنري واتون يلمح لمعان زهور اللابورنوم العسلية ذات اللون العسلي.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and sensory details accurately, but suffers from awkward phrasing and grammatical issues (e.g., 'الاستوديو مليئة' has gender disagreement) that disrupt the aesthetic flow. The ornate, lyrical style of Wilde's original is diminished by clunky constructions like 'شجرة الشوك الوردي المزهر' and the repetitive 'العسلية ذات اللون العسلي.'

results.translated_text: "أرى أنك كنت في أفغانستان." "كيف عرفت ذلك؟" سألتُ بدهشة. "لا تهتم"، قال وهو يضحك ضحكة خفيفة. "السؤال الآن عن الهيموجلوبين. ألا ترى أهمية هذا الاكتشاف؟" "إنه مثير من الناحية الكيميائية، بلا شك"، أجبت، "لكنه عمليًّا—" "لماذا، يا رجل، إنه أبرز اكتشاف طبي-قانوني منذ سنوات. ألا ترى أن هذا يمنحنا اختبارًا لا يخطئ لبقع الدم؟"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue flow of the original text, with proper preservation of Holmes's deductive character and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include slightly awkward phrasing in places ("ضحكة خفيفة" is somewhat redundant with "يضحك") and the hyphenated "طبي-قانوني" feels less natural than a single compound term would be, affecting overall fluency and the Victorian-era formality of the original.

results.translated_text: ذهبت إلى الغابة لأنني أردت العيش بوعي، لمواجهة الحقائق الأساسية للحياة فقط، ورؤية ما إذا كان بإمكاني تعلُّم ما تعلمه، وألا أكتشف عند موتي أنه لم أعيش. لم أرَد العيش حياةً غير حقيقية، فالحياة ثمينة جدًا؛ ولا أردت أن أتبنى الاستسلام إلا إذا كان ضروريًّا. أردت أن أعيش بعمق وأستخلص كل عُصْمَة الحياة.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage with strong fidelity, though 'استخلص كل عُصْمَة' (extract all essence/marrow) is slightly awkward compared to the original's vivid 'suck out all the marrow.' The prose flows naturally in Arabic with appropriate philosophical tone, though some of Thoreau's rhythmic intensity is slightly diminished in the target language.

results.translated_text: اسموني إسمايل. قبل عدة سنوات—لا يهم كم من الوقت بالتحديد—لم يكن لدي سوى قليل من المال في جيبي، ولا شيء محدد يجذبني إلى الشاطئ، فقررت أن أبحر قليلاً وأرى الجزء المائي من العالم. إنها طريقة أتبعها لطرد الغم وتنظيم الدورة الدموية. كلما أصبح وجهي قاتماً، وكلما تحوّلت روحي إلى نوفمبر رطب ومطر خفيف، أعتبر أن الوقت قد حان للذهاب إلى البحر في أقرب وقت.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though 'اسموني' (call me) is slightly informal and 'growing grim about the mouth' becomes awkwardly 'وجهي قاتماً' (my face darkened). The archaic, contemplative tone of the original is diminished; the poetic metaphors feel more literal and less evocative, particularly the transformation of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' into a more straightforward description rather than maintaining Melville's introspective melancholy.

results.translated_text: זו אמת המוכרת בכל מקום, שאיש יחיד בעל עושר חייב לחפש אישה. אולם, אף אם הרגשות או הדעות של אדם כזה אינם ידועים בכניסתו הראשונה לאזור, האמת הזו נקבעת כל כך בדעתיהן של המשפחות הסביבתיות, עד שאותו אדם נחשב לבעלות הראויה של אחת מהבנות שלהן.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone reasonably well, though some nuances are lost—particularly the sardonic universality of 'universally acknowledged' and the subtle property metaphor. The Hebrew reads naturally but lacks the elegant, measured cadence of Austen's original prose.

results.translated_text: הסטודיו היה מלא בריח עשיר של רוזות, וכאשר הרוח הקלילה של הקיץ זזה בין העצים בגן, דרך הדלת הפתוחה הגיע הריח הכבד של לילק, או הריח עדין יותר של תורן פרווה פינק. מהפינה של הדייבן שعليו הוא מונח, מדליק סיגריות רבות, כפי שعادة לו, לורד הנרי ווטון היה יכול לבחין בבהבה של פרחי לברנום העסיסיים ובצבע עסיס.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses significant sensory nuance and aesthetic precision. Key issues include awkward phrasing ('תורן פרווה פינק' is unclear), incorrect word choices ('עסיסיים' means juicy rather than honey-sweet), and disrupted sentence flow that undermines Wilde's lyrical, flowing style.

results.translated_text: אתה ביקר באפغانיסטן, אני רואה. "איך בכלל ידעת את זה?" שאלתי בהלם. "לא משנה," אמר הוא, צוחק לעצמו. "השאלה כעת היא על המוגלובין. בלי ספק אתה רואה את החשיבות של ממציאתי?" "זה מעניין מבחינה כימית, כמובן," עניתי, "אבל מעשית—" "למה, אדם, זהו הממציא המהוור ביותר בתחום המֵדִיקו-נָחוּתִי למשך שנים. לא תראה שזה מספק לנו מבחן בלתי שגוי לכתמים דם?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains several errors: 'ממציאתי' (my invention) should be 'גילויי' (my discovery), 'הממציא המהוור' is nonsensical (should be 'הגילוי המעשי'), and 'מֵדִיקו-נָחוּתִי' appears to be a malformed neologism. The dialogue reads awkwardly in Hebrew with unnatural phrasing that doesn't match Doyle's Victorian tone.

results.translated_text: יצאתי ליער כי רציתי לחיות בכוונה, לעמוד מול העובדות היסודיות של החיים, ולראות אם אוכל ללמוד מה שרצה ללמד, ולא, כאשר הגיעה עת מותי, לגלות שאני לא חייתי. לא רציתי לחיות את מה שאינו חיים, שכן חיים יקרים; ולא רציתי לסבול, אלא אם כן זה היה הכרחי. רציתי לחיות עמוק ולכפות את כל העצמות של החיים.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning accurately, though 'לכפות את כל העצמות' (force/extract all the bones) is awkward—'לספוג' (absorb) or 'לשאוב' (draw out) would better convey 'suck out all the marrow.' The philosophical tone is mostly preserved, but some phrasing feels slightly stilted compared to the original's lyrical flow.

results.translated_text: קְרָא לִי אִשְׁמָאֵל. לפני כמה שנים—לא משנה כמה בדיוק—ללא כסף בקרשוני, ושום דבר ספציפי שימלא את תשומת ליבי על היבשה, חשבתי שאצא לגלוש קצת לראות את החלק הים של העולם. זהו הדרך שלי למשל את הרוע ולסודר את הזרימה. כל פעם שאני רואה את פניי נוטים לכהות; כל פעם שלב שלי הוא רטוב וגשום כמו נובמבר, אני מחשיב זאת זמן מושלם לצאת לים במהרה ככל האפשר.

scores.feedback: The translation has significant issues: awkward phrasings like 'קרשוני' (purse) and 'למשל את הרוע' (to exemplify evil, rather than 'drive off the spleen'), grammatical errors ('לב שלי הוא רטוב' is malformed), and loss of Melville's introspective, philosophical tone. The archaic literary style is not adequately preserved, and several passages are confusing or inaccurate.

results.translated_text: C'est une vérité universellement reconnue qu'un célibataire pourvu d'une belle fortune doit être en quête d'une épouse. Si peu que l'on connaisse ses sentiments ou ses opinions sur ce point, dès son arrivée dans un quartier, cette vérité est si bien ancrée dans l'esprit des familles environnantes qu'il est considéré comme la propriété légitime de l'une ou l'autre de leurs filles.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's ironic meaning and satirical tone, with excellent equivalents like 'vérité universellement reconnue' and 'propriété légitime.' The prose flows naturally in French with only minor stylistic variations from the original.

results.translated_text: Le studio était empli de l'odeur riche des roses, et quand la brise estivale agitait les arbres du jardin, il venait par la porte ouverte le lourd parfum du lilas ou le plus délicat arôme de l'aubépine en fleur. De son coin de divan aux sacs de selle persans sur lequel il était allongé, fumant, comme à son habitude, d'innombrables cigarettes, Lord Henry Wotton pouvait juste apercevoir l'éclat des fleurs au goût et à la couleur de miel d'un laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Wilde's sensory richness and aesthetic precision well, with accurate rendering of botanical details and atmospheric description. Minor fluency issues include the awkward phrasing 'il venait par la porte ouverte' (literally 'it came through the open door') and 'aux sacs de selle persans sur lequel' (grammatical agreement issue with 'lequel'), which slightly disrupt the natural flow compared to the original's elegance.

results.translated_text: "Vous avez été en Afghanistan, je le perçois." "Comment diable le savez-vous?" demandai-je, stupéfait. "Peut importe," dit-il en ricanant. "La question maintenant est celle de l'hémoglobine. Sans doute voyez-vous la signification de ma découverte?" "C'est intéressant chimiquement, sans doute," répondis-je, "mais pratiquement—" "Mais, mon ami, c'est la découverte médico-légale la plus pratique depuis des années. Ne voyez-vous pas qu'elle nous donne un test infaillible pour les taches de sang?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include 'je le perçois' being slightly awkward (better as 'je le vois'), 'Peut importe' missing the accent (Peu importe), and 'ricanant' (sneering) being slightly harsher than 'chuckling'—these small choices slightly diminish the natural flow and tone fidelity of the original Victorian dialogue.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je souhaitais vivre délibérément, faire face seulement aux faits essentiels de la vie, et voir si je ne pouvais pas apprendre ce qu'elle avait à m'enseigner, et ne pas, quand je viendrais à mourir, découvrir que je n'avais pas vécu. Je ne voulais pas vivre ce qui n'était pas la vie, car la vie est trop précieuse; ni ne voulais-je pratiquer la résignation, sauf si c'était absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre profondément et sucer toute la moelle de la vie.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with excellent rendering of key concepts like 'live deliberately' (vivre délibérément) and 'suck out all the marrow' (sucer toute la moelle). Minor fluency issues include 'quand je viendrais à mourir' (slightly archaic construction) and 'ni ne voulais-je' (inverted syntax that feels slightly forced), though these preserve the original's formal tone reasonably well.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ismaël. Il y a quelques années — peu importe combien précisément — n'ayant guère ou point d'argent dans ma bourse, et rien de particulier pour m'intéresser à terre, je pensai qu'il serait bon de naviguer un peu et de voir la partie aqueuse du monde. C'est une manière que j'ai de chasser le spleen et de réguler la circulation. Chaque fois que je me sens devenir sombre autour de la bouche; chaque fois qu'il fait un novembre humide et pluvieux dans mon âme, je considère qu'il est grand temps de prendre la mer aussi vite que possible.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, including the famous opening and Melville's philosophical reflections on melancholy. However, some nuances are lost: 'driving off the spleen' becomes 'chasser le spleen' (more literal), and 'growing grim about the mouth' as 'devenir sombre autour de la bouche' loses the physical specificity. The archaic tone is reasonably maintained but slightly modernized in places ('il serait bon' vs. a more period-appropriate construction).

results.translated_text: Es ist eine allgemein anerkannte Wahrheit, dass ein lediger Mann von großem Vermögen auf der Suche nach einer Frau sein muss. Wie wenig auch immer die Gefühle oder Ansichten eines solchen Mannes bei seinem ersten Aufenthalt in einer Nachbarschaft bekannt sein mögen, diese Wahrheit hat sich so fest in den Köpfen der umliegenden Familien verankert, dass er als rechtmäßiges Eigentum einer oder anderer ihrer Töchter angesehen wird.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and ironic tone effectively, with accurate rendering of Austen's famous opening. Minor fluency issues in the second sentence's structure ('einer oder anderer' is slightly awkward) prevent a perfect score, though the overall quality remains high.

results.translated_text: Das Studio war erfüllt von dem reichen Duft der Rosen, und wenn der leichte Sommerwind durch die Bäume des Gartens wehte, drang durch die offene Tür der schwere Duft des Flaschenbaums oder das zartere Parfüm der weißblühenden Weißdornhecken. Von der Ecke des Diwans aus Persischen Satteltaschen, auf dem er lag und wie gewohnt unzählige Zigaretten rauchte, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade noch den Glanz der honigsüßen und honigfarbenen Blüten eines Goldregens erkennen.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant botanical errors (Flaschenbaumblüten for lilac, Weißdornhecken for pink-flowering thorn) that distort Wilde's specific sensory imagery, and the phrasing is often awkward and overly literal, disrupting the aesthetic flow of the original prose.

results.translated_text: "Du warst in Afghanistan, nehme ich an." "Wie um alles in der Welt hast du das herausgefunden?" fragte ich erstaunt. "Ach, vergiss es," sagte er und lachte leise vor sich hin. "Die Frage ist jetzt die nach dem Hämoglobin. Zweifellos siehst du die Bedeutung dieser Entdeckung von mir?" "Es ist chemisch interessant, zweifellos," antwortete ich, "aber praktisch—" "Nun, Mann, es ist die praktischste medizinisch-gerichtliche Entdeckung seit Jahren. Siehst du nicht, dass sie uns einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren gibt?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and preserves the deductive dialogue between Holmes and Watson, though the use of informal 'du' instead of formal 'Sie' shifts the social register slightly. Minor fluency issues include 'lachte leise vor sich hin' (laughed softly to himself) being slightly more elaborate than the original 'chuckling to himself,' and 'praktischste' is awkward where 'praktischste' or 'bedeutsamste' might flow better.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich bewusst leben wollte, mich nur den wesentlichen Tatsachen des Lebens stellen und sehen, ob ich nicht lernen könnte, was es zu lehren hat. Und ich wollte nicht, wenn ich starb, feststellen müssen, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht das leben, was kein Leben war; denn das Leben ist so kostbar. Auch wollte ich mich nicht der Resignation hingeben, außer es war unbedingt notwendig. Ich wollte tief leben und alles Mark aus dem Leben saugen.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with excellent rendering of key concepts like 'bewusst leben' for deliberate living and 'Mark aus dem Leben saugen' for the marrow metaphor. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward punctuation and a slightly more formal register than the original's conversational tone, but the overall philosophical weight and style are well-maintained.

results.translated_text: Nennt mich Ismael. Vor einigen Jahren—es ist egal, wie lange genau—da ich weder viel noch wenig Geld in meiner Börse hatte und nichts Besonderes, das mich an Land interessierte, dachte ich, ich würde ein bisschen segeln und den wasserreichen Teil der Welt sehen. Es ist eine Methode von mir, die Melancholie zu vertreiben und die Zirkulation zu regulieren. Jedes Mal, wenn ich merke, dass mein Mund grimmig wird; jedes Mal, wenn es ein feuchter, nebliger November in meiner Seele ist, halte ich es für an der Zeit, so schnell wie möglich zur See zu fahren.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but loses some nuance (e.g., 'little or no money' becomes awkwardly 'weder viel noch wenig Geld'). While generally understandable, the phrasing often feels stilted and overly literal, failing to match the original's flowing, contemplative archaic tone—particularly in the poetic metaphors like 'damp, drizzly November in my soul.'

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero, en posesión de una buena fortuna, debe estar necesitado de una esposa. Por muy poco conocidas que sean las sensaciones o puntos de vista de tal hombre al entrar por primera vez en un vecindario, esta verdad está tan firmemente arraigada en la mente de las familias circundantes, que él es considerado como propiedad legítima de alguna de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone effectively, though 'sensaciones' is slightly less precise than 'feelings' and the phrasing is occasionally more formal than the original's conversational irony. The opening declaration and satirical commentary on marriage customs are well-rendered in Spanish.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del rico aroma de las rosas, y cuando la suave brisa estival agitaba entre los árboles del jardín, entraba por la puerta abierta el pesado perfume del lila o el más delicado aroma de la espina florida de rosa. Desde el rincón del diván de bolsas de montura persa sobre el que estaba acostado, fumando, como era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton apenas podía vislumbrar el brillo de las flores dulces y doradas de un laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Wilde's sensory-rich aesthetic language with accurate rendering of botanical and olfactory details. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ('espina florida de rosa' for 'pink-flowering thorn' and 'flores dulces y doradas' for 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured blossoms'), though the poetic intent remains intact.

results.translated_text: "Has estado en Afganistán, lo percibo." "¿Cómo demonios lo supiste?" pregunté asombrado. "No importa," dijo él, riendo para sí mismo. "La cuestión ahora es sobre la hemoglobina. Sin duda ves la importancia de este descubrimiento mío?" "Es interesante químicamente, sin duda," respondí, "pero en la práctica—" "¿Por qué, hombre? Es el descubrimiento médico-legal más práctico en años. ¿No ves que nos da una prueba infalible para manchas de sangre?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the Victorian-era dialogue style, though some phrasing feels slightly stiff (e.g., 'lo percibo' is more formal than the original's casual observation, and 'riendo para sí mismo' is slightly awkward). Minor improvements could enhance naturalness while preserving Doyle's characteristic voice.

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir deliberadamente, enfrentar solo los hechos esenciales de la vida y ver si no podía aprender lo que tenía para enseñar, y no, cuando llegara a morir, descubrir que no había vivido. No quería vivir lo que no era vida, ya que la vida es tan valiosa; ni quería practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera absolutamente necesario. Quería vivir profundamente y extraer toda la médula de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys Thoreau's philosophical meaning with faithful rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately,' 'essential facts,' and 'marrow of life.' The Spanish flows naturally, though 'valiosa' (valuable) for 'dear' slightly softens the original's emotional intensity, and the rhythmic parallelism of Thoreau's prose is somewhat diminished in the target language.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ismael. Hace algunos años —no importa cuántos exactamente— al encontrarme sin dinero en el bolsillo y sin nada particular que me interesara en tierra, pensé que sería una buena idea navegar un poco y ver la parte acuática del mundo. Es mi manera de alejar la melancolía y regular la circulación. Siempre que me siento sombrío; siempre que es un noviembre húmedo y lluvioso en mi alma, considero que ha llegado el momento de embarcarme lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and narrative voice well, but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and philosophical weight. Phrases like 'sería una buena idea' feel too modern compared to the original's contemplative tone, and 'la parte acuática' is somewhat awkward where 'lo acuático' would be more elegant.

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che un uomo single, in possesso di una buona fortuna, debba essere alla ricerca di una moglie. Per quanto poco conosciuti siano i sentimenti o le opinioni di un tale uomo al suo primo ingresso in un quartiere, questa verità è così saldamente radicata nelle menti delle famiglie circostanti che egli viene considerato come proprietà legittima di una o l'altra delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning accurately with only minor issues: 'single man' rendered as 'uomo single' is awkward (should be 'uomo celibe' or 'scapolo'), and 'quartiere' (neighborhood/district) is slightly imprecise. The ironic tone is mostly maintained, though the prose feels slightly stiff compared to Austen's elegant original.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era permeato dal ricco profumo delle rose, e quando la leggera brezza estiva agitava tra gli alberi del giardino, attraverso la porta aperta giungeva il pesante aroma del glicine o il più delicato profumo della rosa canina. Dall'angolo del divano di sacchi da sella persiani su cui era sdraiato, fumando, come era sua abitudine, innumerevoli sigarette, Lord Henry Wotton poteva appena scorgere lo splendore dei fiori dolci e dorati di un laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and aesthetic atmosphere, but contains a notable error: 'glicine' (wisteria) and 'rosa canina' (wild rose) don't match the original 'lilac' and 'pink-flowering thorn.' The prose flows naturally in Italian with good rhythm, though some poetic nuance of Wilde's original phrasing is slightly diminished.

results.translated_text: "Sei stato in Afghanistan, lo percepisco." "Come diavolo hai fatto a saperlo?" chiesi stupito. "Non importa," disse lui, ridacchiando tra sé e sé. "La questione ora è riguardo all'emoglobina. Senza dubbio vedi l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?" "È interessante dal punto di vista chimico, senza dubbio," risposi, "ma praticamente—" "Ma uomo, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non vedi che ci dà un test infallibile per le macchie di sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment, though 'lo percepisco' is slightly awkward for 'I perceive' and 'Ma uomo' lacks the natural flow of 'Why, man' in English. The Victorian tone is mostly preserved but some phrasing feels slightly stiff for natural Italian dialogue.

results.translated_text: Andai nei boschi perché desideravo vivere con intenzione, affrontare solo i fatti essenziali della vita e vedere se non potevo imparare cosa aveva da insegnarmi, e non scoprire, quando fossi giunto a morire, di non aver vissuto. Non volevo vivere ciò che non era vita, poiché la vita è così preziosa; né volevo praticare la rassegnazione, a meno che non fosse assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere in profondità e succhiare tutto il midollo della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with excellent rendering of key concepts like 'live deliberately' (vivere con intenzione) and the vivid 'suck out all the marrow' (succhiare tutto il midollo). Minor fluency considerations: 'affrontare solo i fatti essenziali' is slightly more formal than the original's directness, and 'cosa aveva da insegnarmi' could be more concise, but these are negligible in context.

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ismaele. Alcuni anni fa—non importa quanto precisamente—avendo poco o nessun denaro in tasca e nulla di particolare che mi interessasse a terra, pensai che avrei fatto un po' di vela e visto la parte acquosa del mondo. È un modo che ho di scacciare la malinconia e regolare la circolazione. Ogni volta che mi sento diventare cupo intorno alla bocca; ogni volta che è un novembre umido e piovigginoso nella mia anima, considero giunto il momento di imbarcarmi il più presto possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, with strong choices like 'malinconia' for 'spleen' and 'piovigginoso' for 'drizzly.' However, some phrasing feels slightly stiff ('avendo poco o nessun denaro in tasca' is more formal than the original's casual tone), and the archaic literary style could be enhanced with more period-appropriate Italian constructions to fully match Melville's distinctive voice.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida que um homem solteiro, em posse de uma boa fortuna, deve estar precisando de uma esposa. Por mais desconhecidos que sejam os sentimentos ou as opiniões de tal homem ao entrar pela primeira vez num bairro, esta verdade está tão firmemente fixada nas mentes das famílias circundantes, que ele é considerado propriedade legítima de uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with faithful rendering of key concepts like 'universally acknowledged' and the satirical observation about marriage prospects. Minor fluency issues include 'precisando de uma esposa' (needing a wife) which is slightly less elegant than alternatives, and the phrasing feels marginally more formal than the original's conversational irony, though the overall style and voice remain well-maintained.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava impregnado com o rico odor de rosas, e quando a brisa suave do verão agitava as árvores do jardim, entrava pela porta aberta o forte perfume da lilás ou o mais delicado aroma das flores cor-de-rosa da espinheiro. De um canto do divã de sacos de sela persas sobre o qual estava deitado, fumando, como era seu costume, incontáveis cigarros, Lorde Henry Wotton conseguia apenas vislumbrar o brilho das flores melosas e douradas de uma laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic focus of Wilde's prose effectively, with accurate preservation of botanical imagery and atmospheric detail. Minor issues include slightly awkward phrasing ('flores cor-de-rosa da espinheiro' is somewhat clunky) and 'laburnum' left untranslated, which slightly disrupts fluency for Portuguese readers unfamiliar with the term.

results.translated_text: "Você esteve no Afeganistão, percebo." "Como diabos você soube disso?" perguntei, espantado. "Não importa," disse ele, rindo consigo mesmo. "A questão agora é sobre a hemoglobina. Sem dúvida, você vê a importância dessa minha descoberta?" "É interessante do ponto de vista químico, sem dúvida," respondi, "mas praticamente—" "Ora, homem, é o mais prático dos achados médico-legais em anos. Não vê que nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow, though 'como diabos' is slightly less formal than the original's 'How on earth,' and some phrasing feels slightly constructed rather than naturally conversational. The Victorian-era tone and Holmes's characteristic deductive confidence are mostly preserved, but minor awkwardness in constructions like 'rindo consigo mesmo' and 'é o mais prático dos achados' slightly diminishes the natural fluency of native P

results.translated_text: Fui para a floresta porque desejava viver deliberadamente, enfrentar apenas os fatos essenciais da vida e ver se não poderia aprender o que ela tinha para ensinar, e não, quando chegasse a morrer, descobrir que não havia vivido. Não queria viver o que não era vida, pois a vida é tão preciosa; nem queria praticar resignação, a menos que fosse absolutamente necessário. Queria viver profundamente e sugar toda a medula da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's meaning with exceptional fidelity, capturing his philosophical intent and the paradoxical structure of his prose. Minor fluency adjustments could smooth the lengthy first sentence, but the deliberate intensity of the original is well-maintained through 'sugar toda a medula' and the parallel constructions.

results.translated_text: Chamem-me Ismael. Há alguns anos — pouco importa exatamente quantos — tendo pouca ou nenhuma moeda na minha bolsa e nada de particular que me interessasse em terra, pensei que navegar um pouco e ver a parte aquosa do mundo seria uma boa ideia. É um jeito meu de afastar o tédio e regular a circulação. Sempre que me sinto ficando sombrio; sempre que é um novembro úmido e chuvoso na minha alma, considero que é hora de ir para o mar o mais rápido possível.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses the archaic formality and philosophical weight of Melville's prose. Phrases like 'seria uma boa ideia' and 'o mais rápido possível' are too modern and colloquial for the source material's elevated, 19th-century literary tone.

results.translated_text: To jest prawda powszechnie uznana, że mężczyzna posiadający dobre majątki musi szukać żony. Jak mało byśmy znali uczucia lub poglądy takiego człowieka w momencie jego przybycia do nowej okolicy, ta prawda jest tak mocno zakorzeniona w umysłach okolicznych rodzin, że uważają go za prawną własność jednej z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone about matrimonial expectations, though 'prawną własność' (legal property) slightly shifts the satirical edge of 'rightful property,' and the phrasing is occasionally more literal than naturally flowing Polish prose would be.

results.translated_text: Studio było napełnione bogatym zapachem róż, a kiedy lekkie letnie wiatry poruszały drzewa w ogrodzie, przez otwarte drzwi wpływał ciężki aromat bzu lub delikatniejszy perfum z kwitnącej cierni. Z rogu dywanu z perskich siodełek, na którym leżał, paląc, jak zwykle, liczne papierosy, Lord Henry Wotton mógł dostrzec blask słodkiego i złocistego kwiatu złotego deszczu.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning but has notable issues: 'wiatry' (winds plural) instead of 'wiatr' (wind singular), awkward phrasing in 'perfum z kwitnącej cierni' (perfume from flowering thorn), and 'złoty deszcz' (golden rain) loses the poetic 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' imagery. The sensory richness and aesthetic precision of Wilde's prose are somewhat diminished.

results.translated_text: "Byłeś w Afganistanie, widzę." "Jak na ziemi to wiesz?" - zaskoczenie pytałem. "Nie ma sprawy," powiedział on, śmiejąc się do siebie. "Teraz chodzi o hemoglobinę. Nie ma wątpliwości, że widzisz znaczenie tego mojego odkrycia?" "Chemicznie jest ciekawe, bez wątpienia," odpowiedziałem, "ale praktycznie—" "Czyż nie widzisz, człowiecze, że to najbardziej praktyczne medycyno-prawne odkrycie za lata. Czyż nie widzisz, że daje nam nieomylny test na plamy krwi?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately but has notable fluency issues: 'zaskoczenie pytałem' is awkward (should be 'zapytałem ze zaskoczeniem'), 'Nie ma sprawy' is colloquial for the formal tone, and 'medycyno-prawne' is an awkward compound.
