scores.feedback: The translation contains significant structural errors and meaning distortions, including grammatical mistakes ('אתה היה' should be 'היית'), missing dialogue attribution, and awkward phrasing that obscures the original's clarity and Holmes's characteristic deductive confidence. The flow is disrupted and several sentences are difficult to parse in Hebrew.

results.translated_text: הלכתי אל תוך היער משום שרציתי לחיות באופן שמקורו בעצמי, להתמודד רק עם העובדות החיוניות של החיים ולראות אם אוכל ללמוד מהן, ולאגיל מתו ומגלה שהחיים לא היו ראויים לחיים. לא רציתי לחיות את מה שלא היה חיים, כי החיים יקרים כל כך; ולא רציתי להתפטר, אלא אם כן זה היה הכרחי באמת. רציתי לחיות עמוק ולספוג את כל המתיקות של החיים.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning but contains significant errors: 'באופן שמקורו בעצמי' (deliberately) is awkward, 'ולאגיל מתו' appears to be corrupted text (should relate to dying), and 'המתיקות' (sweetness) misses the visceral 'marrow' metaphor. The philosophical intensity and rhythmic power of Thoreau's prose are substantially diminished.

results.translated_text: התקנו אותי לקרוא לעצמי אישמעל. לפני שנים רבות – פרטים אלו אינם חשובים, לא משנה כמה בדיוק – הייתי עני לחלוטין, ללא כסף בשקי, וחסר דבר מעניין על החוף, אז חשבתי לצאת לשייט קצר ולראות את החלק המים של העולם. זו דרך שלי להרחיק את הנטייה לחרדה ולסייר בדם. בכל פעם שאני מרגיש עצמי מצער בפיו, בכל פעם שזה נובמבר קר ודבש על הנשמה שלי, אני יודע שזה הזמן הנכון לצאת לים ברגע שאני יכול.

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors including misinterpretations ('התקנו אותי' - 'they appointed me' instead of direct address), awkward phrasings ('החלק המים' - 'water part' instead of 'watery'), and mistranslations ('דבש' - 'honey' for 'drizzly'). The archaic, meditative tone of the original is lost, replaced by clumsy, unnatural Hebrew that reads as a poor machine translation rather than literary prose.

results.translated_text: Il est de notoriété publique qu’un célibataire en possession d’une fortune confortable doit nécessairement chercher une épouse. Peu importe ce que ressentent ou pensent ces hommes lorsqu’ils s’installent dans un nouveau quartier, cette vérité est tellement ancrée dans l’esprit des familles environnantes qu’ils sont considérés comme appartenant de droit à l’une ou l’autre de leurs filles.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains good fluency in French, though 'de notoriété publique' is slightly less elegant than the original's ironic universality claim, and 'appartenant de droit' loses some of the possessive irony of 'rightful property.'

results.translated_text: L'atelier était empli de la riche odeur des roses, et lorsque la brise estivale légère soulevait les arbres du jardin, l'encens lourd du lilas ou le parfum plus délicat de l'épine rose flottaient à travers la porte ouverte. Du coin du divan à motifs de sacoches persanes sur lequel il était allongé, fumant, comme il en avait l'habitude, d'innombrables cigarettes, Lord Henry Wotton pouvait apercevoir, à peine, l'éclat des fleurs d'un laburnum aux couleurs miel et au parfum entêtant.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and aesthetic qualities of Wilde's prose, with generally natural French phrasing. However, some nuances are lost: 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is simplified to 'aux couleurs miel et au parfum entêtant,' and 'could just catch the gleam' becomes 'pouvait apercevoir, à peine' which slightly alters the delicate perception Wilde intended; additionally, 'encens' (incense) for 'scent' is a questionable word choice that shifts the sensory impress

results.translated_text: « Vous avez séjourné en Afghanistan, je crois. » « Comment diable savez-vous cela ? » demandai-je, stupéfait. « Laissez cela de côté, » répondit-il en pouffant dans sa barbe. « La question est maintenant relative à l’hémoglobine. N’y voyez-vous pas la portée de ma découverte ? » « C’est certainement intéressant d’un point de vue chimique, » répondis-je, « mais en termes pratiques— » « Mon cher, c’est la découverte médico-légale la plus pratique depuis des années. Ne voyez-vous pas qu’elle nous donne un test infaillible pour les taches de sang ? »

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include "pouffant dans sa barbe" (chuckling into his beard) being slightly more literal than natural, and "test infaillible" using English-derived vocabulary where a more French term might flow better, though these are minor stylistic choices that don't significantly detract from the overall quality.

results.translated_text: Je me suis retiré dans les bois parce que je souhaitais vivre de manière délibérée, me confronter uniquement aux réalités essentielles de l'existence, et voir si je pouvais apprendre ce qu'elle avait à m'enseigner, afin de ne pas, au moment de mourir, découvrir que je n’avais pas vécu. Je ne voulais pas vivre une vie qui ne l'était pas, la vie est si précieuse ; et je ne souhaitais pas non plus pratiquer la résignation, à moins qu'elle ne soit absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre intensément, puiser jusqu'à la moelle même de l'existence.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the philosophical meaning and existential urgency of Thoreau's original with strong accuracy. The French reads naturally and maintains the contemplative tone, though 'vivre intensément' and 'puiser jusqu'à la moelle même' slightly soften the visceral intensity of 'live deep and suck out all the marrow'—the original's more aggressive, almost violent metaphor is somewhat domesticated.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ishmael. Il y a quelques années – importe peu combien précisément – n'ayant ni argent dans la poche, ni occupation particulière à terre, je me suis dit que je ferais bien de voguer un peu et de découvrir la partie de ce monde recouverte d'eau. C'est une façon pour moi de chasser la mélancolie et de réguler ma circulation sanguine. Chaque fois que je me sens sombre au coin de la bouche, chaque fois que mon âme subit un novembre humide et pluvieux, je considère qu'il est grand temps de prendre la mer dès que possible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately but loses some nuance in phrasing and tone. While generally understandable, several choices feel awkward (e.g., 'sombre au coin de la bouche' for 'grim about the mouth,' 'importe peu' instead of 'n'importe'), and the archaic, contemplative voice of Melville's original is somewhat diminished in favor of more modern French constructions.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine allgemein anerkannte Wahrheit, dass ein unverheirateter Mann in Besitz eines beträchtlichen Vermögens zu einer Frau gelangen muss. Unabhängig davon, wie wenig die Gefühle oder Ansichten eines solchen Mannes bei seinem ersten Eintreten in eine Nachbarschaft bekannt sind, ist diese Wahrheit so fest in den Köpfen der umliegenden Familien verankert, dass er als das legitime Eigentum einer oder anderer ihrer Töchter angesehen wird.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone through phrases like 'legitime Eigentum,' though 'zu einer Frau gelangen muss' is slightly awkward compared to the original's elegant phrasing. The formal register is well-maintained, but some constructions feel more labored than Austen's original prose.

results.translated_text: Das Atelier war erfüllt vom reichen Duft der Rosen, und wenn der leichte Sommerwind zwischen den Bäumen des Gartens spielte, so drang durch die geöffnete Tür der schwere Duft der Flieder oder das zartere Parfüm des pfingstrosenblütenartigen Strauchs. Von der Ecke des persischen Sattelsessel-Divans, auf dem er lag und wie gewohnt unzählige Zigaretten rauchte, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade noch den Glanz der honigsüßen und honigfarbenen Blüten eines Goldregenbaums erblicken.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and aesthetic qualities of Wilde's prose, but 'pfingstrosenblütenartigen Strauchs' (peony-like shrub) is an inaccurate rendering of 'pink-flowering thorn,' and the sentence structure becomes somewhat awkward and heavy compared to the original's flowing elegance.

results.translated_text: "Sie waren in Afghanistan, nehme ich an." "Wie zum Teufel wussten Sie das?", fragte ich fassungslos. "Das ist nicht wichtig", sagte er und kicherte leise vor sich hin. "Die Frage geht nun um Hämoglobin. Sehen Sie sicherlich die Bedeutung meiner Entdeckung?" "Es ist zweifellos interessant, chemisch betrachtet", antwortete ich, "aber praktisch –" "Hören Sie, mein Herr, es ist die praktischste medikolegalische Entdeckung seit Jahren. Sehen Sie nicht ein, dass sie uns einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren liefert?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. Minor issues include 'kicherte leise vor sich hin' being slightly more emphatic than 'chuckling to himself,' and 'Hören Sie, mein Herr' adding formality not present in the original 'Why, man,' which slightly shifts the casual Victorian tone.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich bewusst leben wollte, mich nur den grundlegenden Tatsachen des Lebens stellen und sehen wollte, ob ich nicht lernen konnte, was es zu lehren hatte, und nicht, wenn ich sterben sollte, feststellen, dass ich nicht gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht das leben, was keine Lebensqualität war, das Leben ist so kostbar; noch wollte ich Resignation üben, es sei denn, es war unbedingt notwendig. Ich wollte tief leben und das Mark des Lebens bis auf die Schale aussaugen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning accurately, though 'Lebensqualität' for 'life' is awkward and 'bis auf die Schale' misinterprets 'marrow.' The philosophical tone is mostly preserved but reads somewhat stiffly compared to the original's rhythmic eloquence.

results.translated_text: Nennt mich Ismael. Vor einigen Jahren – es spielt keine Rolle, wie lange genau – mit wenig oder gar keinem Geld in meiner Tasche und ohne besondere Interessen an Land, beschloss ich, ein wenig herumzusegeln und mir das wässrige Teil der Welt anzusehen. Das ist eine meiner Methoden, die Melancholie zu vertreiben und den Kreislauf in Schwung zu bringen. Immer wenn ich merke, dass mir um den Mund herum ein düsteres Gefühl aufkommt; immer wenn es einen feuchten, nieselnden November in meiner Seele ist, betrachte ich es als höchste Zeit, so bald wie möglich auf See zu fahren.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and philosophical tone well, though some archaic nuances are softened (e.g., 'spleen' becomes 'Melancholie' rather than a more literal equivalent). The phrasing is generally natural but occasionally awkward ('das wässrige Teil' is slightly clunky; 'wässrig' is uncommon in German).

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero en posesión de una buena fortuna debe estar necesitado de esposa. Por poco conocidas sean los sentimientos o puntos de vista de un hombre así al establecerse por primera vez en una comunidad, esta verdad está tan arraigada en las mentes de las familias vecinas que se le considera la propiedad legítima de una o otra de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's meaning and ironic tone, with excellent rendering of key phrases like 'universally acknowledged' to 'universalmente reconocida' and 'rightful property' to 'propiedad legítima.' Minor fluency issue: 'Por poco conocidas sean los sentimientos' has a slight grammatical awkwardness (should be 'sean los sentimientos' without 'los'), but the overall effect remains natural and captures the original's satirical voice effectively.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del rico aroma de las rosas, y cuando la ligera brisa de verano removía entre los árboles del jardín, llegaba por la puerta abierta el intenso perfume del lilas, o la fragancia más delicada de la espina de rosa de flores rosadas. Desde la esquina del diván de piel de Persia sobre el que se hallaba recostado, fumando, como era su costumbre, incontables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton podía divisar el brillo de las flores de color miel y de tono mielado de una laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meanings accurately, though 'piel de Persia' (Persian skin) is awkward for 'Persian saddle-bags' and 'laburnum' remains untranslated. Fluency is slightly compromised by awkward constructions like 'espina de rosa de flores rosadas' and the repetitive 'miel/mielado,' which dilutes Wilde's elegant sensory precision.

results.translated_text: "Usted ha estado en Afganistán, lo percibo." "¿Cómo lo supo, por el amor de Dios?", pregunté asombrado. "No importa", dijo él, soltando una risita entre dientes. "La cuestión ahora es sobre la hemoglobina. Sin duda ve la importancia de este descubrimiento mío, ¿verdad?". "Es interesante, desde el punto de vista químico, sin duda", respondí, "pero en cuanto a la práctica...". "¡Pero hombre! Es el descubrimiento médico-legal más práctico en años. ¿No ve que nos proporciona una prueba infalible para las manchas de sangre?".

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with faithful rendering of Holmes's deductive manner and Watson's astonishment. Minor stylistic choices like 'soltando una risita entre dientes' and 'por el amor de Dios' work well, though 'lo percibo' is slightly more formal than the original's casual 'I perceive.'

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir deliberadamente, enfrentar únicamente los hechos esenciales de la vida y ver si podía aprender lo que tenía para enseñarme, y no, al llegar a la muerte, descubrir que no había vivido. No deseaba vivir lo que no era vida, pues vivir es tan precioso; ni tampoco deseaba practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera absolutamente necesario. Quería vivir profundamente y extraer hasta la última esencia de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's meaning with excellent fidelity, capturing his philosophical intent and the paradoxical structure of his prose. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly formal constructions ('lo que tenía para enseñarme' is slightly awkward; 'lo que me tenía que enseñar' would flow better), and 'extraer hasta la última esencia' is a reasonable but slightly less poetic rendering of 'suck out all the marrow.'

results.translated_text: Llámame Ishmael. Hace algunos años, da igual la duración exacta, con poco o nada de dinero en el bolsillo y sin nada en particular que me interesara en tierra, pensé que navegaría un poco y vería la parte acuática del mundo. Es una forma que tengo de espantar la melancolía y regular la circulación. Cada vez que me encuentro apesadumbrado, cada vez que es un noviembre húmedo y sombrío en mi alma, considero que es llegado el momento de ponerme a la mar lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'da igual la duración exacta' slightly softens the original's dismissive tone, and 'apesadumbrado' is less precise than 'growing grim about the mouth.' The archaic literary style is reasonably maintained but lacks some of the original's philosophical weight and rhythmic cadence.

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che un uomo single in possesso di un bel patrimonio deve desiderare una moglie. Per quanto poco conosciuti possano essere i sentimenti o le opinioni di un simile uomo al suo primo arrivo in un quartiere, questa verità è talmente radicata nelle menti delle famiglie circostanti che egli è considerato la proprietà legittima di una o dell'altra delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning accurately but loses some of Austen's ironic elegance through awkward word choices like 'single' (English loanword) and 'quartiere' (neighborhood/district rather than the more appropriate 'vicinato'). The formal structure is preserved but the satirical tone is slightly diminished by less polished phrasing.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era pervaso dal ricco profumo delle rose, e quando la leggera brezza estiva si agitava tra gli alberi del giardino, giungeva attraverso la porta aperta il intenso aroma del lillà, oppure la fragranza più delicata del biancospino fiorito. Dalla sua postazione, un divano di pelle persiana da cui, come era suo solito, fumava innumerevoli sigarette, Lord Henry Wotton riusciva appena a scorgere il bagliore dei fiori color miele e di un giallo intenso di un acacio.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning but has notable issues: 'pelle persiana' (Persian leather) misinterprets 'Persian saddle-bags,' and 'acacio' (acacia) incorrectly translates 'laburnum.' The sensory richness is mostly maintained, though the aesthetic precision of Wilde's botanical and chromatic language is somewhat diminished by these errors and the slightly awkward phrasing of 'dalla sua postazione.'

results.translated_text: "Siete stato in Afghanistan, lo percepisco." "Come mai lo sa?" chiesi, stupito. "Non importa," disse lui, ridacchiando tra sé. "La questione ora riguarda l'emoglobina. Non c'è dubbio che veda l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?" "È interessante, dal punto di vista chimico, senza dubbio," risposi, "ma praticamente—" "Ma insomma, uomo mio, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non vede che ci fornisce un test infallibile per le macchie di sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue dynamics of the original, with appropriate formality levels and character voice. Minor issues include "ridacchiando tra sé" being slightly less idiomatic than "ridacchiando tra sé e sé," and the formal "Siete stato" which, while grammatically correct, slightly shifts the register compared to the original's more direct tone.

results.translated_text: Andai nel bosco perché desideravo vivere intenzionalmente, affrontare solo i fatti essenziali dell'esistenza e vedere se potevo imparare ciò che aveva da insegnare, e non scoprire, al momento della morte, di non aver vissuto. Non volevo vivere ciò che non era vita, la vita è così preziosa; né volevo esercitarmi nella rassegnazione, a meno che non fosse assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere intensamente e estrarre tutto il midollo della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with only minor semantic shifts (e.g., 'intenzionalmente' for 'deliberately' is slightly less precise, and 'intensamente' for 'deep' loses some of the original's metaphorical depth). The prose flows naturally in Italian, though 'vivere intensamente' and 'estrarre il midollo' feel slightly more conventional than Thoreau's original intensity and visceral imagery.

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ismaele. Alcuni anni fa – non importa quanto precisamente – con poche o nulle risorse in tasca e niente di particolare a tenermi legato alla terraferma, pensai di salpare un po’ e dare un’occhiata al mondo acquatico. È un modo che ho per scacciare la malinconia e regolare la circolazione. Quando mi sento cupo, quando il mio animo è avvolto da un novembre umido e piovoso, so che è tempo di tornare in mare il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and maintains readability, but loses some of Melville's distinctive voice and philosophical nuance. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become 'scacciare la malinconia' (chase away melancholy), which is less precise, and 'growing grim about the mouth' is simplified to 'mi sento cupo' (I feel gloomy), missing the physical specificity of the original's archaic style.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida que um homem solteiro, na posse de uma boa fortuna, deve estar precisando de uma esposa. Por pouco conhecidos que sejam os sentimentos ou opiniões de tal homem ao entrar pela primeira vez em um bairro, essa verdade está tão bem fixada nas mentes das famílias vizinhas que ele é considerado a propriedade legítima de uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves Austen's meaning and ironic tone, with excellent rendering of the famous opening line. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in "na posse de" and "ao entrar pela primeira vez em um bairro" that could be more elegant, though the overall style and voice remain well-maintained.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava impregnado do rico aroma de rosas, e quando a brisa leve e estival agitava entre as árvores do jardim, entrava pela porta aberta o pesado perfume do lilás, ou a mais delicada fragrância do espinheiro cor-de-rosa. Do canto do divã de couro persa em que estava deitado, fumando, como era seu costume, inúmeros cigarros, Lord Henry Wotton podia vislumbrar o brilho das flores cor-de-mel e de cor de mel de um acácia-amarela.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and meaning, though 'couro persa' (Persian leather) misinterprets 'saddle-bags' and 'acácia-amarela' incorrectly identifies the laburnum tree. The aesthetic tone is mostly preserved but slightly diminished by awkward phrasing like the repetitive 'cor de mel' construction.

results.translated_text: "Você esteve no Afeganistão, percebo." "Como é que você soube?", perguntei, maravilhado. "Não importa," disse ele, soltando uma risada para si mesmo. "A questão agora é sobre hemoglobina. Sem dúvida, você vê a importância desta minha descoberta?" "É interessante, quimicamente, sem dúvida," respondi, "mas na prática—" "Ora, meu caro, é a descoberta médico-legal mais prática nos últimos anos. Não percebe que nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. While generally fluent and natural in Portuguese, minor stylistic choices like 'Ora, meu caro' slightly modernize Holmes's Victorian formality, and 'maravilhado' (amazed) is slightly less precise than 'astonishment' for Watson's reaction.

results.translated_text: Fui para a floresta porque desejava viver deliberadamente, encarar apenas os factos essenciais da vida, e ver se conseguiria aprender o que ela tinha a ensinar, e não, quando viesse a morrer, descobrir que não tinha vivido. Não desejava viver o que não era vida, a vida é tão preciosa; nem desejava praticar a resignação, a menos que fosse absolutamente necessária. Queria viver profundamente e extrair toda a medula da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with excellent semantic accuracy. The prose flows naturally in Portuguese, though some constructions like 'factos essenciais' and 'extrair toda a medula' are slightly more formal than the contemplative rhythm of the original, and the repetitive structure of the opening clauses could be more elegantly mirrored.

results.translated_text: Chame-me Ishmael. Há alguns anos – não importa a precisão do tempo decorrido – com pouco ou nenhum dinheiro no bolso e nada em particular para me interessar em terra, pensei em navegar um pouco e conhecer a parte aquosa do mundo. É uma forma que tenho de afastar a melancolia e regular a circulação. Sempre que me sinto taciturno, quando é um novembro húmido e nevoento na minha alma, considero que é tempo de ir para o mar o mais rápido possível.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'taciturno' (taciturn) is less precise than 'grim about the mouth' and 'o mais rápido possível' is more modern than the archaic tone. The fluency is generally good but slightly stiff in places; the archaic literary style is partially maintained but could be more elevated and period-appropriate.

results.translated_text: Powszechnie przyjęło się za prawdę, że każdy niezamężny mężczyzna posiadający majątek, musi pragnąć żony. Niezależnie od tego, jak mało znane mogą być jego uczucia i poglądy przy pierwszym wprowadzeniu się do nowej okolicy, to prawda ta jest tak głęboko utrwalona w umysłach otaczających go rodzin, że uważa się go za należność jednej z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, though 'należność' (property/possession) is slightly less elegant than the original's 'property,' and the sentence structure becomes somewhat more cumbersome in Polish, slightly diminishing the fluidity of the famous opening.

results.translated_text: W pracowni unosił się bogaty zapach róż, a gdy letni wiatr poruszał drzewami w ogrodzie, przez otwarte drzwi dobiegał intensywny aromat lilaków lub delikatniejszy zapach różowego ciernia. Leżąc na perskim divanie z siedzeniami w stylu siodła, na którym palił, jak to było jego zwyczajem, niezliczone papierosy, lord Henry Wotton z rogu mógł dostrzec blask miodosłodkich i miodowożółtych kwiatów akacji.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but loses some aesthetic precision: 'divan of Persian saddle-bags' becomes awkwardly 'perskim divanie z siedzeniami w stylu siodła' (Persian divan with saddle-style seats), and 'laburnum' is incorrectly rendered as 'akacja' (acacia). The sensory richness and Wildean aestheticism are somewhat diminished by less elegant phrasing and occasional awkwardness in construction.

results.translated_text: — Byłaś w Afganistanie, jak wyczuwam. — „Jak na ziemi mogłeś to wiedzieć?” spytałem z oszołomieniem. — „Drobiazg”, odparł, cicho rechocząc. „Pytanie teraz dotyczy hemoglobiny. Czyż nie dostrzegasz doniosłości mojego odkrycia?” — „Niewątpliwie jest to interesujące, pod względem chemicznym” – odpowiedziałem – „ale w praktyce –” — „Człowieku, to najbardziej praktyczne odkrycie medykopsychologiczne od lat. Czyż nie widzisz, że daje nam ono nieomylny test śladów krwi?”

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning but contains significant errors: gender inconsistency (feminine 'Byłaś' instead of masculine 'Byłeś'), misinterpretation of 'medico-legal' as 'medykopsychologiczne' (medico-psychological), and awkward phrasing in places. The dialogue structure is preserved but reads somewhat stiffly for Polish.

results.translated_text: Szedłem do lasu, ponieważ pragnąłem żyć w sposób świadomy, zmierzyć się tylko z nadrzędnymi prawdami życia i sprawdzić, czy mogę nauczyć się tego, czego on ma do zaoferowania, aby nie odkryć, gdy nadejdę końca, że w ogóle nie żyłem. Nie chciałem żyć tym, co nie było życiem, bo życie jest tak cenne; ani też nie chciałem praktykować bierności, chyba że byłaby to absolutna konieczność. Chciałem żyć głęboko i wysączyć z życia całą jego esencję.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's philosophical meaning accurately, though some nuances are lost—'front only the essential facts' becomes 'zmierzyć się' (confront/measure up to) rather than directly facing them, and 'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'wysączyć...esencję' (extract essence), which is less visceral. The prose reads naturally in Polish but occasionally feels slightly more formal than the original's conversational intimacy, and the rhythmic power of Thoreau's repetitions is s

results.translated_text: Zwać mnie Izmael. Kilka lat temu – niechaj nie będę precyzował, jak dokładnie – mając niewielką ilość pieniędzy w sakiewce i nic szczególnego, co mogłoby przyciągnąć moją uwagę na lądzie, postanowiłem trochę poplątać i zobaczyć wodną część świata. To mój sposób na uwalnianie się od melancholii i regulowanie krążenia. Kiedy tylko czuję, że wcinam się w usta, kiedy to listopad ponury i wilgotny w mojej duszy, uważam, że nadszedł czas, by jak najszybciej wyjść na morze.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but contains notable issues: 'poplątać' (to tangle) is an awkward choice for 'sail about,' and 'wcinam się w usta' (I cut into my mouth) is a mistranslation of 'growing grim about the mouth.' The archaic, contemplative tone is partially lost due to these errors and some stilted phrasing that doesn't flow naturally in Polish.

results.translated_text: 诚然，一个拥有良好财产的单身汉，必定渴求一妻。 无论他对周围社区的感受和看法是鲜为人知，但这个真理已深深根植于周围家庭的观念中，他们认为他理应属于他们女儿中的某一位。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses some nuance of Austen's ironic tone and elegant phrasing. The sentence structure becomes awkward in places (e.g., '无论他对周围社区的感受和看法是鲜为人知' is grammatically unclear), and the opening's famous ironic universality feels diminished rather than emphasized as in the original.

results.translated_text: 工作室里弥漫着浓郁的玫瑰香气，每当夏日微风吹拂过花园中的树木，从敞开的门中便会飘来丁香的沉重芬芳，或是蔷薇花更为清淡的香气。 躺在波斯马鞍包制的沙发上，正如他惯常的做法，抽着一支又一支的香烟，亨利·沃顿勋爵从角落里隐约能瞥见一株金灿灿、香气甜腻的槐树花朵的闪耀。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and aesthetic details, though some botanical precision is lost (pink-flowering thorn becomes 蔷薇花, laburnum becomes 槐树). The sentence structure becomes somewhat awkward in Chinese, particularly the final clause, affecting natural readability despite preserving the overall aesthetic tone.

results.translated_text: “看来你曾去过阿富汗。”我听见有人说。 “你怎么会知道的？” 我惊诧地问道。“别问了。” 他自己咯咯地笑着说。“现在的问题是血红蛋白。你肯定能理解我这个发现的重要性吧？” “从化学的角度来看，这确实很有趣，”我回答说，“但从实际应用上来说——” “你瞧，这是近年来最实用的医学法律发现。你没看到这能让我们得到一个对血迹一模一样的检验方法吗？”

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though some nuances are lost (e.g., 'infallible test' becomes 'identical test method'). The dialogue flows reasonably well in Chinese but lacks the crisp, Victorian-era formality and Watson's characteristic voice present in the original.

results.translated_text: 我来到森林，是因为我渴望过一种有意识的生活，直面人生最核心的事实，看看能否从中学习，以免垂死之际，发现我从未真正地活过。我不想过一种虚伪的生活，生命如此珍贵；我也不想强迫自己顺从，除非绝对必要。我想深入地生活，榨取生命中所有的精华。

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings effectively, with natural Chinese phrasing that preserves the contemplative tone. Minor deviations include 'living is so dear' rendered as 'life is so precious' (slightly different emphasis) and 'practise resignation' as 'force oneself to comply' (subtle semantic shift), but these do not significantly distort the original meaning or impact.

results.translated_text: 请叫我以实玛利。有些年前——具体多少年并不重要——我口袋里几乎没有钱，而且岸上也没有什么特别吸引我的事情，我便想去航行一番，看看这广阔的水域世界。这是我排遣郁闷、调节气血循环的一种方式。每当我发现自己神情阴郁，或者我的灵魂里像十一月的阴雨一样潮湿，我就会觉得是时候尽快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, though 'regulating the circulation' (调节气血循环) is a somewhat literal interpretation that loses the metaphorical weight of the original. The archaic literary style is reasonably preserved, but the Chinese phrasing occasionally feels more modern and less contemplative than the source text's deliberate, meditative rhythm.

results.translated_text: 誠實地說，一個有財產的單身漢，必定會想要娶妻，這是一項普遍為人所認可的真理。 無論這樣一位先生初到一個社區時，內心滋生的情感或觀點有多麼鮮為人知，這項真理已經深深根植於周遭家庭的腦海中，使他被視為是某一位或哪一位女兒的合法所有物。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's iconic ironic tone and elegant simplicity. The opening phrase '誠實地說' (honestly speaking) misses the satirical universality of the original, and the prose feels more literal and awkward than Austen's flowing style, particularly in the phrase about daughters being 'rightful property.'

results.translated_text: 畫室瀰漫著濃郁的玫瑰香氣，每當夏日輕風吹拂過花園中的樹木，從敞開的門縫中便會傳來丁香的馥郁，或是粉花刺的更為清雅的香氣。躺臥在波斯鞍狀的長沙發角落，正按照慣例抽著無數支香菸的亨利·沃頓勳爵，可以勉強瞥見金黃色、蜜糖般香甜的槐樹花朵閃耀的光芒。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic sensibility of Wilde's prose effectively, with accurate botanical references and appropriate vocabulary choices. Minor fluency issues arise from the complex sentence structure in the final clause, where the word order feels slightly awkward compared to natural Chinese prose flow.

results.translated_text: “你曾在阿富汗駐紮過，我猜得到。”我驚訝地問道。“你究竟是如何知道的？”“別在意，”他自顧自地笑了笑說。“現在要談的是血紅蛋白。你肯定能理解我這個發現的重要性吧？”“化學上無疑是很有趣的，”我回答說，“但在實用性上……”“老兄，這可是近年來最重要的醫學法律發現。你沒看到這能為我們提供一個對血跡絕對可靠的檢測方法嗎？”

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure well, though the opening line's word order creates slight awkwardness, and some nuances of Holmes's deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment are softened. The technical terminology is accurate, but the natural conversational rhythm of the original is somewhat diminished.

results.translated_text: 我前往森林，是因我渴望過著深思熟慮的生活，直面生命中最基本的事實，看看是否能從中學習，以免在垂死之際，發現我並未真正生活過。我不想過著虛假的生活，生命如此珍貴；我也不想勉強自己接受順境，除非那是絕對必要。我想要深入地生活，榨取生命中所蘊含的每一滴精華。

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings effectively, with strong preservation of the meditative tone. Minor issues include 'practise resignation' rendered as 'accept prosperity' (順境) rather than 'resignation' (放棄/妥協), and slight awkwardness in phrasing like '榨取...每一滴精華' which, while poetic, slightly shifts the organic metaphor of 'sucking the marrow.'

results.translated_text: 喚我以士麥爾之名。幾年前——細節不必深究——囊中羞澀，陸地上又乏人皆宜之事，我便想乘風航行一番，看看水域世界的模樣。這是我的排遣煩悶、調整血脈的方式。每當我感到口唇緊閉；每當我的靈魂籠罩在陰冷潮濕的十一月之際，我就認為是時候盡快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning and archaic tone effectively, with strong choices like '喚我以士麥爾之名' and '囊中羞澀.' Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ('口唇緊閉' for 'growing grim about the mouth' is interpretive rather than literal), but the poetic essence and melancholic atmosphere are well-preserved.

results.translated_text: 世間一般に、良縁を得たいと願う未婚の男性は、いくら富裕であっても、妻を必要とすると言われている。そのような男性が初めて近隣に住むことになったとき、彼がどのような感情や考えを持っているかは誰にも分からないかもしれないが、周囲の家柄の人々の中では、この事実は確固たるものとして定着しており、彼はその娘の一人が当然のごとく所有するものと見なされるのである。

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but significantly misses Austen's ironic tone and inverts the original logic—the source states a man WITH fortune must want a wife, but the translation suggests he must WANT a good fortune. The verbose, awkward phrasing fails to preserve the elegant irony and satirical voice that defines this famous opening.

results.translated_text: 部屋はバラの濃厚な香りに満ちており、夏のそよ風が庭の木々を吹き抜けるたびに、開け放たれた扉からスミレの重い香、あるいはピンク色の花を咲かせるトゲのある植物のより繊細な香りが漂ってくる。ペルシャの鞍袋をあしらったソファの隅で、いつものように無数の煙草を燻らせていたヘンリー・ウォットン卿は、そこから金色の蜜のような花を咲かせるハンノキの輝きをかすかに捉えることができた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic sensory elements but contains significant errors: 'スミレ' (violet) misidentifies lilac, 'ハンノキ' (alder) is incorrect for laburnum, and 'トゲのある植物' (thorny plant) is vague for 'pink-flowering thorn.' The prose reads somewhat stiffly and loses Wilde's flowing aesthetic elegance, particularly in the sensory accumulation and poetic rhythm of the original.

results.translated_text: 「あなたはアフガニスタンにいらっしゃったのですね、と見受けします。」私は驚きながら尋ねた。「どうやってそれを知ったのか？」すると彼は、独り言のように笑いながら、「気にしないでください」と言った。「今議論すべきはヘモグロビンです。私が発見したこの意義をご理解いただけるでしょうか？」私は答えた。「化学的には興味深いものですね、しかし実用的には…」彼は言った。「いいえ、これは長年における最も実用的な医学的・法的発見です。血痕に対する完璧な鑑定方法を与えてくれるということに気づかないのですか？」

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but has structural issues: the dialogue attribution is confused (the first line should be Holmes speaking, not the narrator), and the flow is awkward with some redundant phrases. While technically accurate in vocabulary, the natural dialogue rhythm and Victorian tone are compromised by overly formal Japanese constructions.

results.translated_text: 森へ行ったのは、意図的に生き、人生の不可欠な真実に立ち向かい、それが教えてくれることを学び、死ぬ前に、生きていないと後悔しないようにしたかったからです。生きているようで生きないことを生きるつもりはありませんでした。生きていることはあまりにも貴重です。また、やむを得ない場合に限って、諦めを実践するつもりもありませんでした。私は深く生きて、人生の髄をすべて引き出したいと思ったのです。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some philosophical nuance and poetic rhythm characteristic of Thoreau's prose. Phrases like '人生の髄をすべて引き出したい' (extract all the marrow of life) are accurate, but the overall flow feels somewhat stilted and less contemplative than the original's meditative tone.

results.translated_text: 召しなさい、イシュメールと。数年前のことだ—正確な年数は忘れよう—財布の中身はほとんどなく、陸上で特別な興味もなかった私は、少しの間、海に出て、世界の水面を見ようと思い立った。それは私が、憂鬱を払い、血行を整えるための方法なのだ。私が口元が取り澄んでくるのを感じる時、私の魂の中に、じめじめとした、憂鬱な十一月が訪れる時、私はできるだけ早く海に出るべきだと考える。

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant errors: 'Call me Ishmael' is mistranslated as an imperative command rather than an introduction; 'grim about the mouth' becomes 'taking on a composed expression' (逆の意味); and the archaic, meditative tone is lost through awkward phrasing and incorrect word choices. The poetic melancholy of the original is substantially diminished.

results.translated_text: 흔히 알려져 있는 진실은, 상당한 재산을 가진 미혼 남자는 반드시 아내를 원한다는 것이다. 그러한 남자가 처음 이웃 동네에 들어설 때 그의 감정이나 견해가 얼마나 알려지지 않았든, 이 진실은 주변 가족들의 마음속에 굳건히 자리 잡고 있어서, 그는 누군가의 딸의 적법한 소유물로 여겨진다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses Austen's distinctive ironic voice and the opening's famous declarative punch. The phrase '흔히 알려져 있는 진실은' (commonly known truth) weakens the universal authority of the original 'universally acknowledged,' and the overall phrasing feels more literal and less elegant than Austen's flowing prose.

results.translated_text: 방 안은 장미 향기로 가득했고, 여름날 가벼운 바람이 정원의 나무들 사이를 스치고 지나갈 때마다 열린 문틈으로 짙은 라일락 향이나 분홍빛 꽃잎을 지닌 가시나무의 은은한 향기가 실려 들어왔다. 페르시아 안마의자처럼 덧대어진 소파 구석에서, 그는 늘 하던 대로 수많은 담배를 피워 물고 있는데, 눈을 돌리면 꿀처럼 달콤하고 황금빛 꽃들이 피어 있는 금단나무의 윤기가 엿보였다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic focus of Wilde's prose effectively, with accurate rendering of floral imagery and atmospheric details. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing in the final clause, and some nuance of 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' is somewhat compressed, but overall the luxurious, decadent tone is well-preserved.

results.translated_text: "당신은 아프가니스탄에 있었다고 짐작되네요." 나는 놀라움에 묻 듯이 물었다. "어떻게 그걸 알았어요?" 그는 혼자 킥킥 웃으며 대답했다. "됐수, 이제 문제는 헤모글로빈이지. 내 발견의 중요성을 분명히 알아볼 거라고 생각해요?" "화학적으로는 흥미롭겠지만, 실용적인 측면에서 보면—" "아니, 대단히 실용적인 의료법적 발견입니다. 수 년 만에 가장 확실한 혈흔 검사법을 제공한다는 걸 모르겠어요?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant structural errors: dialogue attribution is misplaced (Holmes's first line is attributed to Watson), pronoun references are confused, and the conversational flow is disrupted. The tone shifts awkwardly between formal and casual, and some phrasings feel unnatural in Korean, detracting from the original's Victorian-era detective fiction style.

results.translated_text: 숲으로 간 이유는, 삶의 본질적인 진실에 정면으로 맞서 살고, 그것이 가르치는 바를 배우고자 했기 때문입니다. 그리고 죽음에 이를 때, 내가 진정으로 살지 않았다는 것을 깨닫고 싶지 않았습니다. 내가 삶이 아닌 것을 살아가는 것을 원치 않았습니다. 삶은 너무나 소중합니다. 또한, 불가피한 경우가 아니라면 체념하는 연습을 하고 싶지도 않았습니다. 저는 깊이 살고, 삶의 모든 뼈 속까지 섭취하고 싶었습니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the philosophical meaning but loses some key nuances: 'deliberately' is omitted from the opening, and 'suck out all the marrow' becomes awkwardly literal ('섭취하고' - consume/ingest) rather than capturing the vivid, visceral metaphor. The sentence structure becomes choppy and less flowing than Thoreau's original rhythmic prose, affecting both fluency and the meditative philosophical tone.

results.translated_text: 나를 이즈마엘이라 부르시오. 몇 년 전—정확히 얼마나 전인지는 중요하지 않소—지갑에는 돈이 거의 없었고, 육지에서는 특별히 흥미로운 일도 없었기에, 잠시 항해하며 세상의 물 부분을 둘러보리라 생각했습니다. 그것은 내가 우울함을 쫓아내고 혈액 순환을 조절하는 방법입니다. 내가 입술 주변이 굳어지기 시작할 때, 즉, 내 영혼에 흐린 11월이 찾아왔을 때, 가능한 한 빨리 바다로 나가야 할 때라고 생각합니다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses the archaic, contemplative tone of Melville's prose through inconsistent formality levels and awkward phrasings like '혈액 순환을 조절하는' (regulating blood circulation) which sounds clinical rather than philosophical. The mixing of formal and informal registers ('이즈마엘이라 부르시오' vs. '생각했습니다') undermines the original's consistent narrative voice.

results.translated_text: Chắc chắn rằng, một sự thật đã được công nhận rộng rãi là một người đàn ông độc thân sở hữu một gia sản tốt đẹp hẳn là cần một người vợ. Dù cảm xúc và quan điểm của người đàn ông đó có thể không được biết đến nhiều khi lần đầu tiên ông ta đến một khu phố, sự thật này đã được khắc sâu trong tâm trí các gia đình xung quanh, đến nỗi ông ta được coi là tài sản hợp pháp của một trong các cô con gái của họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's iconic ironic opening through awkward phrasing and word order that obscures the satirical tone. The structure feels clunky compared to the original's elegant simplicity, and key ironic elements like the deadpan certainty are diminished by verbose constructions.

results.translated_text: Xưởng vẽ ngập tràn mùi thơm nồng nàn của hoa hồng, và khi làn gió hè thoảng qua giữa những hàng cây trong vườn, hương thơm đậm đà của hoa tử đinh lý hoặc hương thơm tinh tế hơn của hoa sói rừng lại lùa vào qua cửa mở. Từ góc chiếc ghế bành Ba Tư hình yên ngựa mà ông đang nằm, hút vô số điếu thuốc như thường lệ, Lord Henry Wotton có thể vừa thoáng thấy ánh sáng vàng mật và màu mật ong của những chùm hoa laburnum.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning, but loses some aesthetic refinement through awkward phrasing ('hoa sói rừng' for pink-flowering thorn is questionable), and the poetic flow of Wilde's prose is diminished by clunky constructions like 'hình yên ngựa' and 'vàng mật và màu mật ong' which feel overly literal rather than elegantly rendered.

results.translated_text: “Tôi thấy, hình như anh đã từng ở Afghanistan.” “Anh biết được thế nào vậy?” Tôi hỏi, kinh ngạc. “Thôi đi,” anh cười khúc khích, tự nhủ. “Bây giờ câu hỏi là về huyết cầu tố. Chắc hẳn anh thấy tầm quan trọng của phát hiện này rồi chứ?” “Chắc hẳn nó rất thú vị về mặt hóa học,” tôi đáp, “nhưng về mặt ứng dụng—” “Này, thưa anh, đó là một phát hiện y pháp quan trọng nhất trong nhiều năm qua. Anh không thấy sao nó cho chúng ta một phương pháp kiểm tra vết máu hoàn toàn chính xác sao?”

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure well, though 'huyết cầu tố' (hemoglobin) is somewhat technical and the conversational flow loses some of Holmes's characteristic terseness. The exclamatory tone and logical progression are preserved, but the Victorian-era formality and Sherlock's distinctive voice are slightly diminished in the Vietnamese rendering.

results.translated_text: Tôi đến rừng vì tôi muốn sống một cách có chủ ý, đối diện chỉ với những sự thật thiết yếu của cuộc đời, và xem liệu tôi có thể học được điều gì từ nó hay không, để đến khi chết, tôi không phải hối hận vì đã không thực sự sống. Tôi không muốn sống những gì không phải là cuộc sống, bởi vì sống thật quý giá; cũng không muốn thực hành sự chấp nhận, trừ khi thực sự cần thiết. Tôi muốn sống sâu sắc và tận hưởng trọn vẹn những tinh túy của cuộc đời.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core philosophical meaning and existential urgency of Thoreau's passage well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately' (có chủ ý) and 'essential facts' (sự thật thiết yếu). However, some nuances are lost: 'discover that I had not lived' becomes 'hối hận vì đã không thực sự sống' (regret for not truly living), which slightly shifts the existential weight; 'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'tận hưởng trọn vẹn những tinh túy' (fully enjoy the essence)

results.translated_text: Hãy gọi tôi là Ísmay. Vài năm trước—không cần biết chính xác bao lâu—khi tôi chẳng có tiền trong túi và cũng chẳng có điều gì đặc biệt để lôi cuốn trên đất liền, tôi nghĩ rằng mình nên ra khơi một chuyến để khám phá phần nước của thế giới. Đó là cách tôi xua tan sự u sầu và điều hòa lưu thông. Bất cứ khi nào tôi cảm thấy mình trở nên cau có; bất cứ khi nào trong tâm hồn tôi là một tháng Mười Lạnh Giá, ẩm ướt, tôi thấy rằng đã đến lúc phải ra biển càng sớm càng tốt.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' as melancholy becomes literal 'sự u sầu'; 'damp, drizzly November' becomes awkwardly reordered). The archaic, meditative tone of the original is diminished, and some phrasings feel stiff rather than flowing naturally in Vietnamese.

results.translated_text: เป็นความจริงที่ได้รับการยอมรับกันโดยทั่วไปว่า ชายผู้โสดที่มีทรัพย์สินเงินทองจำนวนมาก ย่อมปรารถนาจะมีภรรยา แม้ว่าความรู้สึกและความคิดเห็นของชายผู้นั้นอาจไม่เป็นที่ปรากฏในการเข้ามาอยู่ในละแวกใหม่ แต่ความจริงข้อนี้ฝังรากลึกอยู่ในความคิดของครอบครัวรอบข้าง จนทำให้เขาถูกพิจารณาว่าเป็นสมบัติโดยชอบธรรมของลูกสาวคนใดคนหนึ่งในบรรดาครอบครัวเหล่านั้น

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures the ironic tone of Austen's opening, though some phrasing feels slightly more formal/awkward than the original's elegant simplicity. The key concepts are preserved, but the flowing rhythm of the English prose is somewhat diminished in the Thai version.

results.translated_text: ห้องทำงานอบอวลไปด้วยกลิ่นหอมฉุนของดอกกุหลาบ และเมื่อลมฤดูร้อนแผ่วเบาพัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน กลิ่นหอมรุนแรงของดอกไลแลคหรือกลิ่นหอมละมุนของดอกหลุมดินสีชมพูก็ลอยลอดผ่านประตูที่เปิดแง้มออกมา จากมุมของโซฟาเบาะนั่งลายสานเปอร์เซียที่ท่านลอร์ดเฮนรี วอททันกำลังนอนแผ่ยาควันบุหรี่นับไม่ถ้วน เขาสังเกตเห็นแสงระยิบระยับของดอกซัลเฟอร์สีเหลืองทองที่หอมหวานราวกับน้ำผึ้งได้เพียงแวบเดียว

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning, though some botanical terms are approximated (e.g., 'ซัลเฟอร์' for laburnum is imprecise) and the flowing, rhythmic quality of Wilde's prose is somewhat diminished by awkward phrasing like 'เขาสังเกตเห็น' which breaks the elegant narrative flow.

results.translated_text: "ข้าพเจ้าสังเกตว่าท่านเคยไปอัฟกานิสถานมาสินะ" "ท่านรู้ได้อย่างไรกัน?" ข้าพเจ้าถามด้วยความประหลาดใจ "ช่างเถอะ" เขาตอบพลางหัวเราะเบาๆ กับตัวเอง "คำถามที่สำคัญตอนนี้คือเรื่องฮีโมโกลบิน ท่านคงเห็นความสำคัญของการค้นพบของข้าพเจ้าอย่างแน่นอน" "มันน่าสนใจในเชิงเคมีอย่างไม่ต้องสงสัย" ข้าพเจ้าตอบ "แต่ในทางปฏิบัติ—" "อะไรกัน ผู้ชาย ท่านมันเป็นการค้นพบทางการแพทย์กฎหมายที่ใช้งานได้จริงที่สุดในช่วงหลายปีที่ผ่านมา ท่านไม่เห็นหรือว่ามันทำให้เรามีวิธีการทดสอบคราบเลือดที่แน่นอนได้อย่างไร?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue structure of the original text, with proper preservation of Holmes's deductive nature and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in places (e.g., 'ช่างเถอะ' could be more natural, and the final sentence structure is somewhat convoluted) that slightly detract from the natural flow of Thai dialogue.

results.translated_text: ข้าพเจ้าเข้าไปในป่า เพราะปรารถนาจะใช้ชีวิตอย่างตั้งใจ, เผชิญหน้ากับข้อเท็จจริงที่จำเป็นต่อการดำรงชีวิต, และดูว่าข้าพเจ้าจะสามารถเรียนรู้สิ่งที่ป่ามีไว้สอนได้หรือไม่, และมิใช่เมื่อถึงวาระสุดท้ายจึงพบว่าข้าพเจ้าไม่ได้ใช้ชีวิตเลย ข้าพเจ้าไม่ปรารถนาจะใช้ชีวิตในสิ่งที่มิใช่ชีวิต เพราะการมีชีวิตนั้นล้ำค่า; และข้าพเจ้ามิได้ปรารถนาที่จะฝึกฝนความอ่อนน้อม, เว้นแต่จะเป็นสิ่งที่หลีกเลี่ยงไม่ได้ ข้าพเจ้าปรารถนาจะใช้ชีวิตอย่างลึกซึ้ง และกลั่นเอาคุณค่าทั้งหมดจากชีวิตออกมา

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential concerns, with thoughtful choices like 'ข้าพเจ้า' for formal first-person and 'กลั่นเอาคุณค่า' for 'suck out the marrow.' Minor fluency issues arise from comma usage and slightly formal phrasing that, while appropriate for the philosophical tone, occasionally feels less natural than native Thai prose would be.

results.translated_text: เรียกฉันว่าอิชมาเอล เมื่อหลายปีก่อน—ไม่จำเป็นต้องระบุเวลาที่แน่นอน—ด้วยเงินในกระเป๋าอันน้อยนิด หรือไม่มีสิ่งใดเป็นพิเศษที่น่าสนใจบนฝั่ง ผมจึงคิดจะออกเรือนเล็กน้อยเพื่อชมโลกอันกว้างใหญ่ที่เต็มไปด้วยน้ำ เป็นวิธีที่ผมใช้ขับไล่ความหม่นเศร้าและปรับสมดุลการไหลเวียนของโลหิต เมื่อใดที่ผมรู้สึกขมุกขมัวบริเวณปาก เมื่อใดที่จิตใจของผมเป็นฤดูพฤศจิกายนที่ชื้นแฉะ ผมถือว่าถึงเวลาอันควรที่จะต้องรีบไปสู่ทะเลโดยเร็วแล้ว

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key meanings but loses some nuance in metaphorical expressions (e.g., 'driving off the spleen' becomes more literal). The Thai reads somewhat awkwardly in places and doesn't fully preserve Melville's archaic, contemplative tone, though it maintains the general narrative voice and structure.

results.translated_text: यह एक ऐसी सच्चाई है जिसे जगत ने स्वीकार किया है कि एक सुखीहालत में धनी व्यक्ति को पत्नी की आवश्यकता होती है। भले ही ऐसे व्यक्ति की भावनाएँ और विचार उस मोहल्ले में प्रवेश करते ही कितने भी अज्ञात हों, यह सच्चाई आस-पास के परिवारों के मन में इतनी गहरी जड़ें जमा चुकी है कि उसे उनकी बेटियों में से किसी न किसी की जायज़ संपत्ति माना जाता है।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic intent reasonably well, but loses some of Austen's elegant precision and satirical bite. Phrases like 'जगत ने स्वीकार किया है' feel slightly awkward, and 'जायज़ संपत्ति' (legitimate property) doesn't fully convey the sardonic tone of 'rightful property' in the original.

results.translated_text: कमरे में गुलाब की मनमोहक खुशबू फैली हुई थी, और जब हल्की ग्रीष्मकालीन हवा बगीचे के पेड़ों में से गुजरी, तो खुले दरवाज़े से गुलमोहर की तीखी सुगंध या गुलाबी फूलों वाले कांटों की हल्की खुशबू कमरे में फैल गई। फ़ारसी झोला-बिछावन वाले सोफ़े के कोने से, जहाँ लॉर्ड हेनरी वॉटन, अपनी आदत के अनुसार, अनगिनत सिगरेट सुलगा रहे थे, वे सुनहरी-मधुयुक्त और शहद जैसे रंग के लेबुर्मा के फूलों की चमक को बस देख सकते थे।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most sensory details and maintains the aesthetic focus, but contains a significant botanical error (गुलमोहर/gulmohar instead of lilac) and some awkward constructions that disrupt the lyrical flow characteristic of Wilde's prose. The ornate descriptive style is partially preserved but feels somewhat stilted in Hindi.

results.translated_text: "मुझे लगता है कि आप अफ़ग़ानिस्तान में रहे हैं।" मैंने आश्चर्य से पूछा, “पृथ्वी पर आपको कैसे पता चला?” “कोई बात नहीं,” उसने खुद से हँसते हुए कहा। “अब सवाल है हीमोग्लोबिन का। क्या आपको निश्चित रूप से मेरे इस खोज का महत्व समझ में आता है?” मैंने जवाब दिया, “यह निस्संदेह रासायनिक रूप से दिलचस्प है, लेकिन व्यावहारिक रूप से—" “अरे भाई, यह वर्षों में सबसे व्यावहारिक चिकित्सा-कानूनी खोज है। क्या आपको यह समझ में नहीं आता कि यह हमें रक्त के धब्बों के लिए एक अचूक परीक्षण प्रदान करता है?”

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and preserves the deductive dialogue between Holmes and Watson, though some phrasing feels slightly stiff and the conversational flow could be more natural. The character voices and Victorian-era formality are reasonably maintained, but minor awkwardness in sentence construction slightly diminishes the reading experience.

results.translated_text: मैं जंगल में गया क्योंकि मेरी इच्छा थी कि मैं जानबूझकर जीऊं, जीवन के केवल अनिवार्य सत्यों का सामना करूं, और देखूं कि मैं उनसे क्या सीख सकता हूँ, और मरने के समय यह न खोजूं कि मैंने जीवन नहीं जिया। मैं वह जीवन नहीं जीना चाहता था जो जीवन नहीं था, जीवन इतना अनमोल है; न ही मैं त्याग का अभ्यास करना चाहता था, जब तक कि वह बिल्कुल आवश्यक न हो। मैं गहराई से जीना चाहता था और जीवन के हर रस को निचोड़ना चाहता था।

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the philosophical meaning and core ideas effectively, with accurate rendering of Thoreau's existential concerns. However, some poetic nuance is lost—'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'निचोड़ना' (squeeze/extract) which is less evocative than the original's visceral imagery, and the rhythmic parallelism of the English prose is somewhat diminished in the Hindi version.

results.translated_text: मुझे इशमाएल पुकारा जा सकता है। कुछ साल पहले—कितना समय, यह कोई बात नहीं—मेरी जेब में पैसे कम या न के बराबर थे, और तट पर मेरे लिए कोई विशेष रुचि नहीं थी, इसलिए मैंने सोचा कि मैं थोड़ा यात्रा करूँगा और संसार के जलीय भाग को देखूँगा। यह मेरी निराशा दूर करने और रक्त संचार को नियंत्रित करने का एक तरीका है। जब भी मेरे मुँह पर उदासी छाने लगती है; जब मेरी आत्मा में एक नम, बरसाती नवंबर जैसा माहौल बन जाता है, तब मैं इसे समुद्री यात्रा पर जल्द से जल्द जाने का उचित समय मानता हूँ।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately but loses some of Melville's archaic formality and poetic compression. Phrases like 'driving off the spleen' become more literal ('निराशा दूर करने'), and the metaphorical weight of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' is diluted by the explanatory 'जैसा माहौल' addition, making it less evocative than the original's introspective melancholy.

results.translated_text: এটা সর্বজনবিদিত সত্য যে, একজন ধনী অবিবাহিত পুরুষকে অবশ্যই বিবাহিতা হতে হবে। তিনি কোনো নতুন এলাকায় প্রবেশ করার সময় কেমন অনুভব করেন বা কী ভাবেন, তা খুব কমই জানা যায়, কিন্তু এই সত্যটি আশেপাশের পরিবারের মন্ডলে এতটাই বদ্ধমূল যে, তাঁকে তাদের কন্যাদের মধ্যে একজনের সম্পত্তি হিসেবে গণ্য করা হয়।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise but loses some nuance in phrasing and tone. The Bengali reads somewhat awkwardly in places (e.g., 'বিবাহিতা হতে হবে' is grammatically odd; 'সম্পত্তি' is slightly harsh compared to 'property'), and the elegant irony of Austen's opening is diluted by more literal, less flowing prose.

results.translated_text: স্টুডিওটি গোলাপের গাঢ় সুবাসে পরিপূর্ণ ছিল, আর যখন হালকা গ্রীষ্মের বাতাস বাগানের গাছপালার মধ্যে দিয়ে বয়, তখন খোলা দরজার মাধ্যমে মনে হত যেন জবা ফুলের তীব্র গন্ধ অথবা গোলাপি ফুলওয়ালা কাঁটার আরও হালকা সুবাস ভেসে আসছে। পার্সিয়ান স্যাডল-ব্যাগ দিয়ে তৈরি ডিভানের কোণে শুয়ে, যেভাবে তিনি সাধারণত করতেন, অসংখ্য সিগারেট सुलকাচ্ছিলেন, লর্ড হেনরি Вотটন তখন ল্যাবারনাম গাছের মধু-মিষ্টি ও মধু-বর্ণের ফুলের ঝিলিক দেখতে পেতেন।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant issues: incorrect flower identifications (জবা for lilac is botanically wrong), a non-Bengali word (सुलকাচ্ছিলেন appears corrupted), and Cyrillic characters (Вотттон) that break readability. The sensory richness and aesthetic precision of Wilde's prose are diminished, and the flow is awkward in places.

results.translated_text: "দেখে মনে হচ্ছে, আপনি আফগানিস্তানে ছিলেন।" আমি বিস্ময়ে জিজ্ঞেস করলাম, "আপনি এটা কী করে বুঝলেন?" তিনি মুচকি হেসে বললেন, "সেটা unimportant." "এখন প্রশ্ন হলো হিমোগ্লোবিনের," তিনি বললেন। "আমার এই আবিষ্কারের তাৎপর্য আপনি নিশ্চয়ই বুঝতে পারছেন?" আমি উত্তর দিলাম, "এটা নিঃসন্দেহে রাসায়নিকভাবে বেশ интересное, কিন্তু ব্যবহারিক দিক থেকে—" "বুঝতে পারছেন না, লোক? এটা বছরের পর বছর ধরে করা সেরা medico-legal আবিষ্কার। আপনি বুঝতে পারছেন না এটা আমাদের রক্তের দাগের জন্য একটি अचूक পরীক্ষা দিতে পারে?"

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant issues: multiple untranslated English words (unimportant, интересное, medico-legal, अचूक) break fluency and suggest incomplete work, key phrases are mistranslated or awkwardly phrased ("সেটা unimportant" instead of proper Bengali), and the dialogue structure becomes confusing with attribution errors. The style and tone of Holmes's intellectual confidence are lost.

results.translated_text: আমি অরণ্যে গিয়েছিলাম কারণ আমি ইচ্ছাকৃতভাবে বাঁচতে চেয়েছিলাম, জীবনের মূল সত্যগুলির মুখোমুখি হতে এবং দেখতে চেয়েছিলাম যে আমি তা থেকে কী শিখতে পারি, এবং মৃত্যুর সময় আবিষ্কার করতে না চাই যে আমি জীবনযাপন করিনি। আমি এমন কিছু বাঁচতে চাইনি যা জীবন নয়, জীবন এত মূল্যবান; এবং আমি আত্মসমর্পণ করতে চাইনি, যতক্ষণ না তা একেবারে প্রয়োজনীয় ছিল। আমি গভীর ভাবে বাঁচতে চেয়েছিলাম এবং জীবনের সমস্ত সারEssence শুষে নিতে চেয়েছিলাম।

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential concerns, though the phrase 'সারEssence' (mixing Bengali with English) is a notable error that disrupts fluency. The philosophical tone is largely preserved, but some sentences feel slightly stiff compared to the original's rhythmic intensity.

results.translated_text: আমায় ইশমেইল নামে ডাকো। কয়েক বছর আগে—ঠিক কত দিন, তা unimportant—আমার থলি nearly খালি ছিল, আর পাড়ে আমার বিশেষ কিছু করার মতো ছিল না, তাই ভাবলাম একটু ঘুরে আসি আর পৃথিবীর জলভাগটা দেখি। এটা আমার spleen দূর করার এবং রক্ত চলাচল স্বাভাবিক রাখার একটা উপায়। যখন আমি দেখি আমার মুখ grim হয়ে আসছে; যখন আমার আত্মার মধ্যে একটা স্যাঁতস্যাঁতে, কুয়াশাচ্ছন্ন নভেম্বরের মতো অনুভূতি হয়, তখন আমি বুঝি দ্রুত সাগরে যাওয়াই বুদ্ধিমানের কাজ।

scores.feedback: The translation contains significant issues including untranslated English words (unimportant, spleen, grim) mixed into Bengali text, awkward phrasing that disrupts flow, and failure to capture Melville's philosophical tone and archaic literary style. While the basic meaning is partially preserved, the execution is severely compromised by these technical errors and stylistic mismatches.

results.translated_text: ஒரு நல்ல செல்வம் உடைய தனி மனிதர், நிச்சயமாகத் திருமணம் செய்து கொள்ள வேண்டியவராக இருக்க வேண்டும் என்பது உலகறிந்த உண்மை. அந்த மனிதரின் எண்ணங்கள் அல்லது கருத்துக்கள் அவர் ஒரு புதிய சுற்றுப்புறத்தில் நுழையும்போது எவ்வளவு குறைவாகவே அறியப்பட்டாலும், இந்த உண்மைச் செய்தி சுற்றியுள்ள குடும்பங்களின் மனதில் ஆழமாகப் பதிந்துள்ளது. அவரை அவர்களின் daughtersகளில் யாரோ ஒருவரின் உடைமையாகக் கருதுவது நியாயமானது.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but loses Austen's characteristic irony and satirical tone, particularly in the opening declaration. The phrase 'daughtersகளில்' contains an untranslated English word, breaking fluency, and the formal register doesn't match the original's subtle wit and social commentary.

results.translated_text: அறையெங்கும் ரோஜாக்களின் நறுமுகத் திரவியம் கமழ்ந்தது; கோடைக்கால மெல்லிய காற்று தோட்டத்திலுள்ள மரங்களிடையே வீசும்போது, திறந்திருக்கும் கதவுகள் வழியே ஜவ்வாதோட நறுமணம் அல்லது இளஞ்சிவப்பு மலர் முள்ளம்பழத்தின் மெல்லிய நறுச香り நுழைந்தது. பாரசீகச் saddle-bags கொண்ட divanத்தின் மூலையில், வழக்கம்போல் எண்ணற்ற சிகரெட்டுகளைப் புகைபிடித்துக் கொண்டிருந்த லார்ட் ஹென்றி வொட்டன், தேன் இனிமையான, தேன் நிறமுள்ள laburnum பூக்களின் பொலிவைப் பார்த்துக் கொண்டிருந்தார்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses aesthetic nuance through awkward phrasing, untranslated English words (saddle-bags, divan, laburnum), and a stiff construction that undermines Wilde's sensory elegance. The poetic flow of the original is significantly diminished.

results.translated_text: "நீ ஆப்கானிஸ்தானுக்குச் சென்றிருக்கிறாய் என்று எனக்குத் தெரிகிறது." நான் வியப்புடன் கேட்டேன், "பூமியிலுள்ள எந்த மனிதனும் அதை எப்படித் தெரிந்துகொண்டான்?" "பரவாயில்லை," என்று அவன் தனக்குள் சிரித்துக் கொண்டே சொன்னான். "இப்போது ஹேமோகுளோபினைப் பற்றிய கேள்வி எழுகிறது. என்னுடைய இந்த கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவத்தை நீங்கள் உணர்கிறீர்களா?" "இது நிச்சயமாக வேதியியல் ரீதியாக சுவாரஸ்யமாக இருக்கும்," நான் பதிலளித்தேன், "ஆனால் நடைமுறைக்கு..." "என்னய்யா, இது பல வருடங்களாக நடந்திருக்கும் மிக நடைமுறை மருத்துவ-சட்ட கண்டுபிடிப்புகளில் ஒன்று. இரத்தம் கறை படிந்திருக்கிறதா இல்லையா என்பதைத் தவறில்லாமல் அறிய இது நமக்கு ஒரு சோதனையை வழங்குகிறது என்று நீங்கள் பார்க்கவில்லையா?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure reasonably well, preserving the scientific discussion and character interaction. However, there are awkward phrasings ("பூமியிலுள்ள எந்த மனிதனும்" is overly literal), inconsistent formality levels (mixing formal and informal address), and some unnatural constructions that detract from readability and the Victorian-era tone of the original.

results.translated_text: நான் காடுகளுக்குச் சென்றதற்குக் காரணம், திட்டமிட்டு வாழவும், வாழ்க்கையின் இன்றியமையாத உண்மைகளை எதிர்கொள்ளவும், அது என்னிடம் சொல்ல வேண்டியதை நான் கற்றுக்கொள்ள முடியுமா என்று பார்க்கவும் விரும்பினேன்; நான் இறக்கும்போது, நான் வாழவில்லை என்று கண்டுபிடிக்க நான் விரும்பவில்லை. நான் உயிரற்ற வாழ்க்கையை வாழ விரும்பவில்லை; வாழ்க்கை மிகவும் விலைமதிப்பற்றது. மேலும், அது முற்றிலும் அவசியமாக இல்லாவிட்டால், நான் இசைந்து போவதை பயிற்சி செய்ய விரும்பவில்லை. நான் ஆழமாக வாழவும், வாழ்க்கையின் அனைத்து சாரத்தையும் உறிஞ்சவும் விரும்பினேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's philosophical meaning but loses some nuance in the paradoxical intensity of phrases like 'living is so dear' (rendered as 'விலைமதிப்பற்றது'/worthless, which inverts the intended meaning). The prose structure becomes fragmented and less flowing than the original's rhythmic eloquence, diminishing the meditative quality essential to Thoreau's style.

results.translated_text: என்னை இஷ்மாয়েল என்று அழையுங்கள். சில வருடங்களுக்கு முன்பு—அதற்கு எவ்வளவு காலம் என்று திட்டென்று சொல்லத் தேவையில்லை—என் பையில் அவ்வளவாகப் பணம் இல்லாமலும், கரையோரத்திலோ எனக்கு எதிலும் ஈடுபாடு இல்லாமலும் இருந்ததால், கொஞ்சம் பயணம் செய்து உலகின் நீர்நிலைப் பகுதிகளைப் பார்க்க நினைத்தேன். அது நான் மனச்சோர்வை விரட்டியடிக்கும், உடலின் இரத்த ஓட்டத்தைச் சீராக்கும் ஒரு வழி. என் வாய் கசப்பாக மாறத் தொடங்குகையில், என் ஆன்மாவில் ஒரு ஈரமான, தூறல் மழையின் நவம்பர் போன்ற சூழல் ஏற்படும் போதெல்லாம், நான் எவ்வளவு சீக்கிரம் முடியுமோ அவ்வளவு சீக்கிரம் கடலுக்குச் செல்ல வேண்டிய நேரம் வந்துவிட்டது என்று எண்ணிக்கொள்வேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, including the famous opening and the metaphorical language about melancholy, though some nuances like 'spleen' and 'circulation' feel slightly literalized rather than idiomatically rendered. The Tamil prose is understandable but reads somewhat stiffly, losing the flowing, meditative quality of Melville's archaic style.

results.translated_text: Известно всем, что одинокий мужчина, обладающий хорошим состоянием, непременно нуждается в жене. Как бы ни были мало известны его чувства и взгляды при первом появлении в новом районе, эта истина настолько глубоко укоренилась в сознании окружающих семей, что он считается законной добычей одной или другой из их дочерей.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone well, with 'законной добычей' (lawful prey) effectively conveying Austen's satirical edge. However, 'Известно всем' (known to all) slightly weakens the universal philosophical weight of 'universally acknowledged,' and 'район' (district) is less elegant than the original's neighborhood, affecting the period style.

results.translated_text: В мастерской царил насыщенный аромат роз, и когда легкий летний ветер колыхал деревья сада, через открытую дверь проникал густой запах сирени или более нежный аромат цветущей розовой боярышны. Из угла персидского дивана с накладками в виде седла, на котором он лежал, покуривая, как это было его привычкой, бесчисленное количество сигарет, лорд Генри Уоттон едва мог разглядеть блеск медовых, золотистых цветов лавра.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the sensory richness and aesthetic details of Wilde's prose, though some nuances are lost in the rendering of 'pink-flowering thorn' as 'розовой боярышны' and the somewhat awkward phrase 'накладками в виде седла' for 'saddle-bags.' The fluency is slightly compromised by occasional awkward constructions that, while understandable, don't flow as naturally as the original English.

results.translated_text: — Вы были в Афганистане, я полагаю? — спросил я, поражённый. — Откуда вы могли это узнать? — «Неважно», — усмехнулся он, бормоча что-то себе под нос. — «Вопрос сейчас о гемоглобине. Неужели вы не видите значения моего открытия?» — «Несомненно, это интересно с химической точки зрения, — ответил я, — но практически же…» — «Что ж, человек мой дорогой, это самое практичное судебно-медицинское открытие за последние годы. Разве вы не видите, что оно даёт нам безошибочный метод определения крови?»

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately but has some issues: the speaker attribution is confused (Watson asks 'How on earth' but the translation attributes this to the narrator), and 'безошибочный метод определения крови' slightly misses 'infallible test for blood stains.' The dialogue flows reasonably well in Russian but lacks some of Holmes's characteristic sharp wit and Victorian formality present in the original.

results.translated_text: Я отправился в лес, потому что хотел жить осознанно, сталкиваться лишь с главными, существенными аспектами жизни и узнать, чему она может меня научить, чтобы, когда я умру, не обнаружить, что не жил. Я не хотел проживать то, что не является жизнью, жизнь слишком дорога; и я не хотел практиковать покорность, если бы это не было абсолютно необходимо. Я хотел жить глубоко и вытянуть из жизни всю самую суть.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical meaning and core ideas effectively, with mostly faithful rendering of Thoreau's deliberate living philosophy. However, 'вытянуть' (pull out) is slightly less elegant than the original 'suck out,' and some phrases like 'практиковать покорность' feel slightly more formal/awkward than Thoreau's natural cadence, affecting overall fluency and stylistic authenticity.

results.translated_text: Зовите меня Ишмаэль. Несколько лет назад – не будем точными в датах – лишенный денег и не найдя ничего достойного внимания на берегу, я решил немного попутешествовать и увидеть водную часть мира. Это один из моих способов прогнать хандру и наладить кровообращение. Когда я начинаю хмуриться; когда в моей душе наступает сырой, моросящий ноябрь, я считаю, что пора как можно скорее выйти в море.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and philosophical tone well, with accurate rendering of key metaphors like 'spleen' as 'хандру' and the November imagery. However, some phrasing feels slightly stiff ('лишенный денег' is more formal than the original's casual tone), and the archaic literary voice could be more pronounced to fully match Melville's distinctive narrative style.

results.translated_text: Відомо всім, що неодружений чоловік, що володіє значним статком, неодмінно потребує дружини. Хоч які невідомі почуття чи погляди можуть бути в нього при першому переїзді до нового місця, ця істина так міцно вкорінена в свідомості навколишніх родин, що його вважають законним здобичем однієї чи іншої їхньої доньки.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the meaning and ironic tone well, though 'Відомо всім' (known to all) slightly weakens the universal authority of the original's opening. The phrase 'законним здобичем' (lawful prey) effectively conveys the satirical property metaphor, but some phrasing feels slightly more literal than Austen's elegant irony.

results.translated_text: Студія була наповнена насиченим ароматом троянд, і коли легкий літній вітер збентежив дерева в саду, крізь відчинені двері проносився густий запах лілій або ніжніший парфум рожевоцвітої акації. results.translated_text: "Ви були в Афганістані, я бачу." – "Звідки ви це дізналися?" – запитав я з подивом. "Не важливо," – відповів він, хихикаючи собі під ніс. "Питання зараз про гемоглобін. results.translated_text: Я пішов у ліс, бо прагнув жити навмисне, зустрітися лише з найважливішими істинами життя і з’ясувати, чи зможу я засвоїти уроки, які воно має, а не, на смертному ложі, виявити, що я не жив. results.translated_text: Звати мене Ішмаель. Це мій спосіб виганяти меланхолію та нормалізувати кровообіг. Коли я відчуваю, що мій рот стає похмурим; коли в моїй душі – похмурий, моросящий листопад, я вважаю за потрібне якомога швидше вийти в море.

results.translated_text: קראו לי אישמייל. לפני מספר שנים – לא משנה כמה בדיוק – כשלא הייתה לי כמעט כסף בארנקי, ושום דבר מיוחד שירתק אותי ביבשה, חשבתי שאצא לשוט קצת ואראה את החלק המימי של העולם. זו דרכי להבריח את הדכדוך ולסדיר את הדם. בכל פעם שאני מוצא את עצמי מתעצב פניי; בכל פעם שזה נובמבר גשום ומדכא בנשמתי, אני מחשיב זאת כזמן מתאים ככל האפשר לצאת לים.

Vous ne doutez pas de l’importance de cette découverte, n'est-ce pas ? » « Elle est intéressante sur le plan chimique, sans aucun doute, » répondis-je, « mais dans la pratique— » « Voyons, mon cher, c'est la découverte médico-légale la plus pratique depuis des années. Minor accuracy issues include the softening of 'I perceive' to 'je me permets de le constater' and slight tone shifts, but overall it successfully conveys Holmes's deductive confidence and Watson's astonishment.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je désirais vivre délibérément, affronter uniquement les faits essentiels de la vie et voir si je ne pouvais apprendre ce qu’elle avait à m’enseigner, afin de ne pas découvrir, au moment de mourir, que je n’avais pas vécu. Je ne voulais pas vivre une vie sans substance, car vivre est si précieux ; je ne voulais pas non plus me résigner, à moins que cela ne soit absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre intensément et extraire toute la moelle de la vie.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent with excellent accuracy. The French flows naturally and reads as genuine philosophical prose, though 'une vie sans substance' slightly softens the original's 'what was not life,' and 'vivre intensément' is somewhat more conventional than the vivid 'live deep' metaphor.

results.translated_text: Appelez-moi Ismaël. Il y a quelques années – peu importe la durée exacte – n’ayant presque plus d’argent en poche et rien de particulier pour me retenir sur terre, j’ai pensé que je pourrais voguer un peu et découvrir la partie liquide du monde. C’est une façon pour moi de chasser la mélancolie et de réguler ma circulation sanguine. Dès que je sens mes lèvres s’assombrir, dès qu’un novembre humide et pluvieux s’installe dans mon âme, je considère qu’il est grand temps de prendre la mer dès que possible.

The archaic, contemplative tone is somewhat diminished in the French version, which reads more modern and less introspective than Melville's original philosophical register.

results.translated_text: Mein Name ist Ismael. Vor einigen Jahren – wie lange genau, spielt keine Rolle – als mein Beutel kaum Münzen enthielt und mich an Land nichts Besonderes interessierte, beschloss ich, ein wenig die Weltmeere zu befahren und das wässrige Reich zu erkunden. Es ist eine Art, meine trübe Stimmung zu vertreiben und den Kreislauf anzuregen. Immer wenn ich merke, dass sich mein Mund zu einem finsteren Ausdruck verzerrt, wenn meine Seele einen feuchten, nieselnden November erlebt, halte ich es für höchste Zeit, aufs Meer zu fahren, so bald es möglich ist.

Several phrases feel awkwardly constructed for German (e.g., 'sich mein Mund zu einem finsteren Ausdruck verzerrt') rather than idiomatic, and the poetic melancholy of the original is somewhat flattened.

The prose flows naturally in Spanish with minor stylistic adjustments that are appropriate for the target language.

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del intenso aroma de las rosas, y cuando la suave brisa veraniega se agitaba entre los árboles del jardín, llegaba a través de la puerta abierta el pesado perfume de los lilas, o la fragancia más delicada del espino de flores rosadas. Desde la esquina del diván de alforjas persas en el que yacía, fumando, como era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, Lord Henry Wotton podía apenas vislumbrar el brillo de las flores color miel y dulces como la miel de un laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Wilde's sensory-rich aesthetic language with strong vocabulary choices like 'impregnado' and 'vislumbrar.' Minor issues include 'alforjas persas' (saddlebags) being slightly awkward phrasing, and 'color miel y dulces como la miel' being somewhat redundant compared to the original's elegant 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured,' but overall the lyrical, decadent tone is well maintained.

results.translated_text:
—Parece que ha estado en Afganistán —observó.
—¿Cómo diablos lo supo? —pregunté, asombrado.
—No importa —respondió, riendo entre dientes—. La cuestión ahora es el tema de la hemoglobina. ¿No duda de la importancia de este descubrimiento mío?
—Es interesante, sin duda, desde el punto de vista químico —respondí—, pero en la práctica…
—¡Bah, hombre, es el descubrimiento médico-legal más práctico de los últimos años! ¿No ve que nos proporciona una prueba infalible para detectar manchas de sangre?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with excellent handling of Holmes's deductive character and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include "sin duda" appearing twice in close proximity and "¡Bah, hombre!" being slightly more emphatic than the original's "Why, man," though this actually enhances the Victorian tone.

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir de forma deliberada, enfrentarme solo a los hechos esenciales de la vida y ver si podía aprender lo que tenía que enseñarme, y no, cuando llegara mi hora, descubrir que no había vivido. No quería vivir una vida que no fuera vida, pues vivir es tan precioso; ni tampoco resignarme, a menos que fuera estrictamente necesario. Quería vivir profundamente y extraer hasta la médula de la vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and intentionality with excellent fidelity, capturing the paradoxes and emphases of the original. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward constructions like 'enfrentarme solo a' and 'extraer hasta la médula' which, while accurate, lack the seamless naturalness of native Spanish prose.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ismael. Hace algunos años—no importa con exactitud cuánto tiempo—sin apenas dinero en mi bolsillo y sin nada en particular que me atrajera en tierra firme, pensé que sería buena idea navegar un poco y ver la parte acuática del mundo. Es una forma que tengo de ahuyentar la melancolía y regular la circulación. Siempre que siento que se me entristece el semblante; siempre que tengo un noviembre húmedo y lloviznoso en el alma, considero que es hora de zarpar lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, with mostly accurate renderings of key phrases like 'Llámame Ismael' and the metaphorical 'noviembre...en el alma.' However, some archaic nuance is lost—'driving off the spleen' becomes the more modern 'ahuyentar la melancolía,' and 'growing grim about the mouth' shifts to 'se me entristece el semblante,' slightly altering Melville's precise physical imagery. The Spanish reads naturally but occasionally

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che uno scapolo in possesso di una buona fortuna debba necessariamente cercare moglie. Per quanto poco si conoscano i sentimenti o le intenzioni di un tale uomo quando si stabilisce in un nuovo quartiere, questa verità è così radicata nella mente delle famiglie circostanti, che egli viene considerato come la legittima proprietà di una delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's ironic meaning and maintains the formal, elegant prose style of the original. Minor deviations include 'debba necessariamente cercare' (must necessarily seek) which slightly amplifies the original's subtlety, and 'quartiere' (neighborhood/district) is adequate though 'vicinato' might better capture the social intimacy Austen intended.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era permeato dal ricco profumo delle rose e, quando la leggera brezza estiva si agitava tra gli alberi del giardino, attraverso la porta aperta giungeva il profumo intenso dei lillà, o la fragranza più delicata del biancospino in fiore. Da un angolo del divano orientale costellato di cuscini, dove giaceva fumando innumerevoli sigarette come suo solito, Lord Henry Wotton poteva appena scorgere il luccichio dei fiori giallo miele e dorati di un laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the sensory richness and aesthetic detail of Wilde's prose effectively, with accurate rendering of botanical imagery and atmospheric description. Minor deviations include 'divano orientale costellato di cuscini' (which slightly alters the specific reference to Persian saddle-bags) and a slight loss of the poetic rhythm in the final clause, though the overall aesthetic sensibility remains well-maintained.

results.translated_text: "È stato in Afghanistan, deduco." "Come diavolo lo sa?" chiesi sbalordito. "Non importa," rispose lui, sogghignando tra sé. "La questione ora riguarda l'emoglobina. Senza dubbio lei comprende l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?" "È interessante, chimicamente parlando, non c'è dubbio," risposi, "ma in pratica—" "Ma, signore, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni. Non vede che ci fornisce una prova infallibile per le macchie di sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the dialogue's logical flow and character dynamics. Minor stylistic considerations: 'sogghignando tra sé' is slightly less idiomatic than 'ridacchiando tra sé', and the formal 'lei' register, while appropriate, slightly softens Holmes's characteristic directness compared to the original's more colloquial tone.

results.translated_text: Mi ritirai nei boschi perché desideravo vivere deliberatamente, affrontare soltanto i fatti essenziali della vita e vedere se non potevo imparare ciò che essa aveva da insegnare, e non, quando fosse giunto il momento di morire, scoprire di non aver vissuto. Non volevo vivere una vita che non fosse vita, perché vivere è così prezioso; né desideravo praticare la rassegnazione, a meno che non fosse strettamente necessario. Volevo vivere profondamente e assaporare fino al midollo ogni istante della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential concerns with only minor deviations. While generally fluent and natural in Italian, the final phrase 'assaporare fino al midollo ogni istante della vita' slightly softens the visceral intensity of 'suck out all the marrow of life,' and 'Mi ritirai' (I withdrew) is subtly different from the more active 'I went,' affecting the deliberate agency of Thoreau's original voice.

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ismaele. Alcuni anni fa – non importa precisamente quanti – non avendo quasi denaro in tasca e senza particolari interessi a terra, pensai di navigare un po’ e vedere la parte acquatica del mondo. È un modo che ho per scacciare la malinconia e regolare la circolazione sanguigna. Ogni volta che mi accorgo di diventare cupo e imbronciato; ogni volta che è un novembre umido e piovoso dentro di me, ritengo sia giunto il momento di mettermi in mare il più presto possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and philosophical tone of the original, though 'imbronciato' (pouting) is slightly weaker than the original's 'grim,' and 'parte acquatica' feels more clinical than 'watery part.' The archaic literary style is mostly maintained but lacks some of the original's rhythmic elegance and introspective melancholy.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida que um solteiro com uma boa fortuna deve, necessariamente, sentir falta de uma esposa. Por mais desconhecidas que sejam as opiniões e os sentimentos de um homem ao entrar pela primeira vez num determinado bairro, essa verdade está tão firmemente enraizada nas mentes das famílias vizinhas, que ele é considerado a propriedade legítima de uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's ironic meaning and maintains the formal, period-appropriate tone. Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'sentir falta de' (feel the lack of) versus the more idiomatic 'procurar' (seek), and 'determinado bairro' is less elegant than the original's 'neighbourhood.'

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava impregnado com o rico aroma de rosas, e quando a leve brisa de verão agitava as árvores do jardim, o intenso perfume da lilás ou a fragrância mais delicada do espinheiro-rosado invadiam a porta aberta. Do canto do divã coberto com tapeçarias persas, onde repousava fumando, como era seu hábito, um número incontável de cigarros, Lord Henry Wotton podia vislumbrar o brilho das flores adocicadas e cor de mel de uma laburna.
